1.description: The place is right around the corner from my house so that's pretty convenient for me but the parking situation is frustrating because it's on Kedzie and it's constantly busy and you have to park on the street so it's hard to find parking. There is actually a parking lot in back but not a lot people know about that.It does have that nice family owned feel, but with that comes 2 not very good things:1.) The selection is pretty bad because it's just not a big chain store.2.) They were struggling financially so they converted literally half of the store into porn, which can be good or bad depending on your motives.Recently they made it so you can have your movies for something like three days, which is nice because back in the day it used to be that you could only have it overnight, so this is much easier. No pressure to watch it that day.They take fairly good care of the DVDs. Out of the literally hundreds of times I've rented something, I've only gotten one or two DVDs that were beyond repair and they just let me trade it in for a different movie. It was alright for me because I only have to walk but that could be frustrating for people who live far away.The people who work there are very nice (my best friend actually just started working there) and they have an "employees picks" section which, if you know the person has good taste, can be great if you just want to rent a movie but don't know what to get.Three stars.

0.description: I went there for video transfer.,, it took them 2 weeks as quoted and was no more expensive then quoted.  excellent job... They offer more services... video repair, rental and others... Bravo!

3.description: My guess - George H. works/worked there.Wendy's Corp should close this one down - have complained to district mgr before, but zero change in the quality of service at this Alsip location.  The consistently get orders wrong, poor customer interaction.  If you really want Wendy's - go south on Cicero to the Midlothian location, they have better food/service which is more consistent with what I expect from Wendy's.I usually go to the Midlothian location, but due to time of night & bad weather, I went to this one, and as expected, the order was wrong.  I have learned to stay parked at the window until I can verify that it is correct.   They did give me the rest of my order, but zero acknowledgement, no "sorry", "thank you", "have a good night" etc. that you usually get at a fast food drive thru.  IMHO - they are so used to having to fix orders, that they do so on 'autopilot'.As I said, I've gone the route of complaining via the Wendy's website, but even after speaking with the district mgr (Mark Gee at the time), I haven't seen the slightest improvement.  As a result,  I only hit this location as a necessary evil since it's the closest fast food place to my home.

1.description: Pretty sure none of these employees graduated kindergarten. How one place can manage to mess up an order of chicken nuggets so many times blows my mind.

2.description: This is THE most ghetto wendys I've ever been to in my life. Seriously, is it that hard to push a button to turn off ur mic so everyone in the drive thru doesn't have to hear about what "trick" Treyvon was "on" last night. And you're trip to club o with that "fine ass mo fo" you took last night. Sure hope you've showered before handling my food. On second thought, i think I'll just give this to the homeless man outside the airport and eat there lol unless you want a Maury show experience, I'd stay away from here

0.description: It's what you spect from your neighborhood  Wendy's as far as the food but, the service and cleanliness is great.

58.description: Awesome.... how nice is it to have a truly neighborhood resident running a non franchised neighborhood upscale cafe.... koudos and a definite plus for our Mt Greenwood!

56.description: Really delicious, enjoyed the heck out of the turkey burger.  Kids loved the food too, and it was healthy!  Yay for Maries, keep up the good work!!!

29.description: I had the buffalo chicken wrap and potatoes salad. I liked both! Not a big serving which is what I need! Lol I ate all of it and didn't over stuff myself! Good customer service and whoever made or food... Well that gentleman has a fabulous voice and should be on broadway!

42.description: Local favorite that never disappoints.  Fresh delicious food that is very affordable.  The staff is always very friendly and I am always very sincerely thanked for my business.  Grab a friend and split a burger or sandwich with fries.  You won't be disappointed.  Lastly, they do have wifi, you just need to ask for the password because they change it often.

23.description: Very very delicious food. This was my very first visit. The staff was very attentive. The food was reasonably priced and well portioned. I had the Marie's house club with French fries and the soup of the day which was White Cheddar Poblano which was to die for! My fiancé had the JuicyLucy burger which was divine. I meant to take a picture of my food but I just couldn't wait to eat it. I also got the double chocolate brownie. It was huge and delicious. I'd been waiting for a good brownie. Def a repeat when the fiancé comes back home!

47.description: Looks like there's a ton of self produced "reviews" here. Shame because I'd rely much more readily in a realistically quick "good food" prop than a page long dissertation....Happy customers are usually brief. Unhappy customers tend towards greater detail. Like this:Stopped in on a 12 degree day with my daughter. The previous tenant had failed and, being a supporter of local business, we decided to try the new place out. It was like one of those hidden camera shows. It looked like a regular cafe. Tables, menu's, staff, but it was set up like a take out place. They have a long, cluttered counter that reminded me of  and "order here" "pick-up here" kind of setup without any signs. The few patrons seemed happy enough but it seemed ...sterile, didn't even have an aroma of something cooking.  Not one word of welcome from the staff as we eventually decided to take a table. 10 minutes later we're still sitting there....waitress making table stops doesn't even look our way. So we figure we order at the counter.....stand there for 5 minutes, nothing.....a couple of sideways glances from the half dozen folks wandering around behind the counter trying to look busy but still not even a "welcome to Marie's" much less a smile. All the trouble of dressing the place up and not a clue. But at least the pie's always good at Baker's Square right down the road. ...half-assed apathy as a business model...shame.

8.description: Delicious food! Had the turkey club, very good, all ingredients on the sandwich was perfect!! Potato salad, very good!! Cream of chicken with rice delicious!!!! Had a bite of the angus burger, very good! It's a real handmade burger, nothing frozen. Very good!! All around great! Can't wait to try other menu items. Staff was very kind, gave suggestions and did not disappoint!

31.description: Let them eat cake!.....or burgers, salads, and paninis.Marie's surely has something to satisfy most any appetite.  I enjoy this little sandwich shop so very much.  It's perfect for a snack or a juicy burger with yummy  toppings. Hellooooo Pretzel Roll and fried egg with cheese!  A cup of tomato bisque or their turkey club always hits the spot.  Love that they feature cut-up,  fresh fruit each day and offer tasty coleslaw, potato/pasta salad as a side rather than just fries. Their teas (both hot and chilled) are delightful, with my favorite being the cool Hibiscus. Solid food from kind folks that's made to order; a nice alternative when you want to break from the chains.  Wonderful to see them employing local teens. Discounts available for Police, Fire, and Military personnel. After a meal, grab a menu (they deliver) and a giant, soft cookie to take home or dive into a bit of moist, generously-sliced cake when your tooth is running sweet.  You can always cross the street and walk the calories off at  'Mt. Greenwood Park"...well...err...the first bite's worth anyway. Every bit helps! Some unaccompanied youngsters can get a bit silly in here now and again, but the smart ones are afraid of me so I'm sure to make eye contact and give a disapproving glare. My back-up method may or may not involve ice cubes... and a keen aim for the torso.   I kid...I kid.. *darts eyes* *The infamous phrase, "Let them eat cake.",  was first  documented in French Literature entitled "Confessions" ...written while Marie-Antoinette was still just a child. It was attributed to an anonymous Princess. The line has been forever linked to Marie in error. The more you know.....*tosses you a star*  ;)

34.description: Just remarkable!  Friendly staff, AMAZING food, fresh ingredients!  The food is made with love.  They have gluten free options too!  The fries are better than Mcdonald's.  The turkey burgers, paninis, and potato salad are orgasmic.  A hidden gem on the south side!  LOVE IT!

16.description: Well this used to be a nice small family-owned cafe where the sandwiches were crafted nicely, the sides were fresh, the drinks were just plain amazing, and the staff was pleasant. But now, the food is beyond bland (I ordered a Caesar chicken wrap and the only thing edible was the tortilla shell, barely and the fries tasted like a generic frozen bag from Costco heated up in a microwave). I usually ordered the pomegranate tea, now it tastes like someone took every koolaid juice box and poured it into a glass- not good at all. Lastly, the staff...just awful, they are unpleasant and tired. It's mostly young high school/college kids who work behind the counter- I seriously think they need a lesson on customer service and how to be polite. After ordering a meal, the cashier kept rolling her eyes, gave me the wrong change back, and when I told her to have a nice day she completely ignored me and rolled her eyes again. Either go back to school and find a more fitting job or get new contacts and stop rolling those eyes. The only nice worker there is the oldest man with glasses, he comes up to your table and says thank you for coming in, even the owner is too busy chitchatting with her friends at a booth. Bottom line- although this place is literally next door to my home, I won't be back.

13.description: After driving past this place countless times we finally tried it, and wow! We have only tried the burgers so far, but when you find a good burger it's hard to not order that. We did try the fried pickles,  which I have never had before, and I loved them.  I hope to make it past the burgers, and try something else,  but we'll see.

11.description: Maries has great food and great service! I've never had a bad meal from here and I get the takeout often. The one time they gave me the wrong order, they sent a driver out to deliver the correct order to me. That's a rare kind of dedication, and we're lucky to have a place like Maries in town.

39.description: My boyfriend and I went here because we were hungry and wanted soup. Boy are we glad we did!!! The gourmet grilled cheese is AMAZING. Words cannot express how great that sandwich was, minus the tomatoes. The service was awesome, super friendly owners! We loved it. The soup was OK nothing special, but non the less it was eatable. Go to Marie's, support small businesses!!!

37.description: I was surprised how much I liked this place, I got a lot of food for a reasonable price, I had the ham sandwich with mac and cheese, fries and tomato soup, they don't skimp on the portions and it was all very tasty, I really need to go back at some point

0.description: Always love coming back here. Beautiful fresh ingredients in everything and the poblano cheddar soup is AhMAZING! Love the atmosphere and, as always, great tunes.My family orders out from here a couple times a week, a great option for folks who need good, delicious nutritious food delivered at home. I love the care that is always taken in making sure everything arrives ready to serve. Great asset to the neighborhood !

38.description: I have been there a few times. It is good nothing to expensive. I like the cubano and fries are good. People who work there are nice. Just simple place with average food. Good place to stop in and check out id say.Get a burger they are amazing!

51.description: What a really pleasant surprise!!! I was searching for something to eat tonight (and not the usual suspects, pizza, burgers, italian) and I remembered I really wanted to try this place. I got a turkey club, fries, and a cookie. The french fries are seasoned and are delicious AND I got a ton!! The pesto mayo on my sandwich was yummy. My only regret, the place was empty!! People in our community need to support our local stores/places more. Come here!! Great food and a wonderful atmosphere!

27.description: Went yesterday and the food was great I had the farmhouse burger and sweet potato tots. The food was great. I only wish I had more tots I think I was being extremely greedy the bag of tots went so fast. One minute the tots were there the next minute they were gone.

32.description: Maybe other people have had a good gluten free experience here but I did not.  I watched the staff (open kitchen) cross contaminate my food, handle my food with out gloves, and use the same prep area as gluten containing items. Dont list gluten free if you dont do it.  Also making food with out gloves is a huge issue for me.  All other staff were wearing gloves but the person making my meal.  Really unhappy with the service and the experience.

54.description: Great food and great people. Came in looking for sub type sandwiches, they have their specialty sandwiches (which are fantastic) but they didn't have specifically what I was looking for. The workers asked what I was looking for and accommodated me even though it wasn't on the menu. The employees at Marie's are some of the most pleasant and helpful people I've encountered at any business I've ever been to!!!

48.description: Two recent lunches at Marie's make me wish I lived a little closer. An excellent place to stop in, relax, and try some amazing food. The menu is consistently packed with daily specials, and cafe staples. Soup, salad, sandwiches, you can't go wrong. Signature and do-it-yourself burgers look mouth-watering; unfortunate for my vegetarian diet. That being said, they have something for every taste; even the pickiest eaters will find something to their delight. Cooked fresh, made to order, everything we've tried so far has been superb. Roasted Veggie Salad and Mediterranean Veggie Wraps have been excellent; both fresh and packed with all the veg your heart could possibly desire. Married with goat cheese and kalamata olives, the Med Wrap was definitely a crowd pleaser.  It's easy to see why Marie's gets such high marks...they really know what they're doing. Prices are fair, staff is friendly, decent location, and comfortable atmosphere and decor. Definitely worth stopping in for lunch; no question we'll be back.

44.description: I had driven past Marie's a number of times and thought I'd try it.  The menu looked good and I chose a salad with cashews, roasted chicken, wontons and ginger dressing for take-out.  I was initially impressed as they made it fresh however, the person making the salad was using her ungloved hands, which I believe is a health code violation.  The salad and a Coke were expensive, almost $12.  When I got to work and opened everything there was hardly any lettuce and what was there was the yellow, inner portion of lettuce.  The dressing was slimy but tasted okay.  The chicken was more like sliced lunchmeat and the wonton strips and cashews were more like bits.  I would've sent it back if I ate in the cafe' and I have only done that once or twice in my life.  From here on out I'll continue driving by, probably to Leona's where I could get an incredible salad for a few more dollars.

24.description: Time to skip your those chain shops and go to Marie's.  The food is fresh and custom made to order.  The owners are there at least 99% of the time and always genuinely thank everyone that comes in.  If you love a good burger, try Marie's.  I can't even pick a favorite, they are all so good.  Their side options are awesome as well, especially the seasoned fries.  Bottom line, support this local business and you won't be disappointed.  You'll be treated like a valued customer from the moment you walk in the door and the food will keep you coming back for more.

7.description: This place has gone downhill. Most of the light bulbs are burnt out, scratches all over the walls, dirty carpet, soggy lemons. My wrap was all romaine lettuce (~80%) with minimal amounts other toppings and my fruit was old and soggy. I would have never served it to a customer. All that accompanied with the unjustifiably high prices ($5 for a small CUP of regular ol' chicken noodle? Come on!) means I won't be back. I have come here at least 10 times now ordering different menu items each time and I can honestly say I have not been impressed by any of them. All have been average at the very best. At least the owners seem like nice people, hence the one star.

49.description: I have nothing but good things to say about Marie's catering. I used them Christmas Eve 2012 for the first time, after having used another popular local eatery and catering service for years to feed my very large family of over 30 people. The food was delicious, the portions were generous and delivery after noon on Christmas Eve was not a problem.....in fact Marie's worked with me to make sure my food came at the last possible minute so I wouldn't have to worry about keeping it warm for 5 hours!  AND the delivery person was helpful, and offered me assistance to put things away! Oh and Marie's also provides serving spoons and tongs, something no other caterer in the Beverly neighborhood has ever done for me before......believe it or not this is a god-send to the harried hostess who does not have time to run around looking for large serving spoons and forks at the last minute!My party guests could not stop talking about the sausage and peppers and the stuffed shells.The seasoning was spot on, and if you wanted to make things a little "hotter" Marie's supplied an ample amount of peppers to satisfy everyone's spicy desires!  The Italian beef was tender and the rolls were fresh!  AND the salads (especially the roasted veggie salad) were terrific! The Caesar dressing was SO good. I have never had all of the salads eaten before.....but this time you could lick the bowls, nothing left! So, if you are searching for a new place to have your next party catered, try Marie's. Take it from a party throwing pro, they are the best I have ever had.....THE BEST!Thanks Marie's Cafe and Catering, you were a hit!

40.description: I found my new Friday lunch stop! Had a caprese sandwich with coleslaw and sweet potato tots. Everything was fresh and delish!!! My husband had the Philly with potato salad. Also, very yummy! Next time I'm going to try some soup. Also, they had a lovely assortment of baked goods. Looked yummy, but we did not try. Restaurant is very clean and staff was fast and courteous.

53.description: I've been past Marie's a million times since I've lived here for the last 7 months and finally decided to try it tonight. It was great! We were warmly greeted as we were looking up at the menu and were encouraged to sit down, relax and take our time looking at a hand held menu which was nice. I ordered a 1/2 cuban sandwich, butternut squash soup, potato salad and fresh lemonade. It was great! My husband ordered turkey club, loaded baked potato soup, french fries. His was great too and I couldn't keep my hands off the fresh cut fries that hand a seasoning with a lil kick to it. They are priced well, similar to Panera, but I'd rather support a mom n pop place. I did find out the only homemade soups are the chicken noodle and the chili. Despite that, our soups were delish so kudos to their supplier. It's nice to see young kids working that are nice, polite and helpful. We can't wait to go back!Two and a half years later, still going here and the food is still great!

30.description: My wife goes here often. Today's trip she checked the double burger order out in the car before leaving and patties were completely burnt so she had to go back in and have them redo the order, which they did graciously agree to do. I ordered the sesame ginger salad. Menu says it comes with cut cashews. I did not see one or taste one.. There may have been  a couple tablespoons of chicken  on this salad..Won Tons were about the only thing there was plenty of.  One step up from a garden salad  for $8.25.

46.description: I'm a big fan of this place. Love the sandwiches and the soups! It's fairly new in town and it's already one of the most popular places. I'm from Michigan and every time I'm in Chicago, I make it a point to stop here for breakfast/lunch. The owners and staff are always very attentive and quick to go the extra mile to make your experience great! The food is GREAT and fairly priced for Chicago. Highly recommend this great little spot. Enjoy!

1.description: I received an email for ten dollars off for groupon takeout and decided to see what I could use it for in my neighborhood. One of the options was for Marie's Cafe.. I had passed by this place daily and must've said a thousand times that I wanted to check it out, now was my chance.Upon looking at the menu, I knew I had to try their burgers. I decided to create a burger and added Gouda, mushrooms, bacon, and wasabi mayo.. Amongst lettuce, tomato.. Etc.. After taking my first bite, I was so upset. Upset that I had not come here years ago! It's so hard to find a good homemade burger and this place has nailed it. I was so impressed! Even the fries were amazing...I will be a customer as long as this place exists.. Keep up the great work, it's so hard to find restaurants with fresh ingredients! I can't wait to try the soup and sandwiches.

55.description: The food was amazing. Restaurant was very clean and the staff was awesome. I had the Farmhouse burger, my wife had the oven-roasted turkey club (on pretzel bun) and my son had the grilled cheese with apple slices and yogurt. We drove from Lockport and will definitely be back. They even offer discounts to active and veteran military. Plus there is a park across the street for our son to play after. We will be back soon

9.description: This place is pretty good. I have gone here a couple of times and gotten their sandwiches both times. They were pretty good and full of flavor. I got fries with both of my fries and both times they were a little brown which created a bitter flavor. My boyfriend got the pasta salad with his sandwhich and while the pasta salad was delicious it was pathetically small. I mean it was in a container you normally put a side of ketchup in. This is very, very disappointing. The service was very prompt and friendly. I have nothing bad to say about that. I may want to try some other stuff they have here, but I'm not itching to try it again.

26.description: I just LOVE this place! The burgers are awesome!  They have a farmhouse burger with a fried egg to top it and it's soooo good!  Their Lucy burger is really good, too. Pretzel buns are the best!  What makes this place, aside from the food, is the service and the owner on premise. The restaurant is clean and brightly lit. The owner is always there, so it's running smoothly. The folks working the counter are local, neighborhood people.  I just won't patronize places which hire people from outside the neighborhood.   The french fries, onion rings, and other appetizers are really good as well.  And oh!  Don't forget the soups and peogis! The soups are seasonal and they offer daily variety. The soup and sandwich, is a great combo. This place is nice.  AND the food is filling, too!  Children are welcomed and they have a nice menu selection for them.  I hear the desserts are awesome. I don't have a sweet tooth, so I wouldn't know. Items are not cheap, but they're well worth it. I don't eat here often, so it's affordable.  If you were to have a burger, fries, drink and dessert, it would run about $15. But I usually take out.  The price is the only issue I have with the place. Just a bit too much, however, it doesn't stop me from patronizing.

25.description: Still as good as it was a couple years ago. This time, I tried the oven-roasted chicken panini. Wow. I dream about sandwiches like this. VERY good food.

12.description: The food was fresh and delicious. What a nice place to eat. I enjoyed my meal and company. The price was right and did I mention that the food was FRESH!!

59.description: I've eaten @ Marie's on a couple of occasions and have been very pleased. The menu is extensive and the food is solid. I love the restaurant's decor and the atmosphere is warm and homely.  The service is prompt, professional and friendly. The lemonade is fresh squeezed and was fabulous. If you are in the mood for meat try one of their burgers. If you're trying to eat healthy then go for the chicken caesar salad. Try one of the cookies too! It was delicious.

21.description: Been here twice the burgers and fries are amazing. Salads are good , You can tell everything is fresh, Great service both times, will for sure be back

17.description: If you want super fresh food and a great atmosphere then this is the place.  I had the juicy Lucy cheeseburger with potato salad...  And they both get 5 stars!!! Support this local restaurant because it's the best in Mt Greenwood.

10.description: I've eaten there several times based upon recommendation and have never been disappointed - great service great food!Recommend for anybody to try...

5.description: Let them eat cake!.....or burgers, salads, and paninis.Marie's surely has something to satisfy most any appetite.  I enjoy this little sandwich shop so very much.  It's perfect for a snack or a juicy burger with yummy  toppings. Hellooooo Pretzel Roll and fried egg with cheese!  A cup of tomato bisque or their turkey club always hits the spot.  Love that they feature cut-up,  fresh fruit each day and offer tasty coleslaw, potato/pasta salad as a side rather than just fries. Their teas (both hot and chilled) are delightful, with my favorite being the cool Hibiscus. Solid food from kind folks that's made to order; a nice alternative when you want to break from the chains.  Wonderful to see them employing local teens. Discounts available for Police, Fire, and Military personnel. After a meal, grab a menu (they deliver) and a giant, soft cookie to take home or dive into a bit of moist, generously-sliced cake when your tooth is running sweet.  You can always cross the street and walk the calories off at  'Mt. Greenwood Park"...well...err...the first bite's worth anyway. Every bit helps! Some unaccompanied youngsters can get a bit silly in here now and again, but the smart ones are afraid of me so I'm sure to make eye contact and give a disapproving glare. My back-up method may or may not involve ice cubes... and a keen aim for the torso.   I kid...I kid.. *darts eyes* *The infamous phrase, "Let them eat cake.",  was first  documented in French Literature entitled "Confessions" ...written while Marie-Antoinette was still just a child. It was attributed to an anonymous Princess. The line has been forever linked to Marie in error. The more you know.....*tosses you a star*  ;)

3.description: Place is okay.  Great salads.  Kinda pricey.  Owners are a little impersonal  and never smile.

35.description: What a great neighborhood place. Good variety of fresh food. Lots of healthy choices for those watching what you eat and lots of choice for those who aren't. Soups,wraps, and lots of fresh baked goods. Great customer service. Friendly family owned business that is a clean, modern, fresh atmosphere that makes you want to go back and support.

19.description: Been here twice the burgers and fries are amazing. Salads are good , You can tell everything is fresh, Great service both times, will for sure be back

28.description: Good fried pickles, fried, and turkey burgers.  The owners are very welcoming and always aim to please.  Their desserts are overpriced, but the other dishes are a good value.

45.description: GREAT food and very nice staff.  Happy to see a great place go in this location.  Sweet potato tots are my favorite, as is the vege burger!  Lots of variety too.

33.description: The only problem I have with this place was that my table was a little unsteady,  barring that the food was phenomenal, the service was friendly, and I will definitely visit this place again...did I mention the food was phenomenal!

43.description: What a nice place!The soup of the day was quite delish, The staff was great and I will be back,

2.description: I order a double cheeseburgers, chili and fries for delivery. Despite what others have said overall it was really, really bad. The chili was nasty, way too much chili powder... Ewe. The burger taste burnt, the fries were okay. Maybe it was an off day, just ewe.. I would not recommend this

18.description: Marie's is definitely at the top of my list of favorite Mt. Greenwood restaurants. The sweet potato tater tots,  Juicy Lucy burger, and Reuben are fantastic. I've tried several menu items and have enjoyed everything so far! The wraps and salads are delicious,  too. The customer service is always good as well.

41.description: I have been going to Marie's for more than a year.  I am gluten free and they offer gluten free bread for their sandwiches.  I was initially impressed by the freshness of their food, now, not so much.  Tough bread, marginally fresh meat and veggies.  Even after I received a sandwich with black grit from the grill on it, I gave them another shot.  I don't eat out often because of my food "issues" and when I do I choose carefully where and what I will eat.  Consistency is a big deal for me.  I complained about the issues, but it hasn't gotten better so unfortunately I will have to go elsewhere.

52.description: Had the chicken soup,veggies were hard almost raw,had no proper containers to put soup in.Containers lid fell off soup spilled.Better places for soup like Georges on pulaski in alsip.

50.description: Since the last review I think I've worked through all their burgers and lots of others on the menu. Man, that Goomba Burger is good! Fried ham and salami with hot giardiniera on a burger? Why isn't everyone doing this. It's great! This burger tops my list, recently besting their Campfire Burger, an awesome over-the-top mix of burger, chili, and Fritos. Don't be bashful, try it!Good soup too, try the tomato garlic with a grilled cheese.Also, private lot in the back of the building if you can't find street parking.

4.description: This is a great place - especially across from the park. It has a Panera-like vibe, but it's nice it's a local business and not a chain. I've stopped by a handful of times and tried both the breakfast and lunch items. Most recently my wife and our 11 month old stopped by after some fun at the park. The prices are ok, the quality is very good (the side of fruit was a good portion and very fresh) and so is the customer service. We'll be back again. PS - The paninis are very good.

6.description: I had to come back to edit my 5 star review from years ago because of how bad this place has gotten. The owners seriously deserve to be put out of business for how horrible their customer service is. They are unprofessional and unnecessarily rude. Ran into the male owner at a local business and he was screaming at a female employee who was clearly trying to calm him down and I felt so bad. I will NEVER go back to such a terrible place.

22.description: Some of the best soup on the south side. Hold out for the pumpkin soup if you can, but another favorite is the oven roasted chicken panini. Definitely don't pass this place up. Also, they deliver!

15.description: It's always nice to support the local businesses especially Marie's Cafe. Staff is very friendly, big menu with lots of choices.   It's a better version of panera bread. Owner is Aways there, working hard  and so kind! Hope this place makes it.  A little pricey... But decent

57.description: I see all the great reviews and i really want that same experience.  I have tried the place twice and both times the food has been so bad i don't wanna finish.  Tried the chicken wrap and it was so dry i felt like i was eating jerky.  The sausage breakfast sandwich i ate half and then had to throw out i just couldn't force myself to finish.  The egg was so overcooked and the bread was so bland and dry.   Nice looking place but  wish the food was good.  Try adding flavor and not cooking everything on a griddle.

20.description: Had a good fresh chicken salad. Wifi worked for my mom but not on my computer! Caramel latte is delicious too!

36.description: My wife and I went here yesterday and we really enjoyed it.  It's a nice place inside.  I got the gourmet grilled cheese with fries and a cup of tomato bisque.  All very good.  My wife got a roasted chicken sandwich.  She like it.  They have a good selection of beverages (bottled and fountain).  A very nice place for the neighborhood.

14.description: Time to skip your those chain shops and go to Marie's.  The food is fresh and custom made to order.  The owners are there at least 99% of the time and always genuinely thank everyone that comes in.  If you love a good burger, try Marie's.  I can't even pick a favorite, they are all so good.  Their side options are awesome as well, especially the seasoned fries.  Bottom line, support this local business and you won't be disappointed.  You'll be treated like a valued customer from the moment you walk in the door and the food will keep you coming back for more.

3.description: I had been going to Cutrone (when it was called 'John's') during my high school years and always had great experiences. Then being a broke college kid, I would go to Super Cuts and hated the amount of time I took to describe what I wanted done (which was a very simple cut) to only have it botched. I finally made the decision to come back to Cutrone and spend the little extra money to have a great haircut every time. This place is the real deal.

1.description: Cutrone Barbershop is very clean, professional, and has an all around good atmosphere to it. Mike is my guy there and he's always done a great job cutting my hair. I've been to all the other places prior to finding Mike at Cutrone Barbershop and I have to say I would never go back to the other places I used to go to. Cutrone Barbershop is my place from now on and I don't see myself going anywhere else.

0.description: Awesome place and experience. Josh cut my hair and I couldn't be happier with the experience. I had gone to another shop I won't mention here and they butchered it, but Josh immediately diagnosed the problem and now I'm back on track. It's a little off the beaten path for me, but I found a new barber illness going to for a long time to come. They also carry an excellent array of products in a very clean, modernized shop that's been around more than 40 years. $23 bucks well spent.

2.description: The only place I like getting my haircut done at cause everybody is good to go too have not gotten a bad haircut from anybody there.John is the owner old man and Anthony is the son really nice guys.

5.description: This place has it all figured out.  You check yourself in on a touchscreen, choose your preferred barber, or first available, and have a seat.  Today, Monday, I didn't even have to take a seat.  They were ready for me.  Mike asked me what I wanted, I told him, and we were ready to go.  He sat me down in comfortable barber chair, turned me toward the TV with ESPN turned on and got to work.  He verified what I wanted, and later double checked with me about the length, so I left with a perfect haircut.  There was no awkward attempt at conversation like most places, we talked for a little bit and I let him work.  If you try that at most places, they start fishing for conversation topics and pay more attention to conversing than your hair.  He did a great beard trim as well.  Why review a barbershop?  They deserve it.  How hard is it to get a basic haircut correct?  Not hard at all if you come here first.  I've been trying to get a basic short Caesar cut for what seems like years.  At the Hair Cuttery she said "I don't know what that is" and played on her phone until I found a picture in an 80's hairstyle book that looked similar.  She didn't get close to a Caesar or the picture I showed her.Great Clips was cheap, and the haircut looked like it.  Honestly, I probably could have done better with a mirror and my beard trimmer!I'm always willing to pay a little more to get better quality, which is why I'll be returning to Cutrone.

6.description: $24 for men's cut but honestly could have gotten it done just as well at a Great Clips. Asked for a high fade, 2 down to a 1 and to leave the top long. Instead got a 2 all around with a 1 at the very bottom. Showed her a picture and she said "you want it THAT short?" as if I didn't know what I wanted to do with my hair. Cut the top extremely short as if she didn't hear my requests at all. Nice place and nice staff, but if you're looking for a high-end cut worth $24 I would suggest looking elsewhere.

7.description: Still going there after many years. I Iive out in Orland Park now, but I still drive out to Mt Greenwood every month for this place. All the guys are great; personally, I recommend Mike and Antonio.

8.description: I just moved to Beverly area and was in need of a new hair place. First time I came in I was impressed. The place was clean and they have all the chairs facing the TV's. I personally like this as I am not a fan of small talk. In term of my haircuts the three times I went they were all above and beyond. I go to Izla and she knows what she is doing. The amount of time and detail she puts in cutting hair is exceptional. I would highly recommend this place to everyone I know. It's $21 for a men's haircut so a little more expensive but well worth the money in my opinion. Keep up the great work.

9.description: I came in after getting a really bad haircut at Hair Cuttery.  I knew I was in good hands at this place when I sat down and they said, "Wow, your last haircut was pretty bad, huh?"I had a fantastic haircut.  I didn't wait very long at all on Saturday afternoon.  Price was comparable to any other men's haircut prices.  They shaved my neck with warm shaving cream and a straight razor.  They took their time and did the job right.

10.description: way better than supercuts. they know what they're doing here.

4.description: First time getting a really haircut in 7 years Maria did a great job I am extremely happy with the service I received here great barber shop more modern then most barber shops great plac

3.description: Great flowers delivered at a very reasonable price.  I especially liked that I could give them minimal instructions and they interpret these into something nice.  Huge help on Mother's Day!

1.description: Just called there and spoke with an elderly lady. Was asking if I could have a wrist corsage made as a walk in. She was very rude as she explained it would be at least a 15 minute wait. I said no problem I live nearby and it was ok. She said in a very annoyed voice "um ok" and "I guess I'll see you then" and hung up! Well you lost my business and my son is getting married so you lost that too! Plenty of other places to go but hey my fault for trying local.

2.description: The Best. They always do exactly what I ask at a very reasonable price. Great service at great prices.

0.description: I used Hillside florist for my wedding and was incredibly pleased with their service. The cost was affordable and the  flowers were absolutely beautiful. They are extremely professional. I definitely recommend this florist and will use them again in the future.

4.description: Walked in to buy last minute bouquet of flowers for a retirement party. The ladies here were super nice and friendly. They put something together at a great price. Its an older place but let me tell you the service and quality is superb.

3.description: Worst customer service. The lady who answered the phone was rude. And then when I called her rude she got all ghetto on me. No one asked you to work a pharmacy maybe you should get a job that doesn't deal with the public.

1.description: I went to this CVS with my cousin because I was visiting her in Oak Lawn. We went for snacks and Tequila. I'm not into snacks but my cousin insisted so I found some. What I really liked is that the spirits aren't all locked in a case, only the semi top-shelf I guess.

2.description: This is by far the worst pharmacy I've ever gone to. If my work did not require me to go through CVS, I'd be back at Walgreens. I get multiple voicemail messages saying my prescriptions are ready but when I go to pick up, they don't see anything ready for me.  They always have to order the most common drugs, the staff is slow and could really care less.

5.description: I'm still waiting for my prescription to be filled, I dropped it off 4 hrs ago, unless they have to make this stuff by hand this is the worst I've ever had from everywhere. I even called to see if it was done, no still working on it was what I was told. I think I'll be going back to my old pharmacy.

6.description: By far this is the worst CVS store in the country. The cashiers are slow and very unfriendly. The pharmacy is even worse. They fill the wrong prescriptions or are late on filling them. For a nice neighborhood they hire only ghetto rats... Stay away from here

7.description: The staff at this pharmacy is so rude!  And to top it off, they filled my prescription incorrectly, and tried to tell me I made a mistake when I have been getting the same prescription for years.  The only reason they get two stars is because they are open 24 hours, which is convenient when I need to pick something up late.

8.description: This is based on cleanliness of the outside of the store and the service inside the store.  It is absolutely embarrassing how abysmal the service is here. Not once but twice I've been here in the last couple weeks and encountered similar garbage service.  The first time the two clerks talked the entire time, complaining about work and whatever other bs that they were blabbering about.  They did not even acknowledge our presence, greet us or give a salutation when we were leaving.  I work with severe behavior disordered students that have better social and customer service skills than this.  If these are college students from St. X which is a block away than apparently any idiot can get into that college.  I cannot comprehend that the managers of the store can't find workers that are better than this. Either you aren't trying too hard or you are hiring friends and family.  Bad move sir or madame because these people suck.  Now the outside of the store.  There must be upwards of 200 cigarette butts on the sidewalk.  I know I know it is the person whom smoked the cigarette to dispose of it properly.  However, with that said, we all understand how many smokers dispose of the butts by just tossing them wherever.  Someone from the store please go out and pick that garbage up.  Have some personal pride in the place you work.  Maybe you don't want to be a clerk at CVS all your life but it is your job now. Act like you deserve to be earning a paycheck.  1000's of people would love to earn a paycheck from CVS and cannot.  I will not patronize this store ever again. Crunch the numbers management.  You lose a few customers a day because of this, these few turn into a few hundred a year. You do the math.

0.description: Pros: opened 24 hours and organized.Cons: cashiers are very slow and unfriendly.

4.description: How do you spell ghetto? CVS.I have disliked this store since the day it opened. Nothing has changed since that time. The store is filthy. The employees are slow and ignorant. Expect a minimum of five to six people in line when you enter. The aisles are disorganized. Nothing is faced. My biggest complaint is that many items are under lock and key. Really? This store is not located in the ghetto so don't bring your ghetto features here!If you live in the area, take the time and drive to Walgreen's on 107th and Cicero Avenue. Don't reward this shithole with your business.

3.description: Ive always had great service at this BK. Even when I moved from Mt.greenwood but stopped by for some drive thru; Still the same. Good service, good people!

1.description: 12/6 ...Take out large fry with double whopper with cheese ...6 inch hair In the fries ..tossed it all out ..disgusting

2.description: Yeah, I know...... It's Burger King. It's a fast food joint. You shouldn't be expecting a whole lot, right? Well, I certainly don't - but I also DON'T expect cold food, screwed up orders, a dirty counter, dirty soda area and impolite service. Guess something is telling me to ditch fast food altogether!

5.description: For the record. This BK is wayy! Better than the BK on 127th & Kedzie, now that place gets an F-

6.description: What a pain in the ass this place is.  They screwed up my to go order and I had to drive back so they could fix it.  So next time, I checked my bag before I left.  Of course, it was wrong the second time.  I went back in, and there were about 5 people standing around waiting for their order, because apparently they're giving people in the drive thru the eat in orders, and vice versa.  They were also putting to go orders onto trays and rolling their eyes when people asked them to put it into a bag.  They made no apologies, nothing.  Just threw away the food I brought in and remade my food.  I've been here twice in the past month, and 100% of the time my order was messed up.  If you go here, check your order before leaving!

7.description: Employees are great but hamburgers have gone down hill. I used to love their bacon cheese burgers. Last time I ordered them, they were almost as small as a slider and it took me awhile to find the bacon.

8.description: I come here for the 2 Crispy Tacos. You should too. It's the closest thing I can get to replicate the Jack-in-the-Box taco ecstasy, Hard fried and delicious, these tacos are the best. Just watch out for the sausy sauce dripping out of the back end onto your shorts.Be careful. Though it's on the Value Menu, it clocks in at $1.39 instead of $1.00.

9.description: Ok, so it's a Burger King.  No surprise there.  The staff is always okay with special requests (isn't that what BK is all about?), but sometimes the wait at the drive through is a little ridiculous.  Not necessarily the fault of the staff (more likely the morons who go through the line then decide to change or add to their orders).

0.description: The best BK and best fast food burger joint you're going to find around this area. Food is fresh at all hours of the day and nite. Just remember, it's still a fast food restaurant. The food is what it is. It's just going to be fresher here.

4.description: I used to luv this place.  I live right down the block.  Bad service.  the drive through is the worst I have ever seen.  Stay away is all I can say.

28.description: Pop's has a good beef sandwich. The service was fast and the fries were excellent. I went for the larger beef sandwich and didnt finish it. You will not be disappointed with their beef.

1.description: Always a little pricey, but always good stuff. I love the beef sandwiches and the combos. It's one of those places that makes you jealous of people that can eat unhealthy and not gain wait. I can only go to Pop's a few times a year. But when I go I love it.

39.description: when I use to eat beef I went here. The food is good but it goes straight to your stomach to give you a roll. So if you eat here often use your gym membership.

9.description: This place has some of the most delicious beef on the entire South side, if not all of, Chicago!! 6 Inch beef sandwich with sweet and hot peppers and red sauce plus a giant sack of fries it the first thing you should try there! They load on the beef here and they stuff the bag of fries to maximum capacity!

29.description: This place is just the best joint in the neighborhood.Clean.Affordable.GREAT FOOD.Great staff.Parking.Never had a wrong order.Menu is big and yummy.Nice to sit there outside during the summer months.Only complaint is that I wish they had real hot giadineria peppers.Their beef sandwiches are just AWESOME. Their breaded mushrooms are good, too.

23.description: Have been going here for years. One of the best Italian beefs around, would put it up there with the finest beef joints throughout the city and suburbs. The homemade giardiniera is amazing as well, far superior to the standard giardiniera most places in the Chicago area carry that you can buy at a Jewel or Dominick's. I think they use thin slices of fresh jalapeno as one of the pieces in their mix. The fries are always crispy. The burgers aren't bad either.Every time I visit my family in this part of town I make it a point to stop by. Sometimes I even go out of my way to stop by. For the amount of money you spend and the quality and quantity of food you get, it is easily one of the best values throughout the Chicago land area.

5.description: Food good...it is a Small eat in restaurant.   Shouldn't have eat in without bathrooms available... dont know how the city allows this.  The food is great tho...just clean your hands and fo to bathroom before you get there.

31.description: Their Super Beef is fantastic. It's messy, which should be expected with a good Italian beef. Their giardenera is good, not too spicy, and mostly jalapeno slices. You know a place is good when the neighborhood police officers are always eating there.A+ food, and the service is fast.

25.description: "Really" fast and friendly service and always perfectly done Italian sausage or Beef sandwich's, never a disappointment!

12.description: The beef is great and they have a unique hot pepper mix that is awesome AAA+++

37.description: This is one of the best beef's I've tasted in the city.  The Giardiniera isn't traditional but is amazing.Best of all I've got to applaud the consistency of this place.  Been going since I was a kid probably 20 yrs ago and it has always been great.

21.description: Good food.  Great deal on twist cones.  Beware, this place is SLOW. even if you call ahead, you will be waiting for them to start cooking your order by the time you arrive.

16.description: Been a customer of Pop's on Kedzie for years--- can't think of one time they screwed up an order. Food is always hot and you can't go wrong with their hot dogs or Italian beefs.

17.description: quality spot for beef and sausage for the beverly mt greenwood area, the sausage beef combo is really good, if a bit messy, the fries are good too, only downside is the parking lot is really small and cramped and is a bit of a hassle so walk if you can, or park on the street

10.description: I used to eat there all the time, one time I ordered a meatball sandwich and got sick to my stomach. I thought that maybe it could have been something else ( because I didn't want to believe it could be Pops) so my daughter and I went there one evening and both of us ordered meatball sandwiches   Well we both got sick to our stomachs and I mean bad. So I hate to say I am afraid to go back

11.description: Pretty good food but honestly not the best Italian beef, the hot peppers were odd and the beef had a weird taste. Definitely not as good as Portillos.

26.description: Pop's is the only Italian beef that comes close to beating Portillo's, although I still think Portillo's is better, here's what I like about Pop's (and where I think it beats Portillo's):1.  Pop's is affordable ... two of as for basically what I alone order at Portillo's.2.  Pop's has HUGE portions ... they give you a giant sack of fries, and their beefs are the size that they're actually advertised.3.  Their cheese is better than Portillo's.All in all, I think think it's pretty great.  The only thing that Portillo's really beats Pop's on is the fact that they toast their bun a little, and I think the beef is a little better quality, but other than that, it's delicious.  I really wish there was one downtown instead of Mr.  Beef, or Al's.

27.description: Best beef on the south side!  I recommend the cheesy beef. My daughter who is not a meat fan loves the meatball sandwhiches and has to have the onion rings.  The fries are always crispy and fresh.  Fast service and consistantly good food.

35.description: Sitting outside of Pops eating a great roast beef sandwich watching the cars on Kedzie go by is a pleasure from my youth that I miss.  They're famous for the beef but everything on the menu is worth eating.  A true gem.

8.description: Been coming here for a while because of just how great everything is. The Italian Beef is a definite must for anyone who hasn't had it, it is my favorite here and will become yours for sure. The cheese fries are always a nice add on, as is a chocolate shake. Be aware, this isn't somewhere for one watching their weight, I mean you could eat here, but the temptation to indulge is just THAT great here.Great food, always has been, and likely always will be.

0.description: Omg.... my husband and I had their breaded steak sandwich yesterday. . Amazing!!! I was really surprised with everything they had to offer on the menu.  Next time I'm going to try their oreo ice cream shake bc we will definitely be back!

38.description: This is the best Italian Beef in the city. Thinly shaved, always fresh, never gristly. And full of deliciousness. I love the "gardinera" here too. I used quotes b/c it's not like regular gardinera... it's not pickled veggies, it's fresh thinly sliced celery & jalapenos & red pepper flakes marinated in olive oil. It's crunchy and perfect with a beef w/ gravy (or dipped). Also, the fries are great-- thin and always hot, but I always need more salt. And the hot dogs are yummy too.

20.description: you can always count on Pops for some  dependable, decent, good fast food for a fairly decent, but not great price.  service is pretty quick, not much room to eat on the premesis, and a poor skinny lot to park in, or the busy street.  A lot of sloppy looking mt. Greenwood Hillbilly types come in there looking unbathed and sometimes wearing their pajamas or beat up sweats.  Not a classy place at all.  Just grab a sandwich and GTFO.

19.description: you can always count on Pops for some  dependable, decent, good fast food for a fairly decent, but not great price.  service is pretty quick, not much room to eat on the premesis, and a poor skinny lot to park in, or the busy street.  A lot of sloppy looking mt. Greenwood Hillbilly types come in there looking unbathed and sometimes wearing their pajamas or beat up sweats.  Not a classy place at all.  Just grab a sandwich and GTFO.

33.description: I'm a big fan of pops.  I love their beef but wish they had real hot giadineria.   So I usually get the grilled chicken sandwich, which is without a doubt the best grilled chicken sandwich ever.   The amount of fries you get is ridiculous.  They recently made it so the daily specials are everyday specials, which is very nice.   Their burgers are great as well and the italian steak sandwich is yummy.   I have yet to get something from Pop's that wasn't extremely delicious.  Great local business to support!

2.description: I gave this place three stars for a couple of reasons...the staff was so awesome and my girlfriend loved the food.I on the other hand was not amazed by Italian Beef it didn't have much flavor and it made me want my Al's Beef on Taylor street that much more.The place was very clean and one of the cashiers kept me laughing,The seasoned fries although .50 more then the regular ones were very good and I wished I had more.If I do go back I will have to try something else besides the Italian Beef!Enjoy!

32.description: I am not a big meat eater but my husband loves it so we served this to about 40 people for a birthday party.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed it.  And the women I spoke with while placing the order  was just great!  SHe could not have been more helpful.

18.description: Been coming here for years and it gets better over time. Beef is wayyy better than portillos, the fries are delicious and they have a nice assortment of shakes. The pineapple shake can't be beat.

13.description: Love their beef, so juicy and tender. Their shakes are amazing with fresh fruits and thick ice cream. Super!

4.description: I just ordered grilled cheese. It was awful! The girl behind the counter explained theirs is different. They offered my money back. No, I am just tired and hungry. Food please. Well the second version was just as bad. Usually their food is good. Stay away the GRILLED CHEESE!Seriously, is it that hard to do? I can even do one better. I am a terrible cook.

24.description: this place is an MG staple on kedzie. great beef sandwiches and thin cut french fries. friendly, FAST service. in and out in no time flat pretty much every time, even when they are really busy.i hit this place as often as possible for a shake in the summertime as well. i think they have 50 or so different flavors, but, i stick with the blueberry...one wish, maybe a little more dining space to eat there, even though i'm in the neighborhood and home isn't far.

6.description: Amazing!  Only bad thing.  There isn't one in Houston. Best Beef sandwich. Decent price for size of meal. Fries are fresh. Really friendly staff. Definitely recommend for fresh made quick bite.

22.description: Pops beef was just okkk, meat tasty but Pops doesnt knows what DIP means! I was pretty disappointed after i unwrapped my beef and the thing was not dripping wet where bread was soaked..nothing worst then a dry beef!!

15.description: The service was freaky fast. I got the beef with extra hot peppers. The hot peppers are weird not like any giardenera peppers I've ever had but different. The beef was good but not better then portillos haven't had one better yet.

40.description: Fast food at its best. I recommend the super-beef, the largest italian beef sandwich you have ever seen. Kick it up even more and make it a supercombo. Add mozzarella chesse and a large chocolate shake and get the defibulator ready. Great hot dogs and burgers also!

7.description: I have been coming to Pops for many years. The food never disappoints and the staff is amazing. They are always helpful and friendly. I love the grilled chicken garden salad with their garlic dressing and my children love the chicken fingers, cheeseburgers and shakes. You cannot go wrong with a beef sandwich or pizza puff. The prices are right too.

36.description: This is the type of beef you crave. SO Delish!!! It's got a distinct Pop's beef taste and the hot peppers are a bright green and hot! Even though the fries kinda suck, there's a McDonald's right across the street if you prefer to get them from there.

30.description: I get the beef with hot giardinara and red sauce. Sometimes the super beef if i want leftovers haha. Thier giardinara is so tasty, its not like the stuff you can get at the store. They make thier own and its so fresh and crunchy. The jalepeno's and celery are sliced to perfection. Also they have really good fries and the italian chicken sandwich is not bad either if you don't have a taste for beef. The service is always friendly and the place always has people in it. I'm getting hungry for a beef writing this :)

3.description: Very good food . Great beef. The service beats McDonald's across the street. Not a lot of seating but I get my food to go. Friendly staff. A gem in the Mt.Greenwood neighborhood.

14.description: Very nice people providing excellent service for a great tasting affordable meal - I had the Beef&Cheddar - yummy!

28.description: The food here was pretty mediocre, just another burger joint when it comes to that if you ask me. I suppose there is some draw if you're looking for wild game (elk, ostrich, buffalo).But my main reason to give this place a whirl was the very long list of milkshakes. And Wojo's successfully delivered all my hopes and dreams with the White Chocolate Oreo shake. I need to come back to happily make my way through the entire list.

1.description: This place is great! Here's the straight up no BS review: the food is great, shakes are pretty awesome too. The service is mostly high school and college kids. I don't think I've ever seen anyone I've the age of 26 working behind the counter. So you get what you get when it comes to that but mostly really nice kids. The owners need to sink a little money into a new place or remodel. The 100 shakes they offer has a station big enough for barely one person to work but I always see 2 or more trying to make shakes. Then the decor is horrible. It's a small place with booth seating from 1961 when the average person was . . . A bit smaller. I like the fact they sponsor the local little league teams but if the photos are more than 5 years old remove them. (Like the ones from 1995) and where do I start on the creepy clowns hanging from umbrellas. .  Other than that I'll continue to go there because the food is good and my kids love the shakes.

39.description: I go here every time I visit my friends who live in Oak Lawn.  This place is great because (a) it reminds me of places we used to eat on the way home from the beach in Southern California when I was a kid, (b) it reminds me of places teenagers used to hang out in in the early 1980s, (c) it's got pictures of Little League teams whose members are probably in their thirties now, and (d) the shakes are really good.They even have decent veggie burgers, and I like the criss-cut fries.

9.description: Amazing burger! I had the 1/4 lb. cheeseburger with bacon and it was everything I could ever ask for. The bacon was crisp and crunchy, but not over cooked.  The fries were thick cut, salted but not overly so, and cooked perfectly. The only downside I found is the parking lot. There is only one way in and out and it's narrow for larger vehicles. If it wasn't so far from my house if be a regular.

29.description: I'd give this place 5 stars if there weren't an annoying abundance of teeny boppers in Letterman's jackets crowding this place to death. Awsome food, great shakes...even some flavor combos that...well just shouldn't be flavor combos. Been coming here for years, always had great service...expect to wait at least 10 min for your food..its a good thing, because they make your food fresh. Keep it up!

42.description: If you really enjoy milkshakes, then you probably know already know of the legendary Wojo's.This burger joint/greasy spoon on the southside serves over 60 flavors of shakes and malts---all of them awesome! Actually, I don't really know if they're ALL that great because I haven't tasted the 65+ flavors, but the few I've tried have really kicked it!They're kind of expensive (around $3.25), but they're HUGE and worth the investment for a taste of  any of the crazy flavors like watermelon, grasshopper, banana moon pie, raspberry fluff, chocolate peanut butter fluff, chocolate coconut, rum eggnog, turtle, the "Elvis Shake", and artesian...I have no idea what the f  that one is, but I'm sure it's rad.Wojo's food isn't half bad either. With a burger menu as large as their milkshake menu, you can be sure you'll find something to satisfy your craving. They pride themselves on buffalo, ostrich, and elk burgers. They're pretty good, but I'd stick to the regular burgers that are tender and greasy and taste like any awesome burger joint's burgers should taste.The only downside is that everything on the menu is kind of a la carte, except for a few select "combos". So if you're looking to buy a shake, burger, and fries, be prepared to spend anywhere from $8+.Someday I'll make it my passion to sample every milkshake flavor at Wojo's....and when I do, I'll be back up here with the verdict.

23.description: I have mixed feelings about this place.   I stopped in the first time a few weeks ago to try out the shakes, which everybody was raving about.   First up, the flavor of the month, Strawberry & Banana shake...   the shake was very good, you could taste the fresh banana and chunks of strawberry.  The flavors of both came thru nicely and were mixed into the creamy ice cream, to form a perfectly textured shake. Second visit..  I ordered the Pina Colada shake for the wifey..  now i was expecting a delicious shake along the lines of a virgin pina colada.  Sadly, what i received was not what i expected.   The girl who prepared my shake must have added the wrong combo of ingredients, is what I immediately thought when i tasted the shake.  It tasted like a plain vanilla shake!!   I immediately returned to the counter and advised the girl of the mistake I believed took place, but low and behold, the male working the counter said that she used the proper ingredient mix, but was polite and suggested they try again and add some more flavor..   well lucky me I thought..  we are going to get that delicous pina colada shake afterall...   I gotta say that the second time around was a tad better, but i cant say the same for my wife. She was sooo disappointed that the shake was still not flavorful enough.  I agreed with her opinion, but still was not ready to write this place off based on one subpar performance.  I do want to thank the staff for trying..  they were very nice and understanding. I will be back to try some more shakes.. gosh with over 60 shakes, there has to be some more gems to be had.  I also am itching to try their bison dogs, elk, turkey and buffalo burgers..

5.description: I used to go here when I was much fatter. Now that I am bench pressing 420 and flirting with a 36-inch waist, I don't see cause to come here much, but it's still pretty decent food. The burgers are not the best, but, as one other reviewer said, they will do in a pinch. The dogs are fantastic, but I tend to need four of them just to fight off the hunger crankiness. In other words, I'm still kind of hungry after four. (That is, I was; now that I have this awesome body, three hot dogs might fill me up. I really don't know. All I can say for certain is that I look guh-ood. Like, if I looked this good when Moses was around, God would've created an eleventh commandant**: "Dudes, don't be jealous of Tommy, and don't go wasting my time--sabbath or not--trying to be like him. It ain't never gonna happen.")Where Wojo's shines is in the shake and the ham and cheese department. Many establishments serve good shakes, but the shakes at Wojo's are memorably good. When I was twelve (and not yet fat), I went to Wojo's and consumed a strawberry shake that was so good that I could visualize the chemical reactions between the shake and my taste buds. It was like looking at a map of the Silver War, where next to the names of towns like Gettysburg or Chickamauga, the cartographer inserted an image of an explosive to indicate that a battle took place there. Well, while drinking down that damn shake, I could not help imagining my tongue splattered with little explosions. (That really did happen.) It was like there was an invasion, a war, going on in my mouth--except that this was a war for good, like Vietnam. I've never had a shake like since; in fact, taste invasions of my tongue have been few. Wojo's makes a good shake.Now, I know many people don't dig on swine, but if you want a ham and cheese, turn the damn frying pan off, fish the wrapper out of the garbage can and wrap the cheese back up in it, let your dog eat the ham, and head on over to Wojo's. You ain't gonna make it better than they do, so why bother? Far be it from me to discourage anyone (unless you work out and cannot put up 300 lbs.; if so, why bother working out at all? Why not just go skip some rope or double-dutch?), but it's best to know when you've been beaten.  The ham and cheese sandwiches at Wojo's are delicious. The place is heavy on the calories, of course, which is why, the last time I went (two weeks ago), I got my son, in the middle of a three basketball game-Saturday, a few dogs and nothing for myself.Finally, I like Donald M.'s review--particularly the part in which he says, "This place has been here forever. . . . Don't over look this mom and pop place.  Keep the character of America strong and screw the  big guys." He's right.** I am sure he meant to say "commandment."

31.description: You know - it's a really, really good thing that I chose to spend the majority of my money on other (ahem) addictions in high school because if I hadn't, I would've ended up as the half ton teen on that TLC show. All because of this place. Well, this and Burger King.My bestie used to give me rides to and from my public school since it was on the way to her catholic school, which happened to be directly across the street from Wojo's. If I could've afforded the grub on a daily basis, trust that I would be a heifer today. My favorite burger is the nacho cheese, pepper, and bacon jumbo burger with an order of garlic butter fries. Wash it all down with one of their signature shakes and you're in artery hardening heaven!The shakes? Oh man, the list is endless. I'm a fan of almost anything with 'fluff' in it, as well as the Elvis, and the rum eggnog - just so christmasy! The only drawback is if you come here around 3:00 on a weekday, you'll be bombarded by teenagers, bleh. Even still, totally worth the frustration. So go ahead, venture on out to the south burbs and have yourself a $15 lunch. And remember to bring me back some grub. I will gladly pay you on tuesday for a hamburger today :p

25.description: The workers here are very nice and personable. Almost any flavor shake you want or think of wojos has. I was here two days ago and got a Burger and fries and it was excellent. I just got the beef burger I don't need anything fancy...they offer several different types of meat

12.description: Have driven by and was curious of their menu. My brother and I decided to try it. 1 buffalo burger with Swiss and grilled onions,  med diet,  and fries for him.  1 1/4lb bacon burger With grilled onions tomato and cucumbers,  and a med diet for myself. Total bill 18.88. We got our order,  my brothers burger was a  small patty with the melted Swiss and grilled onions lost in a huge sesame seed bun. Fries were well,  fries. My bacon burger at least had additional toppings  but was flavorless also lost in a huge bun. The best part of the meal was the bacon. We were both extremely unimpressed and dissatisfied. For the amount of money we spent we could have enjoyed a fabulous double bacon cheeseburger from Portillos At least our curiosity was sated. Will not be returning again.

37.description: Despite an odd vibe of curt people and the creepy, grayish clowns hanging down from the ceiling (?), a menu with almost 100 different milkshake possibilities is a damn strong draw.Rum? Grasshopper? Marshmallow fluff and peanut butter? White chocolate? On and on and on.  Their shakes are not to be doubted.  And they have almost 30 different types of burgers, with many more combos you can create on your own.  Garlic fries are great and, surprisingly, I liked the cheese sauce a lot, something I usually hate. Prices, as noted, can be a bit pricey (Two fries and two shakes - $14) for what it is AND it's cash only.I'll definitely go back, but I'm getting mine to go -  All those pictures of kids are kind of creepy, too, like a million eyes are watching me and I can not stand clowns.

21.description: I can't believe I have never reviewed this place. I've been coming here for over 10 years. I rarely order shakes, but always get them here! It's a typical greasy burger/hot dog joint. I always go with a cheeseburger and strawberry-banana shake. They also have elk, ostrich, tukey and buffalo meat along with veggie items. I've never gone that route though. I'm guessing if they can cook my meal right everytime they can manage those items too. 60 different shakes on the menu!!! You have to try one of these. Service can be a bit confusing at times. Seating is available but space can be limited at peak times.

16.description: Love this place love the hamburgers and the shakes don't care if prices are up and miss it since moved to Texas I go there every chance I go visit friends and staff is great

17.description: This place is awful. Not only are they over priced, but they're slow, and the employees are rude. Being my first time, I asked what came on a cheeseburger and the woman taking my order almost choked because she actually had to tell me. Not only that but I was with two children who are indecisive which also seemed to piss her off. To top it all off, the burger I got was cold. When I asked them to cut it, some teenage slob touched my food with his BARE HANDS  and scraped all of my fries out of the basket. It should not be $21+ for two kids to eat a burger and fries. If you want quality food and are in the oak lawn area, go to Nicky's on 115th and Pulaski. Don't waste your time here.

10.description: To be honest I have never had their food, but I have experienced their shakes. They are the best, and they have a huge range of Shake flavors...

11.description: ***This is a review is on SERVICE ONLY***I stopped by here on my way home from work, because a friend told me this place was good, so I decided to check it out. I went in, looked over the menu and ordered a hot dog and fries. There were two other people there before me, that were there waiting on their food. Someone came in AFTER me, AFTER I took some time looking over the menu, ordered, and had already been sitting down waiting on my food that I ordered TO GO. The two people that were there before got their food before me of course, then when the person that came in AFTER me got their food BEFORE me, I was livid. I waited at least 20 minuets already, on a HOT DOG and FRIES!!?? REALLY??? I simply went up to the cashier and asked for my money back!! How ridiculous that I waited all that time, for food that was not even being prepared!!SERVICE: HORRIBLEFOOD: I don't know, the wait was TOO long!!I just want to shout out to the SLOW staff at Wojo's and the owners, that allow them to be so slow. My advice: BE PREPARED TO WAIT!!!

26.description: Wojos has been a favorite of mine since I was a child. Its got a small town burger feel. Staff is nice and food is good!

27.description: Shakes are good but the dogs are so sad

8.description: I can't believe I have never reviewed this place. I've been coming here for over 10 years. I rarely order shakes, but always get them here! It's a typical greasy burger/hot dog joint. I always go with a cheeseburger and strawberry-banana shake. They also have elk, ostrich, tukey and buffalo meat along with veggie items. I've never gone that route though. I'm guessing if they can cook my meal right everytime they can manage those items too. 60 different shakes on the menu!!! You have to try one of these. Service can be a bit confusing at times. Seating is available but space can be limited at peak times.

0.description: Not only does this place have great hot dogs, THE BEST MOST AAAAAMAZING shakes (the strawberry-banana-pineapple was delish), but great customer service. We stopped by there after coming from the airport and I had a cranky, hungry--excuse me--starving baby. The team there helped me as I was struggling to get a bottle ready and was just very catering. Just wonderful service and attitude!

38.description: I don't know what day the other people on this site went to Wojo's but I went this past weekend and it was not all that good as expected based on the other reviews. I've had better burgers, the milkshakes were really milky (personal opinion) and the waffle fries were hard! Also, I got some cheese for my fries and it was very buttery (yuck!) I believe they are over rated, their prices are extremely high for what you get as well. Portilios burgers are Waaayy better they got Wojo's FADED!

20.description: I've been driving past Wojo's for over 10 years and just ate there two weeks ago.  I bought their turkey and veggie burger there as well as their sweet potato fries.  Everything was delicious.  On my first experience, both the manager and I forgot my drinks and when I called back, I was told I'd be given a credit whenever I wanted to use it.  Well, two weeks later I went back and my credit was honored.  Very good customer service.  I even bought some of the frozen veggie burgers for home.  Yum!!!

19.description: This place looks like a basement from the 70's, but the food is so good! I always get a mushroom cheddar bison burger! Very greasy but very delicious! They have so many flavors of shakes! They can mix whatever flavors you like! The only thing I don't like about this place are the sad clowns hanging from the ceiling. It's a bit creepy.

33.description: A client of mine took me out to lunch here after a showing. She swears by it, and I can understand why. Tons of burgers, great waffle fries, and more milkshake flavors than you could invent in a week-long acid binge. Prices are good. I suspect because of the customization of the menu it might take awhile to get your food if they're busy.

2.description: This place is right across the street from Brother Rice High School. They get PLENTY of business from Brother Rice and Mother McAuley.The other day my son who is a good kid not a trouble maker went into Wojo's with his football player teammates and ordered food. While he waited for his food  to be prepared the manager asked all of the boys to leave. They were not being rowdy, just standing their looking at the menu talking.She said that if they wouldn't order they must leave. The other boys were still looking at the menu and said they had not decided yet. She told them if they didn't leave then she would call the police. The kids left and went back to Brother Rice and got one of the parents that were waiting for them which was a Cook County Sheriff.He went to Wojo's and asked what they did wrong and the woman said "Were a family-owned restaurant and don't want them sitting in here" They went back and fourth and finally my son said well if you won't let us sit here please refund my money. The woman refunded his money and my son said we won't come back. The manager replied "We don't care if you came back!" My son and his friends left and went to their competitor.VERY DISRESPECTFUL PLACE MY FAMILY WILL NOT BE BACK THERE ANYMORE. IF U ARE A PARENT CONSIDERING SENDING YOUR KID TO BROTHER RICE OR MOTHER MCAULEY DO NOT SPEND MONEY HERE!

34.description: While I've loved Wojo's for as long as I can remember, my most recent trip was not a good one. The fries were undercooked & the burger was cold. I'll chalk it up to a bad day & I'll go back again, but after a long hiatus it was a disappointing return.

32.description: The bannana split milkshake is the best shake ever! It has real chunks of bannana and strawberry and is nice and thin. The burgers are very good, nice and greasy and cooked right when you order. They do take a while but everything is made to order and they do hustle. The only problem i realy have is they have teenage workers with no real supervision and no training in sanitation.
