The last time i went i was appaled to see the cook trow raw hamburgers on the grill and then put my lettuce and tomato on my meal without ever even wiping her hands (let alone WASHING them). The girl that was doing the frys kept wiping the sweat of her head and then using that hand to help make [people's sandwiches. Overall a five star dive that loses a point because they may kill me one day.

18.description: Wojo's has been around since before I was born and I grew up eating here for years and over a decade later came back to eat again with my Mom who just got out of the hospital and a few friends either last year or earlier this year.The food is, and always has been, great.Wojo's offers dozens of different items on their menu, ranging from hot dogs, shrimp, burgers, dessert and beverages plus side orders, they are cooked well and taste great. They also offer exotic items such a buffalo burgers and ostrich burgers as well.  The place is clean, neat and is located in Chicago's very nice and pleasent Mt. Greenwood neighborhood and is also close to Brother Rice High School and Saint Xavier University. All in all, I highly recommend this place to everyone, I give them 5 out of 5 stars.Great childhood memories btw, thanks Mom, Love Bob :)

41.description: Any place that serves Seasoned waffle fries and 70 varieties of kick- ass shakes is awesome in my book. The prices are a bit steep, but in my opinion, didn't matter when i tasted how awesome the food was.  Every thing that is ordered is cooked fresh, and it makes a big difference.  I highly recommend the white chocolate strawberry shake.

13.description: Oh Wojo's your creepy wood paneled clown laden decor makes no sense, your wall to wall sun faded murals of little league teams just ads to the John Wayne Gacy vibe. Your service slow because you make things the same way since you opened all those years ago. So why put up with the creepy decor and slowness? Cause you have  been doing things  the same way since you opened. Your cheese sauce is to die for, you have burgers made from endangered species, bubble gum flavored shakes, and hot crispy waffle fries, you are the best place aside from Top Notch in the south side to get a burger and hand made shake. Don't ever change,

4.description: I have always heard that this place was a legendary fast food Mecca. I'm sad to say it was a total disappointment. Just a quick snapshot ordered onion rings for 2.19 and received 6 onion rings. That .36 per onion ring. The food wasn't good and way overpriced. Oh well.

24.description: Good clean food, made by people from the neighborhood. Dont misunderstand me this place will not be featured on any show on the food network, but it gets the job done.

6.description: This place was so good. They have like 70 different milkshakes and while I haven't tried them all I can tell you my favorite is the turtle one so far. Their hamburgers were pretty good, but they haven't different types of meat that I want to try as well like bison dogs and elk burgers. Definitely a place to check out.

22.description: This place looks like a basement from the 70's, but the food is so good! I always get a mushroom cheddar bison burger! Very greasy but very delicious! They have so many flavors of shakes! They can mix whatever flavors you like! The only thing I don't like about this place are the sad clowns hanging from the ceiling. It's a bit creepy.

15.description: Eat a cheese dog with fries and one of their 60 or so flavors of shakes. Fries are super amazing Don't have a grilled chicken sandwich. It's bad. This place's bathroom is behind  the kitchen, so it's awkward to ask/ go there. What's even more awkward is the multiple bold-typeface signings that say "don't flush tampons down toilet"

40.description: It's been thirty minutes and I still taste the gloriousness of the perfect elk burger I just scarfed down. Perfect? Well, I have never had an elk burger to begin with, so this one wins be default. Tender meat with a perfect pairing of peppered onions (ask for em) and a dabble of nacho cheese (again, ask). It's an orgasm in the mouth...actually....The prices are steep, then again, where else can you get an elk burger, or an ostrich burger on the southwest side.  As mentioned previously, there are over sixty...SIXTY...variations of their milkshakes. From an Amaretto to a Chocolate Cherry Cheesecake, or you can even ask for a customized milkshake, this place is undisputed Milkshake King. Fuck. Are. They. Great.Essentially this is seen as a greasy spoon but with my four times going, my burgers were excellent with NO grease droppings. None. using one napkin just to wipe the mouth is great.The decor of this place is homely with pictures of their sponsored baseball teams from 95 to now. Come around 3pm-5pm you'll get Brother Rice and Mother McCauley teenagers in here.

7.description: Delicious food, large variety of food and shakes! Love everything about this place and their garlic & butter fries are delicious. Definitely a place to go to if nearby.

36.description: I organized a boycott of this place when I was in sixth grade and have stood steadfast in my hatred as others have fallen by the wayside.  Remember the woman with the wooden tooth and the horribly mean guy with the mustache who used to work there?  Thank them for it.  Way to literally scream at a 12 year old for complaining about a burnt to a crisp cheeseburger.  I'm not bitter (even though it seems that way), but the story still stands.  Fuck Wojo's.Also, I'm most likely still on the wall with the pictures of little leaguers.  Go EPBC Broncos and Red Sox!  YEAH!

30.description: Not my top choice for burgers and stuff on the south side but it will do in a pinch.  Quality burgers (buffalo, elk, etc) and a good pizza puff.  My daughter doesn't like the chicken nuggets here (always a good test) but generally the food is good.  The shakes are the reason to come here.  Good ice cream and lots of flavor choices.  Lots.  Everything you can imagine.  We'll come here once in a while for a change of pace but I wouldn't call it a favorite place.

3.description: Great place!  They have 60 different shake flavors. They have unique meat options: elk, buffalo, ostrich, turkey, and veggie.This place has been here forever.  I've been comin here for over 20 years.  Don't over look this mom and pop place.  Keep the character of America strong and screw the  big guys.

14.description: Wojo's is a the stereotypical Chicago hotdog place.  It is kind of a hole in the wall with the exception that Wojo's had a huge selection of shakes!Seriously, I love a shake as much if not more than the next person.  I can get a different shake everyday for Wojo's for over 2 months now that is crazy!  They all taste good which is awesome!  The Chicago hot dog is decent as are the sides.  My real reason for coming is to grab a milkshake!  Also, timing is key when coming to Wojo's.  If you do not want to be run over with high school students fresh out of Brother Rice and McAuley plan on coming before 2 pm or after 5 pm.

3.description: This pizza place is pretty good. I'm a pizza snob too. Very consistent from week to week and that's a. Big deal for me. I hate it when a pizza place is undercooked one week then burnt the next. This place does it right. Very courteous staff also.

1.description: We always try there pizza which is GREAT....Last night we order dinners.....Spaghetti, Shrimp dinner and 12 pcs FAMOUS Wings....Spaghetti dinner was real good but next time ,have to ask for Xra sauce ,order meatballs and sausage all was great.......Shrimp diner was great.......The wings are the best in this area ,  we brought the B.B.Q and they had lots of chicken on all.........

2.description: Good ingredients,  unreal price, great customer service. It's a solid pizza.   Not a deep dish, but yet a hardy one. I went to more well known place and paid $08.00 for damage near the same pizza. I will be back when in town.

5.description: We love ordering their gluten-free crust for a hawaiian pizza! & They have different sizes! Fast delivery & always very pleasant on the phone.

6.description: Being new to the area, my husband and I stopped here for a slice while exploring and really enjoyed it! I give them 5 stars because not only do I enjoy them enough to keep ordering, but their customer service is really good! Every time we call for a delivery they're really nice!

7.description: My son goes to Chicago Ag high school. He mentioned the pizza slice at this establishment was good. I was in the area and decided to stop by. So far this slice is way better than any other Waldos Cooney's pizza slice. The service was fast and friendly.

0.description: Wow! I was totally shocked by the quality of the food and service. The prices are really good as well. This is definitely the best pizza in the area. Delivery was fast, hot and fresh as well.

4.description: This place is the best! They give you big slices of pizza for $2 and the staff are cool. Plus, it's right across the street from my school. I recommend the cheese fries!!! Great place to go to if you're looking for a good meal for a great price!

3.description: My daughter and I always go here for pedicures.   Usually good sometimes rushed.  Today she took my 6 year old niece for pedicure and manicure and they charged her regular adult prices for a 6 year old ! I think that was way out of line!!  I think I will be looking for anew place to go!!!

1.description: I asked for a gel full set. So I sit down he glues tips on adds the powder stuff on and has me wash my hands. Then a girl put nail polish on adds a top coat tells me to go under the air blowers. I question the lady and so do others. She the tells me it won't be the 35 to add 15 more for a special nail polish. Wait what I asked for gel in the first place you should of pointed me to the right nail polish when I told you I wanted gel nails. You also should of said it would be 15 more not 35. I leave the salon and 4 of my nails are fucked up. Very disappointed to say the least. So I paid 35 for acrylic.

2.description: Got a french mani/pedi today. Not the best I have ever gotten, but not bad either. Still have a few rough spots on my feet, but one of the best hand and foot massages I have received.

5.description: World's fastest pedicure! I wasn't even in the seat for 20 minutes and she was already painting my toes. My feet are still eough, nails crooked, and so annoyed! I was the first one in here and no one is waiting... what's the rush!?!!

6.description: I needed a last minute pedi on a Saturday afternoon and after tryong three other places,  I found this place. They did not have a wait and the are very plesant. The pedicure was well done. However, I wish she was a little more thorough with cleaning under my nails and shaping them. It's a oet peeve when shops don't have a good color selection but this was not the case here, at least for the color scheme I enjoy. It was also nice that the customers were so pleasant!  I have a lovely conversation with three women of all ages as we sat at the drying station.

7.description: I went in today for a no chip manicure. I wanted to try someplace that was closer to home. I found the service to be less than what I expected. First, I asked how much was a no chip. I was told $35.00 which was fine since all the salons I have ever been to charge that. As I was getting my polish removed I was disappointed by the girl putting my hands in plastic bags that seemed to have been used already. (I have never had my hands put into plastic bags before, very odd. Next I noticed the tools she was using on me were just sitting on the table, so I was concerned about sanity with these items. Third, I don't think she did a very good job with my cuticles or around my nails never using a softener or asking me to wash my hands. Lastly and the most upsetting was after I tipped the girl, I went to the counter to pay the owner. She told me $40.00. I questioned her and she told me that to remove the polish it was a extra $5.00. I said that I have never paid $40.00 for a no chip and that when I asked how much, she told me $35.00. She argued with me about the $5.00 and said they had to use cotton and foil, which I said is standard at all other salons I visited and that I will not be returning to her salon. She is not a very savvy owner since after that, my friend stepped up to pay the bill and she did the same to her, trying to justify this additional charge. Now, I don't really care about the $5.00 but I do care about being deceived and felt that she should have been honorable in her practice to us. WILL NEVER RETURN AND NEITHER WILL MY FRIEND. NUFF SAID. AVOID THIS SALON. BAD NEWS!!! P.S: I will also tell all my friend to avoid this salon. If she was smart, she should have been sure I was happy before I walked out the door. Not smart. I have learned that a happy customer is worth it's weight in gold, a unhappy customer can cost you big time.

0.description: Love this place! It's cheap, no frills and they do a nice job. I've had Emily for mani's and eyebrows- definitely recommend her!

4.description: I also have a fungus on my big toe nail. Thanks a lot. I started going to LAN's nail on Cicero in Oak Lawn. They bring out sterilized equipment each time and are much friendlier and cleaner.

1.description: Employee was rude on the night I went. I read a few iffy reviews prior to trying them out but wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. Hours posted said they're open UNTIL 10PM on Saturday. I walked in the door at 8:03 and was told the store is closed, I can get yogurt but there are no toppings. WTF is that? I have a Groupon worth $30 but I will try to get a refund ASAP. I can take my business to Cold Stone or TCBY! BYE FELICIA!!!!

2.description: Extremely poor service.  The employee was allowing friends to use the lobby as a hang out.  They hadn't even ordered anything.  We had to wait nearly ten minutes for the employee to even notice us and that we actually wanted to purchase something.

0.description: I would like to give a shout-out to the very nice employee at Orange Leaf today.  My hubby and I decided to give it a try for the first time today.  We rode our bikes there along with our bicycle trailer for the baby.  We weren't sure where to park the bikes but the nice employe let us roll our bikes through the store to the patio area...she did this so we didn't have to go around back near the dumpsters.  If you haven't tried Orange Leaf yet, it is worth a visit.  It's like being a kid in the candy store with all of the frozen treats and toppings to choose from.  I have to admit that I liked some better than others, but they do let you sample beforehand.

3.description: Got there at 3:45 pm...before advertised closing time and the door was locked. Then we were approached by a gentleman from inside and was told rudely to go away and come back tomorrow...my son was disappointed cause he just wanted to see the Christmas decorations...never going back!!!

1.description: Great, clean and very cheap thrift store.

2.description: great shop , clean , organized and priced well . lots of friendly workers . i was told that the proceeds go towards Chicago Christian high for tuition and expenses .i feel that it is too bad that the parents and student do not volunteer to work there as well as the older volunteers after all it is to benefit the school so they too should contribute as well .

9.description: Pass It On does have items organized well with some nice brands.However, their customer service has been consistently awful in my experience, hence the 1 star. Today was the culmination of multiple bad experiences, and will be our last visit. The workers were verbally unkind to my wife, saying things like "you like to run things down to the wire" and telling her how inconsiderate she was, all for shopping 10 minutes BEFORE closing. I guess they thought customers should leave before that. Ironically, this took place while "The Old Rugged Cross" was playing in the background. This was not the first time workers at this store have been rude. This thrift store supports a Christian school financially, but not in mission, with this kind of example.

10.description: This is one of my favorite thrift stores in all of Chicagoland, and here's why - a set pricing system!All women's jeans cost the same price. All baby jackets are the same price.  The also have a great plus size section, something you usually have to sift through everything else to really find.There is a small section where they keep their "fancier" stuff, but for the most part the world is your oyster. I've gotten Free People, Danskos, COH, etc, etc, here for a couple of bucks. It is a fantastic place to shop and much, much cheaper, cleaner and better organized than some of the northside thrift stores people swoon and wait in line for.They have two large storefronts joined together in the middle of the store, with one side clothing, toys and knickknacks and the other side mostly furniture.Super great deals abound, but you might have to sort through a lot of junk to get to it.There is a strong religious vibe and the money made here directly supports Christian education.  One star off because they have sometimes pretty weird hours and there's something up with their credit card machine that doesn't work with one of my cards ever, but works fine with the others.

4.description: Very clean with high quality products.  However the hours are horrible (like many other charity thrifts) and the book prices have gotten outrageous.  They price the rare books higher and charge prices comparable to online booksellers.  Then the overpriced books sit on the shelves for years. Book buyers go to thrift stores for bargains on hidden gems.

6.description: I've found this place to be as organized and neat as any thrift store I've ever been too. The staff of volunteers is helpful and kind. I have purchased dishes, a Christmas tree, housewares, and clothing in the past. The men's clothing options are limited compared to a Salvation Army or Goodwill but there are gems to be found. Where they do well in my opinion is with household furniture and housewares. I have found the prices to be fair and new items are coming in all the time.  It's definitely worth a stop.This place has arguably the best book section of any thrift store in the area. You guessed it: it's organized by genre. If I had a basement bar or man cave I would buy up the old leather bound books they have and place them there Ron Burgundy style. If you love popular fiction, stopping in is an absolute must.Proceeds benefit Southwest Chicago Christian Schools.piothriftcenter.org

12.description: This is by far the best thrift store I've ever shopped in. I love it. It is well organized, well run, and full of unique finds in every department. I have even recently started volunteering there and there is even more cool stuff in the back not yet priced so this is definitely a great place to frequent if you're into thrift store shopping or even just into finding a great deal on gently used (sometimes brand new) merchandise. It's run by all volunteers, local people from the neighborhood mostly, and all proceeds go to a local Christian school. They showed me in the back all their proceeds in the past few months... it's doing great things for those students. So, before you head out this holiday season check this place out. There is a LOT of holiday items for your home, lots of gift ideas. I saw a man donate a brand new heated shiatsu chair pad... it will probably be priced for $10 or less. There is a lot of clothes, linens, housewares, an excellent book section, luggage, shoes, etc etc etc... all gently used. Believe me, they don't even stock the items if they're stained/ripped/foul-smelling/inappropriate. It's a GREAT THRIFT STORE!

5.description: I'm a Unique Thrift Store (in Markham) loyalist. I love that spot, make no mistake about it. However, a friend of ours recently suggested we check out a hospital bed available at Pass It On as we're in the market for one for our daughter. Let me just say...it was love at first sight at PIO Thrift Center.I've never been to such a clean, organized, and friendly thrift store, um, EVER. Have questions? Ask away and receive a friendly, knowledgeable answer. Wander around? There's a place for everything and everything in its place so aisles are, you know, actually *aisles*. The prices are awesome. One of our little girls has severe CP and finding clothes for her is beyond difficult. We've struck gold here more than a few times. That in and of itself is a HUGE feather in the cap of Pass It On.Oh, and don't even get me started on the furniture and housewares, either. Suffice to say, we NEVER walk out empty handed. You probably won't either. Just trust me on this one.

13.description: Organized, hence 5 stars, merchandise OK, most clothing seemed very used and not very up-to-date.  I shop the Salvation Army on S. Harlem and S. Cicero and both stores are unbelievably junkie, but I frequently find some real steals, Eileen Fisher, Stuart Weitzman, Kenneth Cole, Papell, etc. just to name a few.  But, Pass It On is worth the trip though, my first visit was successful, I was looking for a bowling ball and I found one that fit my fingers for the bargain price of $3. WIll return there soon. Staff was very friendly.

11.description: I am a thrift store fiend. I visit them weekly, mainly to book hunt. This is the best, largest, most well organized book collection i have found in a thrift store. They have classics, kids, religion, etc. Found Hemingway, Dostoevsky, c.s.Lewis, and some rare books. Love this store.

8.description: Love this place.

0.description: This place is incredibly clean and well organized! The main room is filled with clothes: women's, men's, and children's. The racks are not overstuffed, and they are organized by item, size, and color. All items are genetically priced (long sleeve shirts, short sleeve shirts, vests, etc). The larger side room is filled with furniture, household times, and an amazing bookstore (also incredibly well organized by genre.) The prices can't be beat. The store is 100% run by volunteers. They always have plenty of people working.  If you love thrifting with a clean, fresh feel, this is your place! Second hand is the best hand!

7.description: Good deals all the time! I am a weekly visitor & always find something :)

0.description: I have sadly come to realize that maybe you get what you (don't) pay for. I was ready to get my second fill-in this week.  My full set of arylics were put on here, and my fill-in was done here too. Then, this weekend I notice that under my nail where the acrylic was beginning to lift was a little strange-colored on two of my nails.  The lifting was getting to be pretty bad -- at least 3 nails on each hand had some lifting, usually along the side and not near my cuticle.  So I was annoyed and decided to break the acrylic over these strangely colored spots to see what was going on -- if the acrylic was miscolored for some strange reason, I could get it fixed, but oh no, I was delighted to see that my nails are also a twinge green.  You see, it seems that due to the lifting and then water getting caught in between the nailbed and the acrylic, I have a touch of fungus.  Thankfully it's all treatable and I won't lose my nails.I'm thrilled, really.  How many places do you get your nails done and they throw something in for free?  Next time, I just hope they give me a 10% off coupon instead.Obviously, I won't be going back.

3.description: This is the nicer bar on 111th street real darts good people good music. If your not from the area that's ok will talk to ya any way. Pretty cheap good place for a few beers and good conversation

1.description: Meh, average bar.... Not great, not terrible.... Never felt very comfortable or welcome there....

2.description: Nothing really against the physical bar itself. They have darts? I guess that's cool. If I was into darts, I mean. The clientele is really the worst part about it, consisting of 25 year old low life scumbags who can't shake the 19 year old desire to go out looking to fight. It's too bad, because the bar could be a somewhat nice place to hang out. Especially if the popcorn machine was back in action. But it's the stereotypical MTG white trash that feels the need to make themselves the centers of attention at the bar that just doesn't do it for me.

9.description: Decent place to head to with friends to talk and have a couple of drinks; except on Friday nights.  Sunday football games are the best time to visit and the Bloody Marys made by the Sunday bartender are delish.

10.description: I really enjoy this bar. It's quieter on week nights and busier on weekends. Crowd is nice, made up of local people varying in age. Bartenders are nice, definitely cater to you as you become more of a familiar face. The atmosphere is good, dim lights, normal music, definitely one of the nicer bars in the area.

4.description: Nothing special hear, a lot of low life's as customers, and don't leave your wallet or money on the bar keep it in your pocket or you won't have it for long. COME BACK ERIK THE REDS!!!!!!

6.description: I had a fundraiser here.  The people were somewhat cordial until I was robbed.I had over $800 stolen straight from my wallet.When the security personnel learned that the wallet he returned to me was empty, he gave me no indication of any concern whatsoever.  Same goes when I told the owner's wife about the theft.  Her literal reaction was, "Oh, really?  How?"No offer to call the police and make a report.  No offer to pull the surviellance cameras.  It took me THREE days to make contact with the owner, Joe.  And, again, nothing.  He sang me a song about how it's just too bad, and that there's no cameras in his brand new bar.This bar has two strikes against it for minors.  I will do my best to spread the word about low-lifes that go here and run it.It should have never taken me three days to make contact with the owner and there surely should have been more pro action on behalf of the bar when they were inititially informed of the theft.In addition, when I booked the fundraiser, I asked specifically if it would be crowded between the hours of 4 p.m. - 7 p.m., and was told NO.  When I asked for the juxebox to be lowered, I was completely ignored. This bar needs to be closed down.  They service minors and cater to a thug crowd.After having brought 70+ people into their establishment -- all who were locals and all were 40 years old and above, WITH money, the least they could have done is follow up with proper ownership.

11.description: Okies so me & my buddies popped in here in the process of checking out a few bars in the neighborhood. I ordered a drink that had lemonade in it, but the bar's fountain drink/mixer device must have been malfunctioning because it came out looking like water. Instead of fixing it, or offering an alternative the bartender just served it to us....but likely didn't charge us for it. Sooooo I guess it cancels out?? I fully dig that super famous guy that can turn water into wine....but I gotta say after sampling that libation that the reverse route isn't as righteous....*blechy*

5.description: Another one of my favorite bars- this one because of the darts. They have REAL darts! Not those stupid, plastic-tipped, have to pay a dollar every game electric kinds, but three sets of authentic darts. Plus, mechanical scoreboards (and chalkboards if you prefer). Good drink specials every day, live music, hilarious bartenders, and in general, a very neighborhood feel to it. Comfortable, chill and cozy.

7.description: Everytime I've been here, I've had a great time. The staff is always friendly, a comfortable atmosphere, and great drinks. I had a blast watching Hawks games there with friends! This place has a cozy local feel, can't wait to go back!

8.description: Looks like a college bar for the St Xavier crowd. A nice bar along busy 111 th street. It is spacious and has a wide variety of beer choices. One of the nicer more modern looking opubs on this stretch of bars in this Mount Greenwood neighborhood that I look forward to viasiting more in the future. There was a big crowd for the NFL chamopionships with people of a variety of ages, although some looked like they were fresh oput of high school.

0.description: I've been here a few times for a number of different things and have had a great experience every time. There can occasionally be some college students here but for the most part it's a nice local bar with friendly servers, has seven large flat panel TVs that they are willing to change to anything, and the facility is nice and clean. I recently attended a fundraiser here and it was set up perfectly. The staff had moved the tables to accommodate our crowd and had tables ready for our food. The three TVs in our area were changed to the three channels that our guests wished to view. Kudos to the staff here!

3.description: I bought some bike shorts from Fred the owner.  The store has no changing room to try them on unfortunately.  I took them home and realized the shorts did not fit correctly.  I took the shorts back and Fred the owner was noticeably annoyed because I didn't want to exchange them for something else.  He did give me my money back after making me feel guilty about bringing them back.  Sorry Fred, I am not coming back!

1.description: I tried to get my bike fixed at another store, and they wouldn't do what I asked. I wanted a tire replaced, not patched (as the tire kept tearing, despite their patches), but they just wouldn't listen. I came here, told the owner the story, and he said, "No problem."  Later that day, I had a new tire. Thank you for listening!

2.description: Eventhough it said closed they were open on Tuesday. The worker ben was very efficient and good and at repairing the bike i brought in. He checked out a few other things that were wrong with the bike and i was in and out with 20 minutes. Great job

5.description: I went here to buy spin shoes and was quite pleased!  One on one customer services, a discount if you were recommended from LA Fitness, and prices much more reasonable than REI in Oak Brook!  The salesman even took the time to show me how to "clip in" to the spin bike so that I wouldn't have any problems on my first try.  Would definitely recommend!!

0.description: Great neighborhood shop with honest service and good prices. When I brought my bike in for a tuneup, they installed new pedals free of charge for repeat service. I've been going here for several years and I'll be in the market for a new road bike soon and I look forward to Chicagoland Bicycle helping me find my new bike.

4.description: I had a gear break on my mountain bike. I guess narrow gangways and brick walls are not the same as mountains and valleys. Anyway, the guys at this store replaced the gear and the bike has never run better. The price was fair. It wasn't cheap but it wasn't crazy either. I guess you get what you pay for. In addition to repairs, they also sell bikes, equipment, etc. There is street parking on Kedzie and on 104th street as well so that is not a problem. For Mount Greenwood residents, this place used to be called "Richard's Schwinn."If you need repairs or are interested in getting something new, stop in and check this place out. It's also good to support local business.

1.description: Just went in to get an order to go and sat down for half an hour. Workers, bartenders, and the manager all looked at me several times but not one came to take my order. Left hungry and excruciatingly irritated and dissatisfied.

9.description: All around terrible... and that's pretty much all i have to say! Lol...I attend SXU.. Ive only been there twice in 5 years & that was too often. Service is bad & the food is really bad! Students hardly go there & the food is free for them when using their meal plans!

12.description: This is without a doubt one of my favorite bars on the south side. I enjoy it for a number of reasons. The atmosphere is great because its not overcrowded and you don't have to yell when your hanging out with friends. I also love their beer selection and they have great daily specials as well. they always have the seasonal Sam Adams and goose island beers as well as good old standbys. also they are one of the few bars in the area to car goose island green line. one of my personal fav's. now for the food. they have a great menu that far surpasses typical bar food.I love the firecracker shrimp as well as the pig skins ( potato skins filled with pulled pork). i think if you're looking for a great night out then i truly hope you try out Gilhooleys.

21.description: great restaurant/pub for singles, couples or families!  great service, lovely decor/environment, diverse menu items, kids menu, yummy food & beverages!  families w/ kids note - after 8:00 p.m., ages 21 and over only.

16.description: As a college bar, this is pretty upscale. I mean, it's no dive bar; you can converse without worrying about shouting. The downsides of this bar is that it does last call pretty early and can be pretty pricey. Does it stand apart from other bars in the area? Not so much. It seems like this is the little brother to Bourbon Street.

17.description: I was there for a private party on Saturday evening. Bar was rather empty- poor sign ! In addition- no music ! Further the party room is workable but the DEN has a pool table with broken cue sticks? . The buffet was not plentiful or tasty and the bar set-up .... A JOKE! A hike to get there- I will not be back !

10.description: The prices are high because SXU students can use their meal plan money here.The service is slow and inattentive because SXU students have no other choice besides here and the diner. The food isn't impressive for the same reason.I was a student at SXU and it always blowed my mind that non-students would come here willingly. No one should have to deal with this place.

5.description: I love carrot cake, and Gilhooley's is the best carrot cake I've had in Chicago and 'burbs. I am not kidding. (I saw another reviewer say that their carrot cake was frozen but I don't care!)The rest of the food was fine--I had a chicken sandwich on a surprise pretzel bun (yum!) with fresh fruit (actually, the fruit was really good for some reason) and the service was decent, but the carrot cake is why this place is getting four stars. I am working around there now, but Gilhooley's doesn't open until 3 p.m., so luckily, since I'm usually done early, I won't be tempted too often to go there for carrot cake.

11.description: this place is just pathetic. the only reason why i've given it 2 stars is because the servers are very nice and friendly.  the menu is about the size of a kleenex tissue. and what little food they do have, it's mediocre at best. i ordered a brownie for dessert and they didnt have the ice cream to put ontop. my sister ordered the carrot cake and they literally told her that it was in the freezer and it may not taste so great so they let my sister have it for free. the ravioli has no flavor what so ever. the service is beyond slow. if you plan on eating there next month, i suggest you put your order in now.. seriously, they're THAT slow. i dont think i'll ever visit there again.

3.description: Absolutely terrible bartenders. Definitely need some new ones. The free popcorn is okay because it's free. The food is decent if you can find someone to take your order. Only real problem with this place is the staff. Time to change it up.

0.description: This place is amazing. I typically don't write reviews but the staff here is amazing! Ellen is so kind and helpful. I told her I was new to Oak Lawn and she suggested a health food store I can buy sprouted bread.I went again lol, I asked John (manager) when the kitchen closed and he came and checked with me to ensure I placed my order.Great place for inexpensive food when I want something quick since I do not drive and do not always have the energy to meal prep for the full week.

20.description: Nice bar that was recently given to nearby St. Xavier University.  My only complaint is that they shut down way to early, if I'm not mistaken I think last call is around 12:30.

19.description: I've been doing my internship at a high school nearby, so ended up eating and drinking here a few times.  Food isn't exciting, but not terrible either.  I didn't think it was too expensive, but maybe for the burbs.  Liked the pubby atmosphere - laid back, smelled like college.  Ah memories...

2.description: Lots of frozen food, soda flat, messed up my order, waited 20 minutes for a refill, and waited 30+ minutes for the check because the waitress was eating at the bar.

18.description: I like it but I wanna LOVE it!  I think this place has a lot of potential because of a pretty cool set-up.  There is a bar in the middle with a crowd on both sides...but one side is elevated above the other.  There are darts to play when there isn't a band and the food isn't bad either.  My problem is the lack of energy on most nights.  Why don't more people go here??  There is a University right across the street and not another decent bar close by so I don't get it.  Ah well, check it out if you get a chance.

13.description: I've been here twice since my friend goes to St. Xavier and brought me here both times. The service is not even respectable, since they had about 3 waiters on a Saturday night and I even overheard a table next to us say they were there for 30 minutes with no service whatsoever. Their menu is quite odd, with appetizers more like entrees and they always seem to be out of something (my friend mentioned to me that they were out of lemons one day- at a bar!). However, the food is actually quite good once you get it. I'd recommend the mac and cheese- very tasty!

4.description: Honestly some of the rudest staff members around. They are honestly some of the least helpful people in terms of getting your order fulfilled or just getting help at the bar. Most of the time the place is nearly empty but I honestly think people come then never want to come again because of how crappy the staff is.

6.description: For a bar just walking distance from  SXU, it's not bad at all. This place provides you with good deals when it comes to getting beers after an exam. Place has good burgers and wings if hungry. Plus a nice patio where you can take yourBeer and smoke as you enjoy it.

15.description: this place would be alright if the food wasn't bad. i was hangin with some of my SXU classmates and we ordered nachos and corndogs.. nachos were ok, but the corndogs were served warm on the outside cold on the inside. despite the fact that we could pretty much eat anything at that point of the night, it wasn't very good. stick to the drinks if you ever pay this place a visit

7.description: Gilhooley's has the potential to be a gathering spot with it's large outdoor patio and "pub in a box" interior, but no one seems to be gathering here.We were here on a Saturday night and there were only a smattering of people in the place.  Pretty quiet for a weekend.  I laughed that they actually carded us - although I guess this could be considered a "college bar" given the proximity to St. Xavier University but there was not a student in sight.There is a pool table in the "den" and darts in the back but no one was playing either when we were there.  And the whole "vibe" of the place lacked a friendliness that I expect when I go to grab a beer at a neighborhood place.  Even the bartender acted like he didn't want to be there and was just going through the motions.We sat at the bar had a beer (cheap) and waited to see if it was going to pick up.  It didn't, so we left.

8.description: Very nice establishment. Good food and drinks. Only downside is it closes at 1AM on weekends. The staff is friendly and takes care of your needs.

14.description: My food came 8 minutes after everyone at my table recieved their food.  I had a salad.  I was sitting there with my water while everyone was halfway done with their meals.  The ranch dressing is probably the worst dressing I have ever had.  I don't know if they make it in house or buy it off a shelf.  The ranch is NOT good at Gilhooley's.  The salad was good, waitress was nice and the overall place was clean and tidy.

0.description: A little boutique with a casual and exciting vibe AND some purpose! And although I'm not in there very often, I have to admit that I have a pretty serious store crush on them right now. They carry an eclectic assortment of designers, from Triple 5 Soul and Ed Hardy, to Joe's Jeans and some local designers - in fact most of their accessories are all from local designers and very cute. It would be unfair to label them just an "urban" shop, as that might conjure up images of 50 Cent or something, when they (welcomingly) have a way more Common type of thing going on. The shelving that holds some of the clothing also serves as an entertainment center with a big television and is surrounded by comfy couches. Once when I went in there and there was just a dude that worked there in there on a couch and eating lunch and watching TV - I struggled with whether I think that is cool or awkward, and I think I've decided it is both.... On their MySpace page they say they opened the shop to bring some needed F.A.M.E. (Fashion, Arts, Music and Entertainment/Events) to the far south side - all welcome additions - and they get super big bonus style points for having a mix of David Bowie's "Fame" worked into a list of Eryka Badu and Bilal on their site - ::SWOON:: - That is right after my heart! I do wish that the email I got for an event there yesterday didn't arrive in my inbox - yesterday....or else I would have been more than down to check out a trunk show of a local jewelry designer and refreshments - um, hell yes... I woulda.... I'm also really excited about their other talk about bringing music, art and other events to their space. Of course I love them for that.And since I'm fat - which ain't currently in their purview - I'll stick to their awesome hats, earrings and other accessories to continue to complete my ErykaJillearthmothergoddessbutdon'tfuckwithme style persona.

3.description: Luxure is a very nice local place to get your nails looking great. I request Donna as often as I can and am never disappointed. Her work is thorough and very neat. Although I always bring my own nail polish, there are literally dozens of current colors to choose from.The decor is current and the pedicure chairs are very comfortable. I am never rushed out the door, and many times I have called and been able to get in for a polish change with little advance notice. I'm glad our neighborhood has a modern salon that is CLEAN, close and current. Nice job, ladies!

1.description: I booked a group of us to come in before an event, as suggested by a friend. Whrn booked, we were to have 3 techs scheduled. A week before, we were informed 2 techs would be available....and that 2 at a time would be able to come in. I had to cancel ghe appointments for the final agreement of the entire party to be "on premise". The atmosphere is very well thought out. And the star is for the quality of seating and decor. The tech paid so little attention to my nails and more to the TV or what her colleague was doing...I have polish and cuticles everywhere, there are hangnails from the trimming, and streaks on every finger from a lack of a thorough base coat application. The polish was explained as a 10-day wear. It chipped an hour after application getting out of the shower. I am quite disappointed, as I make a conscious effort to support woman-owned small businesses.

2.description: Don't let the bad reviews fool you - this is a neighborhood gem!  (Check out the filtered reviews.)  I've driven past Luxure since it opened, but never tried it.  I had a place I liked in Oak Lawn - you know, one of those places where the nail techs talk over your head, the chairs aren't in great shape, and there are mirrors on EVERY wall.  But hey, they did a good job and it wasn't insanely expensive.  Well, I needed a pedicure and decided to give Luxure a shot.  I am SO glad I did!I called in the morning (Saturday) and asked if I could get in for a pedicure.  I told the girl I could be in as soon as in 15 minutes, and she said they could fit me in right away. I went over and was greeted right away.  I was shown where to hang my coat  and told to pick out my color. Among others, they have OPI, Essie, and Butter London nail polishes.  The new fall/holiday colors were also pointed out to me.I sat for my pedicure and was offered something to drink.  The pedicure was great - I didn't feel rushed, and I felt like the woman doing it was really taking her time.  The environment is very relaxing - no gaudy pictures of airbrushed nails on the wall, soothing music playing, and the TV was on mute with subtitles.  Since it was freezing cold and snowy out, the woman who did my pedi said I could sit and wait for my nails to dry if I wanted, so I did. After about half an hour (I had a good book), she checked on my nails, told me they were dry, and then put oil on my nails and wrapped my feet in plastic gloves (the kind for food service, not the kind you see in a hospital).  This way, my nails wouldn't smudge in my boots.  I went to the store after my pedicure and got home a couple of hours later - and my nails look GREAT.It's not a huge place - three nail stations and three pedicure stations.  I wouldn't be surprised to go in and have a wait, but for the level of service I received that's totally ok with me.  I'd rather be in a small and well-maintained place than a place with ten chairs and bright florescent light.  I felt so welcome at Luxure, and am so happy I went.  This will definitely be my go-to nail place from now on, and I would recommend that people in the neighborhood check it out.

5.description: Beautiful inside, very relaxing. The girls (employees) need ALOT better lightning over them when they are giving pedicures. My lady polished my toe nails the best way she could but it wasn't painted great.

6.description: The aesthetics are good here - everything looked clean and pretty.  I went for a no-chip manicure and a regular pedicure.  The woman started the pedicure at 11:30 and didn't finish until 1:10. - one hour and 40 minutes for a regular pedicure - nothing fancy.  As another reviewer said, the lighting was really bad and she redid the polish three times.  By the time I was finished I really wanted to just leave but needed the manicure.  That took another 50 minutes which is about what I expected for a no-chip manicure.  Total time almost 3 hours which was WAY too long for me.  The end result was ok but definitely not worth the time and not one apology along the way.

7.description: Such a nice clean place, there work is amazing!!! A very relaxing atmosphere! Plenty of colors to choose from and they are very attentive. Best place on the south side.

8.description: Cozy, quiet spa. One of the better ones in the area, very friendly staff. Extremely reasonable prices & big variety of polishes to choose from. Surprised at the negative reviews I really liked this place and will be back! Just a note - Cannot add tips to credit card so bring some cash.

9.description: I've been looking for a nice local place to get a mani/pedi. The verdict isn't in yet. The place is styled very nicely but I am not sure about the quality of the work yet. I think it may be just the person I had as the others there seemed to be getting a different treatment than I did. I've never had a manicure that didnt include lotion on my hand. I've also never had a pedicure where I had to go home and continue the maintenance that wasn't completed. For example, my cuticles were not trimed, just pushed back.  I went home and had to trim them myself. I wasn't entirely happy with the manicure and I was told I could come back and have it fixed at any time. Like I said, I think it may have been the nail tech that I had as it was crowded and others seemed happy. On the positive, they offer you mimosas and have one of the best massage chairs I've ever sat in.  You can tell some time and effort went into designing this place.  The woman that I assume was the owner, was very involved and you can tell that she puts alot of effort into the place and wants it to succeed (naturally).  That said, I'm going to give it one more shot and hope that I can change my review.

0.description: amazing........this guy mr. twinkle  knows exactly what toe to touch to relax each and every nerve in my body! the place os so..l.clean and beautiful. the staff is very professional and so much hospitality! i wish he was in cali...!

4.description: I am so glad I made the plunge and started coming to Luxure. I have been coming consistently for about 10 weeks for my manis or pedis. It is $35 + tip for a regular manicure and pedicure which I feel is a good price considering the quality of the service and the quality of the salon & products.I always make my appointments online a couple days before I need to go in as I know they fill up quickly because they only have 3 spots of pedis and 3 for manis. This is my "go-to"spot  and it will continue to be. I find getting my nails done awkward but I feel very comfortable at Luxure.

0.description: I wish I could give more than 5 stars! I've bounced around with stylists but I don't think I would let anyone other than Claire! She is an amazing stylist! I just recently cut a lot of my hair and had a little bit of a freak out moment and she was so patient! HAIR BY CLAIRE! HAIR BY CLAIRE! HAIR BY CLAIRE!!

12.description: After a long hike after the South Side Irish Parade through the wilderness of the southwest side, ended up at Durbin's on a sunny Sunday afternoon.  Wasted people were gearing down from the parade, going to town and forgetting to take names.  Inside the bar had people spread out throughout the bar and it was very dim. The first thing that caught my eye were two plastic dartboards, but I was not going to play that crap.The bathroom consisted of one urinal and one toilet with rickety wooden door.  The signs on the bathroom showed the drink specials, of note was Wednesday night $4 pitcher night, which must be the going rate of beer out in the boonies.  Sat down and ordered some eats and had a half pound bacon cheeseburger for the generous price of $7.55. Add in an order of calamari and it was only $5 or so.  A server walked around with Durbin shots, Red Bull vodka with colored green for St. Pat's, I drank and earned myself a giant rubber green plastic ring with lights.The food was good, the fries were battered and my burger came with cole slaw.  This bar gets no points for paper menus and plastic silverware, but I don't blame them. The food was economical as was the beer and one could smoke on their patio.  Some people brought their kids who wandered around aimlessly. I am a fan, but am unlikely to head back until next year's Irish Parade since it is so far away!!!

7.description: Great pizza, trivia Monday night, bingo Tuesday night.Quite an interesting crowd. The only downside I can mention is that the parking is very limited in their lot.

3.description: A nice comfy Irish Pub, just the way it should be. Just got here after the South Side Irish Parade, and the place is hopping. People, live music (playing Bowie just now, and playing it well), beer, food, TVs with sports, just what you want is here. I've always had a soft spot for this place, and each time I come, I remember why.

1.description: Racism is top notch here. If minority, you can be ignored easily and wait 10 minutes for just water, then wait another 10 minutes to be asked to place your order, then get your food 30 minutes after ordering and never get a drink refill or be asked if everything is okay.  But if you can endure that, hell maybe you will get to enjoy the corned beef.  I gave you two chances and I won't be giving you a third. G O F U C K yourself, you racists!

2.description: It was one of a few places open on Christmas. After seeing Foxcatcher we needed a place to decompress and complain about the pile of shit we just saw. I don't drink but this place has insanely cheap pitchers; $5 pitchers.The place has plenty of seating at the bar and at tables. It's got a kind of lounge feel on the inside. It seems there was some party going on in the back; so it may be even larger than what you see up front near the bar.Gambling. Or Live Gaming. Whatever they call it now here in Illinois. I wish this shit was illegal but oh well. They have an ATM so you can drain your bank account while you push the flashing lights and buttons which amounts to a very fancy random number generator. Good luck.It's got a Wrigleyville Bar feel. Not only is this a feeling but there's also a neon sign in the window that literally says "Wrigleyville". Jäger shot ski. We sat by a jäger shot hockey stick.Intense door man. I don't blame him, these types of bars attract dumb young kids with fakes.Clean bathroom. They don't have those side urinal shields so it's all kind of open.

9.description: Ordered delivery from them twice and the food was delicious! Had the rib-eye steak sandwich and a melt. Steak was tender and delicious. Person over the phone taking the order was courteous and it arrived pretty quickly. Will order from them again!

10.description: I went to this Durbins on the South Side Irish parade day of course it was packed. We got there and waited for someone to acknowlege that we were there nobody did. The people that came in after us got served first not good at all. We had to flag down a server to get us a server. The food was alright, pizza bread no sausage was okay. The pizza at the other Durbins location was good but did not get a chance to try it at this one. Also my friend got a turkey sandwich and it came with nothing on it not even mayo what is that about? The ranch tasted like tarter sauce my friends said. The cranberry vodka drinks were weak.

13.description: I ask that my fellow Yelpers do not continue to do business with Durbin's Pub in Tinley Park or any of their other establishments. They have poor customer service and have on several different occasions created problems with me and my party which they refused and/or neglected to rectify. So, again, I ask that you do not do business with these people.

16.description: I've only been there for lunch but  it is nice to be able to sit outside and not feeling like you are putting the staff out! The food is reasonable and tasty. Two flat screens out front and the traffic along Kedzie make for excellent entertainment. Its always crowded for late night bar traffic when I go by. They have a drive thru but I've never seen anyone use it!

17.description: Just was here last night to watch the hawks game. It was a pretty decent time. The pizza is alright, the parmesan cheese they gave us for the pizza was exceptionally sour which was pretty gross. Other than that little mishap, it's not bad. Unfortunately I smoke a lot, so instead of having to go outside during the breaks in game play, they have two LCD t.v.'s hanging outside in the patio/smoking area. Didn't miss a moment of the action. The service is fairly nice, but this is coming from low expectations. They have a lot of drink specials which is nice, because my friend is an alcoholic that wanted to go to another bar after this place eventhough he had to be up at 630 AM. So I only paid forty bucks to get me a nice buzz, and he was nearly fall down drunk. So I thought that would teach him a lesson to drink heavily till 130AM when he has to be up in 5 hours. Evil? Maybe. Halarious? Definitely.

15.description: We have been ordering from Durbin's for quiet some time now (years) but today topped it. I understand the weather can be overwhelming but if that is the case, delivery service should be SCRATCHED off their menus and not provide that service. We live exactly 6 blocks away and it took them over 1 hr  1/2 to deliver... Seriously! I called 3 x to find out what is going on and the Durbin's order taker apologized and then goes on to tell me they are busy and are short drivers... Well then guess what DON'T offer deliver service easy as at. Well I was going to give the driver until 8 o'clock this evening to deliver our food or I was going to call back and cancel my order. To our surprise the paper bag that was getting handed over to us was ripped and the driver apologizes because some how the mostacholi turned over... REALLY????? Fortunately we have other options to chose from; Baggers, Papa Joe's, and Palermo's. It makes me wonder that Durbin's offers really good food but to live 6 blocks away and to get my delivery over 1 hr  1/2 is unacceptable, they could have easily said we are extremely busy at this time we cannot deliver you are more then welcome to come in and pick up your order.

0.description: We've only gotten it diliverd , but my family always likes the pizza. The crust is very good and they are generous with the toppings. Definitely worth a try, maybe I'll make it out to the bar one day :)

5.description: Ordered pizza and ribs. The pizza was too light. Tight on the cheese. Not even close to its competition in the area. The ribs had no wow factor. They appeared to be baked.no grill marks anywhere. Too many quality pizza places in the neighborhood.

11.description: After moving to Atlanta, you learn to have more respect for the pizza. Face it, Atlanta pizza, even the "best" of it- sucks compared to most anything that comes out of Chicago. So, whenever I return, I MUST get a pie. My niece loves their taco salad so we opted for Durbins. The pizza did not disappoint. Crust- thin and crispy- CHECK!  Sauce- not too much or too little- CHECK!  Sausage- (yes, sausage. Folks elsewhere don't understand the appeal and make pepperoni the standard but that is because sausage SUCKS outside of Chicago) seasoned with fennel, not too much or too skimpy- CHECK! Cheese- enough to cover the entire pizza in a tile-like layer- CHECK!  Cut in squares NOT wedges? CHECK! CHECK! CHECK! Total pizza experience= VERY GOOD pizza. Friends in Atlanta ask if I plan on going to one of the big Chicago pizza joints, but I always say that there is no need- most every neighborhood has a place like Durbins with better pizza than anyplace in Georgia.

8.description: We ordered delivery from Durbin's last night, I got the chicken and rib dinner and my boyfriend got the pizza.  The chicken and pizza were very good.  They had forgotten the ribs though, we called and the man who answered the phone was very courteous and apologetic.  They rushed the ribs right over and we had them in no time at all.  They were worth the wait, very good as well.  We will definitely order from them again, and really appreciate the great customer service!

4.description: Used to order from here all the time.... Until a couple of weeks ago. I had ordered off of GrubHub and it took them forever to deliver it! When the guy finally arrived, my brother had answered the door and asked if I needed to sign anything because I had prepaid for the order. Driver said no, proceeded to give us the pizza. As he is trying to pull the pizza out, he turns the pizza vertically! Do you know how hard it is to get an autistic child (who also has an anxiety disorder) to eat a messed up pizza?! After he gets the pizza to us, he literally steps INTO the house, and asks for the money. Did I already mention that I already prepaid for it and my brother had asked if I needed to sign anything? After telling the guy we already paid for it, he asked for a tip. Again, already included which was a mistake the size of the Grand Canyon. Never again.

14.description: Terrible... really disappointing. I wanted to get a real south side Irish corned beef sandwich, but I definitely did not get that. I came up to their drive through, and they looked surprised to have a customer. To make a long story short, they gave two pieces of bread, with some microwaved corned beef that was mostly just fast and charged me 7 bucks for it. This is not the place to go if you want the real irish deal...

6.description: Every football season, there is a group of us who love partaking in the "Chicago Bear game package".  The price includes:  nachos, pizza, dinner (fried chicken/fried shrimp/chicken wings, french fries, and garlic bread), and cocktails from kick-off to the last second of the game.  Holy special times twenty!!  Sure, it may not be the healthiest meal, but when has Sunday been "watch your weight" day??!??In addition to the super deal, there are strip cards floating around and often raffles that offer prizes, such as football jerseys and game tickets.The waitresses are extremely attentive and funny; and most importantly, do not try to skimp on the cocktails.  As for the football fans?!?  There is so much energy in this place, that it can lift any individual's spirit in a heartbeat!What a super local pub on the Southside!

3.description: Well...I've never actually received services from her.  I've been following her on fb for months and finally contacted her to try her out gratis for this new volume lash technique she's been doing.  We set an appointment and I actually forwarded her info to several of my lash junkie friends.A friend had an appointment set for about two weeks ago.  I guess Tara has surgery and had some complications.  Never returned my friends messages or told anyone what was going on.  She's been back on fb posting pics, etc for about 1.5 weeks...still hasn't responded to my friend...I had an appointment set for today...no message on where to go or confirmation.  I sent her an email stating that it's extremely unprofessional to not follow up with clients on set apptmts!  She responded within 30 seconds of me sending the message.  Kind of interesting, huh??  Stating she's sorry, etc.  But to be honest, I don't want to go to someone that is this unprofessional.Needless to say, I will just go to my current girl and continue to send my friends and followers to her.  I wouldn't recommend Tara based on my experience and my friends!

1.description: My team booked her for a makeup course and it was a disaster. She asked for money before the class... And 4 weeks later we still do not have our products. Trying to get a hold of her is impossible. When I contacted lash affair to report about her business practice. We found out that she lied about : 1) being a lash affair artist2) travels and trains students under lash affair3) giving us a certification Her whole business is a joke!!! I'm so disappointed....Tara. We want our money back!

2.description: I wish I could give ZERO stars.  I made an appointment with Tara for this week and when I showed up, the place was abandoned!!!  I called and called and she NEVER returned ANY of my calls.  I texted for like 30 minutes.   I drove 45 minutes to see her!!!I feel like that was the WORST anyone had ever treated me as a customer.  To this day I haven't heard from her.   I see from reading the other comments,  this behavior is normal for her.  Very unprofessional.  Please DON'T waste your time and energy.   If she responds to this,  I'd be floored!   Seems the only way to get a response from Tara is to write a negative review.  Well here it is!  You TOTALLY ruined my event that I had the next day. I paid a babysitter and everything, so for you to not show up or call and give an explanation is so disrespectful!!!!!!!!!

5.description: Absolutely love her work! Used to get my eyelashes done here about a year ago when I lost most of my own eyelashes due to horrible fake lashes. She saved me! My lashes looked so natural and full. Would love to start again but haven't gotten around to it.

6.description: Very unprofessional! Business at home. We had to wait outside while it was raining until she welcomed us in. Went through her back door were she had two dogs. Scheduled us at a certain time but we waited about an hour after that time because she was taking care of a friend instead. She rescheduled us about three times for no reason.My friend and I also got infected with the pink eye. Do not recommend it.

7.description: I wanted to write a 5 star review the second I left from getting my lashes done for the first time. Phenomenal. Loved them so much. I thought I should wait to make sure they lasted, and had no issues, and I can say I've been getting my lashes done by Tara for the last 6 months, filled in on a regular basis and I am ADDICTED. So glad I found her, especially after some of the horror stories I've been hearing lately about lash extensions. I can confidently tell anyone (and I do all the time) to go see Tara, she is the best. I'm confused about some of these other reviews, I've never experienced any issues with Tara. She is professional, clean, and great at what she does.

8.description: When Tara did my full set of lashes.She did a awesome job.When I needed a fill in.She had another customer.She said it would be 10 minutes.But the wait was over an hour.She was just starting the other customer when I came for my appointment.She was in a big rush because it was close to the time of her next appt.Who was there already.Right away they started falling off.Which I didn't have any problem with my first set of eyelashes.I called Tara left a message telling her what had happened. She never returned my call.I left 2 other messages but still no reply from her at all.She never said come back and I will fix them.Because that's what I paid for.Never to this day ever heard from her . I'm very disappointed in the way  she just ignored me.She knows she was falling behind and rushing and didn't do them properly .Just to blow me off is bad business ethics! !!

0.description: I got a full set of lashes put on about two months ago and I absolutely LOVE them!  I have had them filled in twice but they are so natural looking that I don't even need to wear mascara!  I get compliments CONSTANTLY on my gorgeous lashes!Tara is a very professional and sweet woman who takes the time to explain what she is doing and always makes sure the customer is satisfied.This is the best deal in town and I intend to NEVER be without my lashes!!

4.description: Tara is amazing! My lashes were in awful condition from going to a different lash salon and she did an awesome job making them look great! It's been almost two weeks and they still look incredible. I would definitely recommend her!

29.description: Love going here for margaritas!!!  HATE that they dont give you much chips n salsa though, so then I have to pay to get the same small portions.  I like this place for the most part though, but Ive certainly had better.  I'll never stop going for the ritas yummm

42.description: To quote a hilarious friend of mine, " this is no place to write home about." The food here is a little below standard Mexican food; nothing that will leave you thinking about your next time but nothing that will have you running for the bathroom.It's one of the few, if only Mexican resturants in the dirty south, so I guess it will have to do...Just have a few margaritas and you won't even care what you're eating.

23.description: This is really more of a 3.5 star place, but I'm feeling generous today. I've been here several times and I've always left happy. This place is not authentic. It's a neighborhood restaurant with nice strong margaritas. This is not a place to travel to. I go because I live in the area and enjoy getting tipsy on tequila. I think if you keep that in mind it's a 4 star experience. I stick with basics- The taco norteno being my favorite. It's breaded steak in a flour tortilla topped with fresh avocado slices and sour cream. The flan is some of the best I've had! Be vsure to order that as well. My only gripe about my last time here was I felt rushed. Our server was really nice until the end I really felt like we were being pushed out. I'm sorry, but when I spend $81 on basic Mexican food I feel I'm entitled to sit for 65 minutes. I don't like rushing!

8.description: We live in Florida but my husband is from Chicago and we visit family every year. La Fiesta is one resturant we always visit. Arrived today and first meal was lunch at La Fiesta. Ordered fish tacos. Talipia was perfectly seasoned and topped with fresh tomato & cilantro. I love fish tacos and these did not disappoint. Absolutely awesome!!!!  We will be going back this week with the family. The service is great and the resturant is nicely decorated and includes outside seating. Highly recommend this local establishment.

31.description: The food is just okay, and the prices (for the area) are a little on the high side. I've never had a problem with the service.  This is the neighborhood's "fancy" Mexican restaurant, and it does a pretty good business. But you can travel a few miles south and get much better Mexican food in Blue Island. One question: why does the logo picture a man wrapped in his serape, his sombrero pulled over his face, snoozing against a cactus? Wouldn't that be better suited for a place called "La Siesta" and not La Fiesta?

34.description: I literally have to eat it at least once a week. The margarita's are so good they're hard to resist. Great place to eat outside, dinner or just drinks.

16.description: Best mexican restaurant in the area. The staff is fast,  friendly, and it won't kill your wallet for lunch.  I got the taco plate were very big, and my wife got the chicken fajita salsd which looked,  and she said was awesome.  Our bill was $17 with beverages,  and the food.  My wife said the bathroom was the cleanest she hss seen, and with the bladder the size of a pea she has seen a lot.  Bottom line....I will be back.

13.description: This place has grown on me. Although much of the food does not have the punch you'd expect from authentic Mexican food, the menu has some real gems. The chicken tacos and chips are fresh and light but substantial. The chicken quesadilla is consistently tasty. I've found their more complex dishes (eg mole) and even taco salad to be disappointing. Service is usually very good...friendly and attentive, but not annoying. The patio is a lovely addition.

11.description: This is really more of a 3.5 star place, but I'm feeling generous today. I've been here several times and I've always left happy. This place is not authentic. It's a neighborhood restaurant with nice strong margaritas. This is not a place to travel to. I go because I live in the area and enjoy getting tipsy on tequila. I think if you keep that in mind it's a 4 star experience. I stick with basics- The taco norteno being my favorite. It's breaded steak in a flour tortilla topped with fresh avocado slices and sour cream. The flan is some of the best I've had! Be vsure to order that as well. My only gripe about my last time here was I felt rushed. Our server was really nice until the end I really felt like we were being pushed out. I'm sorry, but when I spend $81 on basic Mexican food I feel I'm entitled to sit for 65 minutes. I don't like rushing!

39.description: Great food! The quesadillas are awesome. Also, give the tacos sombrero a try!

37.description: They never get my order right or hot enough.  I usually order the tamale dinner with mole on the side and crumbled white cheese, they cant get it right. I really despise this place, only go on occasion for margarits, hand shakin' not from the margarita tap...the only reason they are in business is b/c Mt. Greenwood has such a limited restaurant selection.  I prefer to go to Wonderburger than this lame mexican crappy place....oh yeah, I dont think the owners really give a crap about the service or the customers.

0.description: Me and my girl had two fish tacos two steak tacos side of guacamole, beans and rice and 1 bloody Mary and prickly pear Margarita!!! And devoured it ALL!!! It was good eats!! Service was fast and friendly and clean would definitely go back!!

38.description: I've had dinner here twice and shouldve only had it once. There is better Mexican food at 7-11 (go go taquitos). The salsa tastes like water and tomatoes. The beers were a step above lukewarm.

27.description: I have had better meals at taco bell! They know people in this area have nowhere to go so they overcharge for this dogfood and these fools keep coming back. The staff and everyone is nice. but the food is HORRIBLE!I lived in New Jersey for 3 years and there was NOWHERE TO EAT so people would go to places like this and go gaga over the food and the outdoor patio because there were no other choices!!! People go crazy because it has a patio. SO WHAT???????IT OVERLOOKS A PARKING LOT AND 111TH STREET. WHOOPDY DOOO!!People in this area have to be desperate to eat here. The beans tasted like lard out of a can. A big layer of GLOPPY CHEESE over the enchiladas. Tomato sauce like another reviewer here noticed, tastes like they poured it out of a Campbells soup can. It makes me think the owners are laughing all the way to the bank! But when you live on the Southside and there is no place to eat, you think this dogfood is the best!!! Oh, and it has a porch by golly!!!!!

32.description: Food is gross and bland, no flavor ! The prices are ok but seriously 4.25 for a freaking beer is ridiculous.  This is Mt. Greenwood, not downtown.  Ate here yesterday and it was around 8.  They closed two hours after that,  the woman was so intent on leaving she was vacuuming the floor the whole time,  SOOOO annoying, especially when she started doing it in and around our table.  Please wait the freaking two hours the restaurant is still open.  I was so annoyed!

44.description: There are two redeeming qualities of this place: The outdoor patio and the Pollo El Carbon. You really won't catch me coming here when the outdoor patio is open and I won't go out of my way to come here. The food here is average Mexican food.  The only thing that really stands out is the Pollo El Carbon which is pretty tasty. The service has never really wowed me here but I have never had a horrible experience. I can't comment on the margaritas because I drink beer!

24.description: There aren't many options in the Mt. Greenwood/Beverly area for great Mexican food and I am spoiled as I lived on the North side for the last 14 years! La Fiesta has this area by the balls for lack of a better term because there really aren't any great sit down Mexican restaurants in the south area and I'll pass on Casa Margartia in Orland, that place is nothing to rave about either. Their margaritas are ok, clearly some faux fruit margarita flavoring that is over colored; they don't have horchata as they must be too high class for that; they don't have micheledas which are a traditional mexican beer cocktail.Their chips are good, their salsa is so mild a 2 year old can eat it which is great if you bring your kids I guess. I have had their carne asada dinner cut up and sauteed with onions, peppers, melted cheese and it was decent along with a combination plate of taco, enchilada, tamale, all were fair. The place definitely caters to a non Latino population out here and maybe that is why they are still around as the area has no idea what true authentic mexican food should taste like, but again, we don't have options out here so I guess we will take what we can get. Better yet, for real mexican food in a quick sit down place, we will sometimes drive north on Pulaski to places like El Solazo.This place, is what it is, nothing more. Sorry folks.

7.description: The outside Patio is very nice, The drinks are ok.... But the food is horrible.There were four of us and not one person in our party enjoyed the food. The steak was dry & tasteless..... they actually charged us for chips & salsa. If you are looking for good mexican food this is not the place!!!!Very disappointed.

40.description: My gals love to go for the Monday Night 1/2 price margaritias. The quesowas a solid brick of gross but the service was very friendly.

30.description: I really wanted to give La Fiesta a better rating, but for some reason it has really gone downhill.  When I was a kid, this was my family's go to Mexican restaurant.  Now, though, it seems like they are more interested in profit than being a landmark in Mount Greenwood. First of all, I have never gone to a Mexican restaurant in which you had to pay for extra chips and salsa.  Sure their chips are deliciously hot and crispy, and the salsa is mild and tasty(yeah... it's probably Pace, but it's GOOD!), but if they are going to be stingy enough to charge me for every extra basket and cup, you can count me out.  Prices for the main dishes are reasonable, but a "large" plate of guacamole is $8.20, and there are no free refills on pop.  It seems like all the extras get you paying much more than expected.  The best part of my meal was the waiter.  He cracked me up by calling everyone baby and my grandma, "mama." He seemed to be having a great time serving, and it was definitely well received.  He even recommended the dish I got (carne an rajas) which was very delicious.  I have gotten a few of their dishes, and this is definitely my favorite. Overall, it is not the food or service that is disappointing, it's the pricing. Then again I may have gotten spoiled by Pilsen's (18th and ashland) pricing and delicosity.

1.description: It is sad to write a bad review about this place, I love it here. Usually, everything is great, and the food and experience is wonderful. But, when you are told that your burrito is going to come with rice and beans on the side, you expect to get them. My friends received their sides, but no sides for me. I asked about them, but nothing came, The server was slow tonight, so I wonder if she forgot about the sides, even after I asked.I think next time, I will just go with margaritas and chips. I don't want to pay for things I am not going to be getting. I know it sounds like I am whining, but I want the food I order and pay for.

9.description: Anyone saying the food has no flavor has not tried their taco sombreros! If you like steak, bacon, and jalapeños then they are a must try! They are my favorite steak tacos in the area. All the other food I have had is just decent, nothing special.

26.description: This was my first time here.  I had a strawberry margarita and enchiladas suizas.  We sat on the patio.  I enjoyed it.  It was a nice summer, Chicago night.  We enjoyed the evening, and I like that we could be outside without going downtown or the Northside.  We will be coming back.

25.description: had the enchalidas, cheese... were very good.Service was sloppy.... our server was more intrested in flirting with the bartender than attending our tables needs.You could tell there was no manager on duty.... all the staff gossiping in the corner of the bar with one another, if there was a manager on duty they should fired for running a muck.Entree was good, rice and beans were also ok..... chips and salsa were good.

12.description: Popular mexican place in Mt Greenwood, I doubt it's very authentic, but it still tastes good to me, I've had the burrito, taco bowl and the tacos, I was satisfied every time, it's nice to sit outside in the summer too

21.description: Yelp needs a no star button. Tried it more than once, disappointed every time. La fiesta makes Taco Bell and chipotle look authentic. Strangely enough on more than a single occasion, when I took my well trained dog for a walk past the side door, he always whimpers, cries and try's to run away.
