I can't walk him past this place, ever. I tried that more than once too.

17.description: I usually enjoy this restaurant very much:My sister and I decided to visit for cinco de mayo. We ate a good meal and left. Then this ignorant couple decided because they thought we were illegally parked in a handicap spot that they should take a picture. So I got out my my car went back in the patio and politely asked what they were doing. The ignorant man preceded to try to tell me it was illegal for me to drive because I'm not handicapped. Little did they know that we had a valid placard issued by a dr. I'm am not a person to be loud or rude in public but I can't stand ignorance period. PSA to all the ignorant patrons who were in the restaurant today there are people walking around with an illness that you can not see, it doesn't mean they aren' in pain and it isn't any if your business to judge or be the morality police.

10.description: Um, Yum! We had a birthday lunch for one of the Aunties. Friendly server (but a little overwhelmed with our group) ... we had about 20 people and she was the ONLY one taking care of us. Can't say she did a horrible job but they could've had someone helping her out. Anyway .. complimentary chips and salsa on the table were a plus. The chips were a little greasy but the salsa was very flavorful and I couldn't stop stuffing my face. The lunch specials are a steal & the food is pretty tasty. It was my first visit & I am willing to give it another taste :)

5.description: I came here with a large group to celebrate my friend's rehearsal dinner.  Obviously they knew ahead of time and we had a catered dinner.  We bride and groom to be are obsessed with this restaurant but I had never been here before.  They served chicken and cheese enchiladas and beef fajitas along with rice and beans.  I really enjoyed the enchiladas but wasn't impressed with the fajitas.  We sat out in the patio area which was nice at first.  After it started to rain they closed everything up and it got really, really warm.  I was a little frustrated with out wait staff.  One side of the table kept getting refills of margaritas and chips but they kept forgetting about us.  I think I would give this place another try just for those chicken enchiladas!

35.description: Wow, reading the reviews, y'all are breaking bad on La Fiesta...what the heck!Seriously, the place has some solid Mexican food, and I am picky as hell! I just had the Camarones Diablo tonight and they were spicy and excellent (the waitress warned  me that they were "really spicy", but they were perfectly spicy), and I usually order the Chili Rellenos and I am VERY picky about those, and they are always excellent here!This place is close to my shop and there is an absolute dearth of decent places to eat around here, but I would recommend La Fiesta even if that weren't the case! Oh, and the service is always excellent too...I never have to flag someone down to get me another beer at this place!Keep up the good and consistent work, La Fiesta. I am a fan!

19.description: Where do I start?  With the good, ok.  I'm a nice guy so I'll do it.The food is really good.  They know how to cook.  The atmosphere is also nice, and its clean in there.The bad now, here it comes.I went there for lunch, and the waiter took forever to even look at me let alone serve me.  And I was the only one in there (besides my girlfriend).  He was too busy watching the soccer game with the other waiter and bus boy.  Then he finally came, I ordered a queso fundito and some drinks.  He came to our table only 2 times.  To take our order, and to give us the food.  Didn't check up on us once!  So they only gave us 4 tortillas and I HAD TO GO UP TO HIM WHILE HE WAS WATCHING TV and asked for more, and they wanted to charge us!  And the price they said was more expensive than an entire pack at the store! Pshh!!!!  So I was done eating, and I HAD TO GO UP TO HIM AGAIN to get the check!!!!  I'm not going back until they learn how to be good servers there.It's by the post office if anyone wants to give it a try.

28.description: Very non Mexican food.... Appears to be Campbell's tomato soup used for all their sauces.  Salsa and chips are charged each time you ask for more. Bad news

3.description: Monday night $4.50 margaritas are pretty good. I also really like the chips and salsa which are homemade and super fresh. The service is always really fast and friendly. For the most part the food is just okay. The shredded chicken tacos are pretty tasty too.

33.description: Blah, nostalgia has let me down yet again.When I lived in Oak Lawn as a kid/teenager, La Fiesta was my family's default Mexican place. I loved everything about it.Well now, life has gone full circle for me and I have a job at St. Xavier University, 2 miles from where I grew up, 1 mile from where I went to high school, and 1 mile from my old favorite Mexican restaurant. So when my new supervisor asked where I'd like to go to celebrate starting my new job, I recommended there.It wasn't bad by any means, just... disappointing.First off, the service was slower than hell. Sure, it was 12 on a Tuesday, but still, it took an eternity (note:this is an exaggeration, not to be taken literally) for each stage of the dining process to take place. We sat for 15 minutes before anyone came to greet us. Then several minutes before we could order, then five or ten minutes before and refills were offered, etc. etc. Then when the food did come. It tasted good, but was kind of a mess. My tacos were lying on top of each other in such a way that they were all really soggy and hard to eat. I will admit the flavor was about as good as I remember, but poor plating can hurt a meal. I'm not a judge on Chopped here, just keep the food in good condition for me.In other, less hard to mess up meals, some of my co-workers got a torta they were raving about, but were perplexed that it came with fries. Oh and their chips and salsa are absolutely fantastic here. Overall, though, it was disappointing. It's still good food, but it needs a little more polish to be better than average.

43.description: La Fiesta is a favorite happy hour destination among my teammates after a long day in the operating room.  The margaritas are pretty tasty, plus they have an outdoor patio.  The food is average...  I've definitely had better.  Service is friendly and fast.Basically, my thoughts are:Dinner - no!Happy Hour - YES!!!

2.description: From what I hear from my father in law this place used to be great. I've been here a few times since moving to the neighborhood but I've always been dissapointed. The food just isn't good, it's bland and flavorless.

18.description: This is quite possible the worst food I have ever had. I cannot say the worst food that I have ever tasted because it had none. I had the steak enchiladas suiza. This is not mexican food. It is tasted like microwaved meat. My husband had the steak fajitas and he claimed they were just as awful. I also requested hot sauce and I said hot sauce 5 times and the girl still said suiza sauce. I said, " no, I am requesting hot sauce." She gave me a cup of ketchup that had no sort of spice at all. Just to confirm, I gave them a star by accident. I accidentally hit it upon opening the app and hitting write a review. It wouldn't let me take it back.

41.description: So my girl & I decided on this place a couple nights ago since its close to her house. Upon walking in, the place had a nice vibe. Very lively with lots of people. They have a full bar so it definitely seems like a place to have a party and some fun. Since I read other peoples reviews on here before hand, I was not expecting to be blown away by their food, & I wasn't. The salsa that came with the chips before the meal tasted like some Pace or Tostito's jar salsa from your local grocery store. (the chips were good, however) I ordered chicken tacos, & my girlfriend ordered steak fajitas. The portions were definitely plentiful, as I only could put down two tacos (the appetizers were filling) I did finish all the rice & beans, which were probably the high point of the meal. Other than that, the food is neither good nor bad. Just "meh". Not a place to go if you're seeking authenticity in Mexican food. But if you're around the area & as hungry as we were that night, you might occasionally find yourself here anyway. Afterall, it's a nice place & the staff seems pretty nice as well.

4.description: I remember a time when this was THEE go-to spot for my Mexican fare fix. What a cluck! Since the area is largely Irish pubs and Italian joints, La Fiesta enjoys little competition...and that's a good thing since I doubt they'd hack it otherwise. The menu has great dishes..prepared with mediocrity...and at times, little care at all.  Therein lies their biggest issue. I thought I'd give them another try a few weeks back, but went with take-out since service was so slow last visit. Chips were not included with my pricy *double* order of Pico de Gallo, but no one bothered to tell me. I got home in the snow only to discover this for myself  Oh, for f*cks sake! My rice was dry..my beans, watery. The meat on my Tacos Nortenos seemed suspiciously old. It even smelled rancid. I ended up tossing my dinner...bypassing feeding it to my pit, who digs in the garbage and chomps down Chuck Taylors. :/If you like chunky, poorly mixed Margaritas, slow service, and Russian Roulette, you'll love it here! The consistency and quality just isn't there these days which is truly a  shame because we could really use more great restaurants in this area of Chicago. *sad trombone*

6.description: Tried this place when they first opened and the food was pretty good, but the service was horrible.  So today I was going to try again and I checked out there website.  I picked out a couple things and called to place the order.  First off the girl that answered the phone started out nice and quickly became very rude.  After completing the order she gave me a price and it was about 6 bucks higher that is posted on the website.  Her reason was the price was higher because of the increase in minimum wage.  I asked if she was going to honor the price as listed on their website and she said "No, It is not my problem if the website is wrong."  I guess she is correct about that, I don't really know, but it is how she said it.  Needless to say I told her politely that I changed my mind and she most likely lost a customer for life.  Her response was, "Ok, No Problem"If you want good Mexican food from people who really care about you and the food go to La Fiesta Azteca down the street by 127th and Kedzie.

22.description: Yesterday was my first time trying La Fiesta's and I am not a fan! My waitress was terrible she barely came to the table she rushed us to order and she brought us cold food! I ordered chicken tacos and less than ten minutes later she brought them out, they were dry and they smelled funny, as high as the prices are for this horrible food and service they have the nerve to not offer free refills on soft drinks therefore each refill you ask for is an extra $1.50! I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone I know the service sucks and the food is not good!

15.description: I love this place soo much! It's a great place 2 relax and watch a good game. Their chips honestly are amazing! They're so salty and oily and light...... Yyuuumm! They're ssoo good! It's a really big place and very pretty. Their daqureis are  also really good. They have really good food and their margaritas are pretty good too(my dad's opinion.... I'm only ten!) This place is really good!!!

20.description: Where do I start?  With the good, ok.  I'm a nice guy so I'll do it.The food is really good.  They know how to cook.  The atmosphere is also nice, and its clean in there.The bad now, here it comes.I went there for lunch, and the waiter took forever to even look at me let alone serve me.  And I was the only one in there (besides my girlfriend).  He was too busy watching the soccer game with the other waiter and bus boy.  Then he finally came, I ordered a queso fundito and some drinks.  He came to our table only 2 times.  To take our order, and to give us the food.  Didn't check up on us once!  So they only gave us 4 tortillas and I HAD TO GO UP TO HIM WHILE HE WAS WATCHING TV and asked for more, and they wanted to charge us!  And the price they said was more expensive than an entire pack at the store! Pshh!!!!  So I was done eating, and I HAD TO GO UP TO HIM AGAIN to get the check!!!!  I'm not going back until they learn how to be good servers there.It's by the post office if anyone wants to give it a try.

36.description: Love the foood and the service is outstanding ! I always ask for Carlos he really knows his  customer service!,

14.description: It's great but bland, you know what your getting. It's one of only outdoor eating venues on the south side of Chicago. Good drinks

3.description: What a fun and different bar! Great bartenders and good specials fun atmosphere and ice cold beers. Great place to listen to music and relax. In my opinion Hinky Dinks is a great pub to kick back and have a great time.

1.description: My friend was having her birthday gathering at Hinky Dinks.  It is one of the dive bars in Mount Greenwood but in a good way.The staff was super nice and helpful.  They even had a nacho bar set up for the party!  The price of drinks is also pretty cheap and they even had a wrist band special for the night.They also had a band playing which was nice to have some background music.  They also sounded good.

2.description: Just a neighborhood dive bar. I like the layout and the actual circular bar setting. One pool table and some sausage guy was there in butcher outfit hacking sausages from his shop. it was free and good.

0.description: Great bartenders, very friendly, great place to watch the bears, hinky dinks has the nfl ticket, so you wont miss anygames. $10 buckets and plenty of $3 bombs 4ya. beer garden is very kool, large screen tv so Cub fans can watch their team lose in private

4.description: Nice little hole in the wall place with friendly regulars and good specials.  In reality, it's on the south side, and it serves cold, domestic beer.  What else do you need?

3.description: The is store is great! They always go the extra mile and have made special order items for me. I WISH our school would officially endorse them as I am a huge proponent of supporting the local businesses, and not the national school chain!

1.description: We've been buying school uniforms at Schools Are Us for years and years and have always been very satisfied with the customer service we've received. Really really good place.

2.description: Good place.  They have the business of many schools so in August and September they are very busy so be patient.  Sheri is very accommodating and helpful.  Good quality clothing - most have lasted through my 3 kids....

0.description: They were very accomodating to us after we had miscommunicated (our fault!) what we needed.  Great demeanor.

3.description: I have been going to Face to Face for over 20 years, my 22yr old daughter also.Professional, clean, friendly, up on latest styles, colors, trends -recommend to any & all wholeheartedly.Owner Toni Frangella is a perfectionist & a sweet person.

1.description: I've been here on two occasions with two different stylists. First, I had Shannon who was wonderful. She listened to what I wanted with my hair, and really took the time to make it look great. She washed it, cut it, blow dried it, straightened it, then finished cutting it just to make sure that it looked good and that I was happy with it. I definitely recommend her! The second time I went in, Shannon wasn't available so I saw Tracy. I was not pleased, and months later I am still trying to grow my hair out from what she did. I feel as though she didn't listen to what I wanted and didn't take nearly the amount of time with me that Shannon did. My hair looks choppy and uneven and I am always wishing it would grow faster to even out the cut.

2.description: I am new to this area of Chicago and I was not sure about choosing a salon from Yelp, but this is a great salon and totally not what you would think looking at the outside!! So modern and SUPER friendly. I had an up-do done by Noelle and she did a great job and she was great to talk to!Thank You, LOVED my hair!!

0.description: A couple weeks back I got my hair done here for a wedding. I got a half up-do and loved it. Dawn did a fantastic job and was hilariously entertaining to talk to. I love when I get my hair done by someone I enjoy talking with, it makes all the difference. Thanks again, It turned out great!

4.description: I love Face to Face.  I usually get my hair cut and highlighted by Shannon or Karen.  They both do a WONDERFUL job with my hair.  I have a weird natural blond color that makes highlighting difficult.  They fix it up with no problems.  It is great that they, all the people who work there, all support each other and are not upset if you see another person that was available sooner.   I really appreciate this since sometime I am not able to go to either Shannon or Karen consistently.

3.description: Best DD in the area!  Staff in very friendly, fast, and efficient.  The location is a bit odd and I never expected it to do well, but every morning there's about 8-10 cars in line for the drive thru.  I've been 4-5 times and they've always been nice and gotten my order correct in spite of being incredibly busy.  Props to the staff!

1.description: Things here have greatly improved, as far as service and time to get your order. I have been getting coffee here quite a bit lately, with the whole any size hot or iced coffee for a dollar from 3pm to 6pm. The donuts are an added bonus occasionally.It does get busy during rush hour in the morning, and kids pack it after school, I guess it is a good place to hang before going home or something. Oh, and the rush hour after work gets busy, as well, so be ready to wait a bit if it is busy.

2.description: Best DD I have ever been to! Fast, friendly and efficient! Ever realize how some DD's make your coffee great and some just can't get it right? This one ALWAYS gets it right!

5.description: In spite of the super-tight drive up--I have an extra long Expedition--I still love this place.  The coffee is fresh even after 5.  The employees are friendly and intelligible through the speaker.  And the guy in charge--it's the same guy in charge from 119th St.!  He's a real nice guy--he works so hard!  To be fair--I don't get donuts here.  Just coffee.  Just regular, non-fancy, coffee with cream and sugar.

6.description: Or, conversely, sigh; another crappy franchise donut (as opposed to doughnut) shop. There are real bakeries in EP and Blue Island.

0.description: Great fast service and nice drive threw to get back on the street. Only compete is when the older gentleman is at the window maybe he can say something like anything , possible the total , thanks , hi or bye instead of just staring at me the whole time

4.description: Every morning I use the drive thru and the staff is always kind and nice and fast as well.

3.description: This place was better when it was Frank's.  We stopped in for carry out.  First, they ran out of the jumbo shrimp, so we couldn't get a pound, but he gave us an extra 1/4 of the Chicago style to make it up, which was fine.  All the shrimp tasted good, and Chicago style has a nice flavor to the batter.  On to the sides.  We got some fries and an assortment of onion rings, cauliflower, and mushrooms.  Most of those were ok until I opened the onion rings.  They were all burnt, drying out, and downright disgusting.  Being that I have worked in the food industry for years, serving up black, burnt to a crisp food SOULD be considered unacceptable.  No one wants to pay for garbage.  I wish I would have known that before we got home.  Especially for what they charge, I don't think we will be returning.

1.description: I got the Jumbo Shrimp meal  and the Chicken Salad Wrap.  The meal was reminiscent of Goose island but better. Unlike Goose Island, I prefer my shrimp fried hard. I had plenty of shrimp in the meal. PLEASE LOOSE THE MILKY MACARONI OR COLESLAW. Unless its fresh or homemade it's gross. I could appreciate a small fruit or side salad. The wrap was better than I expected. The Chicken Salad is pretty tasty similar to mine.  I will go back. There is no other seafood place in my area. Like every other place in Hyde it closes early. I hope as they get busy the stay open a little later and the get rid of the gross milky sides that really don't get eaten.

2.description: I thought the Chicago style shrimp was excellent!! The 1lb meal deal was perfect for two people to share (unless you are very hungry or don't like to share). I will most definitely be back again soon!! The shrimp cocktail .... So yummmmmmy

5.description: It's a good place for a quick bite. Nothing fancy about it, but it serves it's purpose. Everyone there is friendly and helpful, also. There are some things I've gotten that are really good and some that are pretty average, but I've never gotten anything that was bad. The soups are particularly tasty (ESP the corn, shrimp chowder.)

6.description: Solid food, nice staff, and nice place

7.description: The shrimp batter is too thick and not tasteful.  The catfish seems to have the same batter.  Not a good place for seafood.

8.description: It would've been nice to have a quality seafood place in Hyde Park.....but again brand food takes up restaurant space in HP. Nothing is seasoned....the quality of the seafood seems pretty good but if they could just season the food!!!!!!!! They're squandering a good opportunity to have something unique in the community!!!

9.description: This was truly terrible. I came here with friends expecting plump fresh fish and flavorful shrimp and got neither. The breeding was three times as thick as the fish and the food was tasteless. Not worth the money and I should have stuck with my golden rule: if it's empty don't eat there.

0.description: First time at this establishment I phoned in my order, surprise! surprise! surprise! I ordered1/4 lbs of jumbo Chicago style shrimp and 1/4lbs jumbo garlic shrimp I wish I had a menu, I paid over $9.00for four shrimps.  The Chicago style shrimps was a little tough, but I must say the garlic shrimps was very good before I go back I will check out the menu first, and I will not order jumbo shrimp. Bon appétit

4.description: its pretty much a greasy spoon with deep friend everything. I ordered delievery not knowing what to expect after reading the menu which they threw about 5 on my front porch. I ordered the shrimp, hush puppies,  and catfish nuggets. the shrimp was OK unseasoned but good quality. the batter on everything. wasnt to my liking and everything seamed unseasoned now that I this k about it. anyway just another mediocre restaurant to add to the long list of bad restaurants in hyde park with low standards.

0.description: This is my go to Aldi nowadays. It is a hop, skip and a jump from my place.I tend to shop a few different stores when I grocery shop, and Aldi is always on my radar. Great prices on milk, eggs, cereal, bottled water, canned goods and frozen products. stop in and see the deals and leave smiling at how much you saved over Dominicks or Jewel.

3.description: I just visited the store for the first time today on Free comic book day.  Friendly people, great costumer service. They have a big selection and good sales. I just recently got back into comics again and this is going to be my go to store.

1.description: The woman who answered the phone was really rude, acted like she was doing me a favor taking time out of her day to answer my questions. Someone needs a tutorial in customer service...

0.description: Chicago's best comics shop is actually in Mt. Greenwood. Sure, you can find the latest books here next to their big collection of t-shirts and gaming supplies. And sure, there's a gaming room in the back and long-boxes full of comics. But the thing that impresses me the most about this shop are all the funky little nooks and cranny's full of graphic novels and books. For a true comics fan there's nothing better than turning a corner to find a hidden grotto with even MORE books in there for perusal. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable. The shelves are clearly marked. And this place is jam-packed full of the best possible merchandise! I will be back. Most definitely, I WILL be back!

2.description: As a new member to this shop, I have to say i'm impressed. I read a few reviews before this and want to give it just 4 stars, but I can't. This store really is outstanding. I usually pick up comics every third week and just binge away. I do this because they have a $10 minimum for cards in their store. Not only is the owner such a cool guy to talk to, but the second person that works there is a really awesome woman as well. They always have multiple copies of most things you'll want and always have some kind of sale going on. When a brand new #1 of something that isn't Marvel comes out, the comic is only about $2 after tax.

5.description: Now that I have a comic lover for a companion, this is the kind of nerdy stuff I review.  Ok, I'm also a nerd, but not quite a comic nerd.  This store has a huge selection, particularly of trade paperbacks which are easier for me to understand, and they also have a huge section of back issues.  I was a little disappointed that though they had a sticker on the door claiming to be women friendly, some of the women/girls selected comics were titles like "Marvel Weddings."  What about Tank Girl?*  They did have some interesting Daniel Clowes titles beyond Ghost World, so I won't be too cranky about it.  For a comic novice like myself, this place is a bit overwhelming, but I now have a good place for gift shopping for a certain someone, or a way to lure him into giving me a ride when I have things I need to do at the Beverly Art Center.*They do have Tank Girl, just not in this section.

6.description: Alternate Reality is the best comic shop in Chicago, and it doesn't even have a review yet! I attribute this to the fact that it is south of Madison, therefore does not exist to the rest of the world.Those of us geeks who spent time stomping around the south side however, probably have been in here at some point.If I didn't live over an hour away from AR, I would still go there.Tim, the owner is a really nice guy and will help you find or order whatever you need.Best selection of comics, books, graphic novels, toys, shirts, collectibles that you can find, and a very decent back issue selection especially for books from the last year or so, which is great if you need to play catch-up on a certain title. Hundreds, maybe thousands of movie posters to choose from.Awesome discounts which rotate every day of the week with lots and lots of monthly and yearly sales with deep discounted stuff. New stuff, not just crap that other stores put on sale because they can't sell.My only complaint is that last time I was in there, some of the titles were so deep on the rack that they were beginning to lean forward and bend.  Made the racks look unprofessional, and put a curve in some of the new books' spine. Not a big deal if you only buy your comics to read, but I personally like to put my own dents and creases in my books/comics. And if you use their subscription service, obviously this would never affect your stuff.

7.description: I am a Comic nerd.I have been one since I was 10 and I have Nirvana around the corner. Alternate Reality is a Southside shop with a Near North side Cool. The staff is steeped in Comic knowledge. Posters trade paperbacks toys and statues....everything you could want...need. In fact you may show up when one of the regulars in the store are there and you will eavesdrop on The New Avengers....movies......politics.I pick up a coffee and hang out with Tim for hours....Look for me and I like DD coffee.....

8.description: Its an amazing shop, what impressed me the most wasn't that Comicbookman had everything that I personally look for in the "ultimate" comic book store, but the fact that he had something for almost every demographic of comic and pop culture. Always with an animated movie looping or audio comicbooks on speaker in one part of the store.  This is a place where anyone is invited whether you've been a comic fan for years, or looking to find your inner geek, Alternate Reality is one of the best Comic Book stores I've ever perused..

9.description: Free Comic book day sale is the best out there. $1 new comics on every comic priced $4.99 and under. Best store in the city, I cannot wait for the next big sale. Highley Reccomended!

10.description: WOW.  A whole lot of comics and toys everywhere.  The store is so large and packed floor to ceiling with comics, toys, posters, and other things, it was over whelming.  My neck hurt after looking at the figures hanging from the ceiling.  I did find a few good deals, but I can get some items at other stores for cheaper.  I would go back if I'm in the area again, but that's a 3 hour drive from where I live.

4.description: Come for the comics, stay for the movie posters and the ageless Comic Book Man.There's not much for me to say that hasn't already been said in the previous reviews. In my opinion this is the best comic book store in the greater Chicagoland area. I just wished that I lived closer. There's so much to love about this place. Tons of comics and collectables for a good price. 15% off all new comics! That's never changed in the 10+ years that I've visited this establishment. This is a place is not only perfect for comic book lovers, but also for movie buffs. They have the best selection of movie posters that I've ever seen in a store. They have ultra rare posters from decades past and in amazing condition. Posters range from popular movies like Star Wars to the lesser known cult films such as Foxy Brown.  I highly recommend this place for people who truly love comics. Not recommended anyone who belongs to the new wave of self proclaimed nerds who don't know all the Robins or what "women in refrigerators" mean. Go down to the Southside and immerse yourself in the sprawling caverns made of ink and paper. Also, that guy hasn't aged a day in ten years.

3.description: I'd stopped here for a slice before, and it wasn't anything too good.  Tata's down the street has WAY better pizza, as does Simply Slices and Beggar's.  I should've figured something was wrong when the "CLOSED" sign was still facing out, despite the fact that they were open.I'm having people over for the game today, so I figured I'd get their "playoff special"  located here:  myrosatis.com/PlayoffPro…Which is an 18" pizza and 18 wings for $18.  The pizza isn't that good, but with the partying we probably wouldn't notice.We were told it's not their coupon, it's from a different chain, despite that their location shows up on the website, and I asked if their website was myrosatis.com, and they said it was.  They still would not honor the coupon.  If they don't want to honor it, they can just say that instead of making up some stupid crap about it not being their website!They offered us a 14" pizza with 12 wings for $15, A much smaller pizza, and 6 less wings for a mere $3 less?  Not much of a deal for crappy pizza.  We're having people over, and the point was to get enough for everyone, we just went to Simply Slices and got some pizza and breadsticks for under $15 that's enough for everyone, and it actually has a great flavor too!

1.description: I love love the chop salad, very good with flame grilled chicken and their house Italian dressing is very good too. The pizza is good, they actually cook it well done perfectly for me.  The menu stated it's under new ownership, I'm not sure how long it has been but seems to me their doing a good job!

2.description: I've only had the pizza slices here. Nothing special, but not bad either. Problem I had was that they have a pizza by the slice sign constantly on in their window but I've been denied individual slices multiple times because their warmers were not working.

0.description: Not clear on all these bad reviews. We just tried them randomly after getting a flyer at our house and we're impressed! Of course a slice on the go is not gonna taste like a fresh pizza. The flavor a were great and the crust was especially awesome. They used enough garlic and fresh mushrooms were great. We will definitely order from them again. Fried dough is amazing too! I recommend the rosati monster pizza!

4.description: Pretty good pizza and consistant quality.  I like their sauce - not overly sweet, sometimes I want sweet and I will go Milanos but Rosatis is a good place, excellent coupons and gives back to the community.  Just finished our Friday night dinner and it was plentiful and good all for under $20 and leftovers - will feed us for lunch

1.description: Seeing below others had reservation issues too. Been a life long Barracos patron (Burbank and Evergreen), my brother even worked at one location for a few years. I called and made a 7pm reservation 1 week prior to the event for a group of 7. Arrived just before 7pm and the hostess told us it would be a few mins because they were waiting for a table to leave. 15 mins later I asked the hostess for an update. She informed me that a 5pm reservation was still at the table and had not left yet. I explained that I had also made a 9pm reservation for another venue and was informed by that venue if we were late we would loose our table. I actually felt bad for the hostess, she was trying. My group of 7 sat and waited. At 730 pm they sent a waitress over to tell us that the group still had not left but it should be any minute. I then asked for a Manager, Daniella. Daniella informed me that "reservations weren't a guarantee" (nobody said that over the phone). She was apologetic but other than that didn't do anything...didn't offer an appetizer while we waited, drinks, nothing. At 745pm I ended up calling another restaurant down the block (got in right away). Please sort out your reservation issues.

9.description: Was told I was on a date with my male friend.  Wrong thing to say to me! Horrible service! Now 5 days later. I wish there was a way to put 0 stars!

23.description: I'll give this one a 3 star. I just have never been a big fan of barracos on 95th or some of the food really. J  I will say that this one is allot better then the restaurant on 95th. I would suggest if you like a good chicken chopped salad I like this one even though they went a little much on the onions but still not bad. Parking will not be easy with it being off of 111th so good luck with that!

5.description: Our reservation for 7PM was not in their pencil and paper system when we showed up, despite being called in the day before.   The hostess actually told my dad that he "must have made the reservation at the other Barraco's".. because he's old I guess.  It was his fault.Lo' and behold, a few minutes later the manager who took the reservation the night before acknowledged that he remembered the 7PM reservation (that he took over the phone) but, unfortunately, they were not able to find a table for us.  Because he/they/someone lost the reservation. He blamed the shift change for losing the reservation (that he took).   Professional?  So we waited another hour to be seated.  To the manager's credit, he comped us some fried appetizers and a round of drinks.. but what we really would have liked to not have to wait another hour in their waiting area.  No real closure to completely screwing up our reservation and setting a bad tone for the rest of the night; he never checked up on us once seated.  Mickey mouse operation.Once seated we had to wait another 15 minutes to get our drink orders in.   The waiter's excuse was not really an excuse and, instead, verbatim here, "I was busy with other people".  That may be true.. but don't tell us that.  Amateur.  The food was good; not bad, not great.  Maybe the $22 steak and potato is less tasty when your first hour and a half at a restaurant has been ruined by terrible service.Honestly, I hope we, the people of Beverly/Mt. Greenwood, can stop allowing restaurants like Barraco's skate by with such halfass management and service just because their space and beer selection are nice.Two stars for doing a solid job when we had a reception there following a funeral.Aside: why were half of the (unoccupied) couches in the waiting area flagged with a "Reserved" sign?  This restaurant tends to give the impression of wanting to be as swanky as a Rush St steakhouse with random tacky crap like this... at least back it up with service and meal quality.

25.description: Have been in twice, first time ordered off the menu and food was good. Bread is fantastic with their olive oil, balsamic vinegar dipping sauce. Went a second time and caught the buffet which was really bad. Boxed mashed potaoes, petrified chicken, none of the buffet was appealing. Very low quality. Would stick to ordering from menu only. Place looks nice, staff great.

12.description: I'll give this one a 3 star. I just have never been a big fan of barracos on 95th or some of the food really. J  I will say that this one is allot better then the restaurant on 95th. I would suggest if you like a good chicken chopped salad I like this one even though they went a little much on the onions but still not bad. Parking will not be easy with it being off of 111th so good luck with that!

21.description: Two stars for the decor.  Food is not very good and pricing is too high.  If your looking for a place to drink it's nice.

16.description: We came here for dinner for the first time since it opened and was thoroughly impressed. The space was redone beautifully with lots of light and open space; you don't feel on top of other tables. Margaret was our waitress and was so pleasant and accommodating. I can't wait to go back and try the patio area, it looks beautiful!

17.description: When I heard Barraco's was going to open in the former Corrigan's space on 111th, I thought, ooh, it will be good to have a good neighborhood restaurant there again.I'm not sure when exactly it opened; it hasn't been open long, but they have it down. (They should - Barraco's has been around awhile.) I've always liked Barraco's, but mostly I've had their catering. This is maybe my second time in one of their restaurants.We had maybe a 10-minute wait. The waiting area is furnished with big, comfortable sofas with lots of throw pillows. Just at the point where I was thinking, hmm, maybe we should try somewhere else, our pager went off.Wow, this was good. The service was terrific. You sit down, you get bread that's not just warm, it's HOT. And fresh. And I noticed later that there was a guy walking around with MORE. Mmmmmmm. The salad that came with my dinner was really good, and it was big enough that I almost asked them to wrap my dinner right away. (Almost.) My one (minor) quibble with the salad was that there was a tad too much dressing on it; on the other hand, the dressing was so good (creamy garlic on this trip) that I was kinda glad there was a lot of it. The greens were fresh, crisp, and fabulous.I had the fried shrimp. I don't usually get shrimp in restaurants; it tends to be a disappointment. Not the case here - the shrimp were huge and perfectly prepared. It was a shame we didn't try the desserts - their selection is pretty big. Maybe I'll just have to make a special trip, just to try the desserts.My one and only serious complaint, and this has always been a problem on 111th - there's just not enough parking. Please, Barraco's, make a deal with the bank across the street. Other than parking, this is a terrific place.

10.description: Awesome Lunch! Stopped in for the first time, finding the place via Yelp after meetings at the Oak Lawn Hilton. Better than advertised! Sat at the bar, skipped the buffet and order off the menu. Unbelievable prices on bottles of wine, basically a long list of familiar labels with a good Italian red going for $25. Had the gnocchi with vodka sauce and a breaded chicken breast. Wish I lived closer.

11.description: Trying to find the words to compose, this may be lengthy but PLEASE READ. Last night my friend and I went to a bar in the Evergreen Park area, Barracos on 111th (that ive been to plenty of times). AS SOON AS WE WALK IN. A white lady sitting with another white lady and a white male (all in their 40s) mean mugs us up and down and says "Really?!?"....we sit down & order our drinks. NO MORE THAN 10 minutes later, one white lady approaches us and tries to get our name and shake our hands. IF LOOKS COULD KILL  we didn't say a peep to her. she continues on and says "I wanted to ask a question but it may be rude and I don't want to come off rude." In unison , my friend & I say "exactly ma'am so please go BACK to your seat." ...The lady continues and says " Well I just want to say I appreciate YOU PEOPLE for being here tonight." And goes back to her seat  I follow her. "what do you mean you people? " she says "ohh you know what I mean by you people." Her friend chimes in and says "Well I don't appreciate you people being here and YOU DONT BELONG HERE, I WISH YOU'D LEAVE. "  I stated "Ma'am your money is as green as mine and appreciated here just like yours." We are all going back & forth in an argument...The manager finally came to see what was going on. We stated we were being harassed by that table and they came up bothering us. INSTANTLY, the white people started screaming out "FUCK YOUS" & "YOU DONT BELONG HERE" and doing hand gestures.....The manager did NOT ask them to leave but stated to us " I'm sorry girls but if you want to stay you can, if you want to leave I understand." WHAT?!? Disruptive and belligerent people are normally asked to leave, right? PLEASE DONT SUPPORT THIS PLACE.

26.description: I like Barraco's pizza, and we've ordered from their 95th St. restaurant several times, for dinners and catering. I was happy to see their newest site less than a mile from my house. My family--all adults, parents, siblings, spouses, niece and nephew--ate here last night. Our party of  nine was almost too big for the place--we over-filled the largest table. (Tables are round and can't be pushed together.) The food is okay. Not great, but pretty good. Between all of us, we sampled a good variety of food, and no one was dissatisfied. The portions are large--we all took home doggie bags. But the prices are higher than average for the area. If you go out for pizza/casual dining, it's a little pricey. The place is new, and they don't seem "complete", yet. I'm sure they eventually add artwork to the brick walls and expand their playlist (though I do appreciate Springsteen! All the other music was Italian pop). Parking is terrible. There's very limited space on the street, and the side streets are one-way and/or cul-de-sacs. There was an initiative in this neighborhood several years ago to address traffic problems by severely reducing thru-streets. This has had mixed results. I'm sure the residents appreciate less traffic roaring past their homes after the (many) area bars close. But for patrons of businesses, it's a pain. I think this is the main reason so many business at this site fail. For businesses that rely on quick transactions (picking up a Tata's pizza or running into the hardware store) parking spots open up fast. But sit-down restaurants don't have that level of parking turnover. Bottom line: be prepared to park a block or two away and then walk. My main concern was the slippery flooring. When we arrived, it was pouring rain. The floor was a little slick from people tracking in water. You just had to be careful and pay attention. But the rain stopped and the floor seemed much drier on the way out--NOT ! There were still some slippery sections. This was nerve-racking, because we dined with my parents, who are in their late 80's. (My dad walks with a cane.) I escorted him, but I was skidding in a few places. I think it's the flooring. I hope management figures out how to handle this, possibly having someone assigned to continually dry the flooring whenever it's wet out, or maybe installing more absorbent floor coverings in the entrance way. I can't think of another restaurant where I've been this concerned about the floors. I hope this business survives and that I'll have the chance to eat here again--though frankly, unless it's for a sandwich, it's a little out of our budget. I'd rather get this kind of check at an old school steakhouse, not a pizza place.

27.description: When I heard Barraco's was going to open in the former Corrigan's space on 111th, I thought, ooh, it will be good to have a good neighborhood restaurant there again.I'm not sure when exactly it opened; it hasn't been open long, but they have it down. (They should - Barraco's has been around awhile.) I've always liked Barraco's, but mostly I've had their catering. This is maybe my second time in one of their restaurants.We had maybe a 10-minute wait. The waiting area is furnished with big, comfortable sofas with lots of throw pillows. Just at the point where I was thinking, hmm, maybe we should try somewhere else, our pager went off.Wow, this was good. The service was terrific. You sit down, you get bread that's not just warm, it's HOT. And fresh. And I noticed later that there was a guy walking around with MORE. Mmmmmmm. The salad that came with my dinner was really good, and it was big enough that I almost asked them to wrap my dinner right away. (Almost.) My one (minor) quibble with the salad was that there was a tad too much dressing on it; on the other hand, the dressing was so good (creamy garlic on this trip) that I was kinda glad there was a lot of it. The greens were fresh, crisp, and fabulous.I had the fried shrimp. I don't usually get shrimp in restaurants; it tends to be a disappointment. Not the case here - the shrimp were huge and perfectly prepared. It was a shame we didn't try the desserts - their selection is pretty big. Maybe I'll just have to make a special trip, just to try the desserts.My one and only serious complaint, and this has always been a problem on 111th - there's just not enough parking. Please, Barraco's, make a deal with the bank across the street. Other than parking, this is a terrific place.

0.description: Love the Nicky's special pizza, good apps. Basic Italian American food, but excellent pizza.

20.description: Although the food was good, the manager on duty was not very accommodating.  I made a reservation on January 11th for a party of 10 at 7:00 on Saturday the 17th.  O spoke with Jack who transferred me to a Daniela.  She took the reservation and did not say that there would be any issues.  When we arrived, they seated us a table that could probably accommodate 6 people comfortable.  When we asked to speak to the manager, she did come over and unfortunately I did not get her name.  She was very rude and said something about they don't guarantee their reservations and they try to seat people with reservations when they come in, regardless of how large the table is.  She said we could get back up and wait for the next table to finish and put the tables together, had we done that we would have waited a hour.  I said that we would not be back there and would appreciate her taking care of something on our bill.  When the server brought our drinks because there was no room, he spilled a beer on one the the individual's jacket.  After this instance we received some appetizers, however at this point it really didn't matter.  The manager never came back over to see if there was anything else that she could do.  Will not be going back to that location

19.description: Absolutely disgusting.  This is my first review ever.   I've never felt need to but this food was terrible.  Someone wrote they really enjoyed the grilled calamari so I tried it.   It wasn't even edible.  Tasted like seafood that had been rotting in the sun for a week.  Pizza was also awful.  They can't even put out a decent salad.  Why is this place still in business? Well that's of life's great mysteries

2.description: One of my favorite places to eat. This is one of the newer locations and its very nice inside. Their food is always  delicious. Try the chicken tetrazzini its one of my favorites. They also have a lunch buffet that is good, has enough variety to please anyone in the group.

18.description: Met friends and family at the bar last week. First time there. It was very nice inside.  That's where the positivity of this review ends. We started a tab that got to over $200, they asked us to pay it. No problem if they were changing shifts but they weren't. They were afraid of us leaving without paying the bill. Totally rude and first time I saw that after working in restaurants for over 20 years. Overall we spent close to  $350 there, tipped the bartenders ovet 20% and received horrible service at the bar. We tipped well because many of the group is in the service industry. We had to constantly remind them we ordered drinks. They didn't buy one round let alone a drink for anyone of us. We will not be back ever and I  will let everyone I know not to bother. Worst service on the south side.

13.description: This place has a great atmosphere for dining or drinks.   It is also little known that it does have a small back patio to eat on as well.  The food here is always good, and the service is great as well.

4.description: Good atmosphere, friendly wait staff, but slow slow slow food. The soup could stand to be hotter, too, was lukewarm and just didn't taste right because of that. The beer selection was good, the TVs to watch the Blackhawks game were ample, but, as I said, the whole meal situation took too long. The girl sitting on the couch trying to be stealthy as she smoked her ecig wasn't stealthy.. She should have been asked to leave, since on the door, it says they aren't allowed inside.Also, there are not enough toilets. When three little boys want to take the ONE guy's toilet so they can all text together, it is dad that I needed to go all the way home to use the bathroom. I'm not trying to be gross, but letting the situation be known.

24.description: I've been here a half a dozen times since they opened.  The bar is well done and the bartenders have been friendly/outgoing.  The food has been good.  The Supreme pizza is better than their regular thin crust.  Wings are just the right spiciness.  They take reservations but they don't go by them????????????? (Insert Seinfeld episode here)

6.description: Since going when it first open, all I can say is OMGez!!! This place is freakin phenomenal.  To our surprise, after my husbands graduation from the CFD we decided to go to Barroccos; they have a BUFFET set up during lunch hour!! There was no waiting the staff was friendly like always and I LOVE their chicken vesuvio.Totally recommend this place not only because I live in Mount Greenwood and they are local but  honestly it's a very family friendly place. Give them a try.

22.description: The new Barraco's on 111th is the bomb. They start you off with some excellent fresh baked bread and olive oile with balsamic vinegar and fresh grated parmesan on a plate for dipping. The bread and dip alone are worth a visit. Everything else was just as good, well prepared, and in oversized portions. I had the sausage and peppers, and they were delicious. Everyone in the area is always complaining about lack of choices for places to eat, well here it is, so go there and give this place your business. You won't be disappointed.

15.description: The new Barraco's on 111th is the bomb. They start you off with some excellent fresh baked bread and olive oile with balsamic vinegar and fresh grated parmesan on a plate for dipping. The bread and dip alone are worth a visit. Everything else was just as good, well prepared, and in oversized portions. I had the sausage and peppers, and they were delicious. Everyone in the area is always complaining about lack of choices for places to eat, well here it is, so go there and give this place your business. You won't be disappointed.

7.description: We love coming to Baraccos. The pizza is always delicious. We also love the chicken, the caprese salad, all the soups and the pastas. The staff in the restaurant and bar area have always been nice, knowledgeable and helpful. The nightlife is great too. The outdoor area is amazing, especially at night. Love the addition to our neighborhood.

8.description: This is a great place to watch a Blackhawks game. Even when it's crowded I've never had to wait more than a minute or two for a drink. Mama Barraco's Stuffed Pizza, with ricotta & spinach is hands down my favorite one they serve, as well as one of my favorites in the area. Try it - you won't be disappointed!!

3.description: Dined in with local friends who order carry out frequently, something I encourage others to do if they choose to visit. Service was very slow. Our waitress was very attentive but it seemed like she was the only one serving the entire restaurant. Host staff stood around doing nothing while this poor girl (Megan?) worked her arse off. Overall the food was fair. I had the lobster ravioli which was good but the Alfredo sauce was mediocre. I also had a cesar salad that was just awful and absolutely don't recommend this. I asked if there was a mistake but the waitress clarified it was made correctly. She did offer to give me an alternate salad but I declined. Our friends liked their chicken parm and hamburger so perhaps you would have better luck with those options.  Nice environment and lots of seating but not sure we will return.

0.description: I had my wedding flowers created by Duffy Floral and am so glad I did. My mom and I probably drove the poor women nuts in there because we kept changing our minds on what we wanted, but they were always so patient! They had wonderful suggestions and really customize the bouquets to match everything. The flowers looked very modern and exactly what I had envisioned! I did not have a large budget for flowers, but you would have never known! They are so reasonable! Thank you!

3.description: Having lived in Chicago almost a year, I felt it was high time to really start seeing other parts of the city as I have covered a good portion of the North, Loop, and West Side.  I just love getting out of my neighborhood and in the 3rd largest city in the country anyone who doesn't is selling themselves short on some wonder places and people.  But the south side has been on my to do list.....I hear about the southside, Chicago accents, and Irish population, but haven't experienced that in any depth until I went to Lannigans in Mount Greenwood.  Here I was able to hear some of the accent and partake of the Irish flavor that made some of what this city is today.The bar is quaint in the sense that there isn't anything special decor wise and the place was very bright lighting wise....it kind of felt almost like closing time than a bar, but then again, I've been to London, not Ireland, so perhaps that is how they are lighted over there?  Regardless, folks are friendly, though everyone looked the moment I walked into the room, I came from a small town in the south, so I understand that type of reaction when entering a neighborhood bar.As should be in this side of town, plenty of White Sox items abounded, as they should and drinks were very affordable.The bar is not big by any standard and there is a pool table in the back.  A few TVs allow for watching a game.But after 10pm is when it gets interesting.....this particular Sunday night a circle of folks set up in a corner of the seating area and began playing and singing Irish tunes.....I felt as if I was in a pub somewhere in Ireland as it was just great music.  Cheap drinks....great Irish music (free)....friendly folks...makes for a great little southside bar.

1.description: Good and friendly place. Karaoke in Friday nights used to be great, but everyone in the backroom anymore so that the place fills with smoke. It was great when I could breathe, but that's probably not happening again for a while.

2.description: The last time I was in here all I kept thinking was "Can someone tell them that the giant screen playing project runway or some other weird fashion show over and over is killing my buzz? I know that the Notre Dame Game was being projected there, but it ended hours ago and no one changed the channel." This is not the first time that the giant tv screen has bothered me before. It takes away from the ambiance and charm that this place might potentially have. And the bright lighting never helps either! These are my only two real beefs with this place.But other than that this place is your average inexpensive south side bar full of blood shot eyed neighborhood Dads drinking with their buds. There is a pool table and dart board in the back. Its a dive, but so is everywhere else. It's an Irish pub no doubt!

5.description: It's a place where The Reader or Chicago Magazine will never recommend in one of their bar issues, which is a shame. It's not uber-hipster cool, but it has a pool table, a juke box, and excellent Irish beer and whiskey. It can use a few more ipa's, but it has something for everyone. Friendly atmosphere and a nice bartender on the Monday that I was there. Only three TV's in the joint so it's a laidback kind of dive.

6.description: I was here after the Southside Irish parade and seeing as it's been cancelled I am now able to sleep at night.I don't remember much about being here, sorry it was a long day of "festivities"... but I can assure you we had a great time. I do remember however that it wasn't jam packed with people and that the servers weren't as angry with us for being so "happy."It's a  little Irish bar somewhat off the beaten path that is Western Ave., and is it's  appeal for me. If you don't like it, you can always walk about 50 feet to Corrigan's for a similar effect...**Newsflash, 99 percent of bars on the Southside are Irish. SO, if that is a problem...go North!  :)

7.description: Loved it.  I have friends who live quite nearby Lanigan's, I was 'out south', dropped in on them and landed here, eventually.  Cute little hidden gem of a place.  Great staff, nice non-macho-nor-slutty-nor-dufus customers as far as I could tell, the usual cheapish southside prices; had low-key fun (check out the paneled pool table room), maybe more cuz of my friends or being a lil bombed, but was impressed either way.  Cool neighborhood, too.  I'd definitely return.

8.description: I recently spent a real bender of a weekend in Mt. Greenwood. Shan't trouble you with details, these things just happen. People of vague Irish descent (like myself) are absolutely insufferable. We're always going on and on about how many shillelaghs we own, which county our dear aul gran came from, how many of our family members were carried off by the bottle... blah-bitty-McBlah-blah-blah....hiccup. You wanna know why we're so obsessed with telling everyone how Irish we are? Lean in and I'll tell you a wee secret (sorry about the whiskey breath)...It's because it's a lot more glamorous than just being like, "Yes, I'm an alcoholic."Aah cultural stereotypes. Stubborn, industrious Germans. Boisterous, passionate Italians. Needy, high maintenance - [erupts into coughing fit]....you know where I'm headed.  Personally I have no shame in wrapping my character flaws up in the Irish tricolor. And evidently the good folks at Lanigans are quite happy to pursue cirrhosis right alongside me.Here's how you know you're in a proper Irish pub1. You're not in Wrigleyville.2. There's a raffle going. Probably to benefit someone's mam who has a nasty, ingrown toenail.  If you enter, you might win a bottle of Tullamore Dew!3. The nice old gents to either side of you are trying to stave off the delirium tremens. All you can think to yourself is "Somebody get this man a drink! He's old!"4. There's singing. Loud and off key... and no Neil Diamond either. Feck off.5. The barkeep is being worked to the bone but she is making an absolute killing so no matter. And she's NOT some 20-something broad wearing a racer-back "Kiss Me I'm Irish" tank either.So Lanigans is probably one of the better if not The Best Irish Pub in the Chicagoland area (I've still got Celtic Crossings in mind for this illustrious title as well). Just don't come here unless you have a bed to fall into within spitting distance or a friend who's cool with you booting all over the interrior of their ride on the way home. Erin go barf.

9.description: To start with I've been coming to this bar for years and never knew that it was actually Jeremy Lanigan's.  Yelp looked it up and that is the official title for it, but signs on the street will just say Lanigan's pub.This place is the typical southside irish pub (and I mean that in a good way).  On a typical weekend the crowd has a good mix of locals and those straight from Ireland.  It can get tight as there isn't much space, but I have never had to walk to the bar more than twice and not have the bartender know my order.  It might not be the place were you want to stay all night but it is worth the stop in at some point on your evening.

0.description: Don't let the exterior fool you, Lannigan's is pure gold.Typical Irish bar; Guiness and whiskey reign.If there's a wait for your drinks, you may get siddled up with the bar corner drunk who'll chat you up his journeys in the army in the 50s/60s/70s (always changes).Kareoke is on fridays at 9pm-2am. Always a good time, the DJ can actually sing and is very responsive to requests. I haven't made an appearance for quite some time, but back in my day, Weezer's 'say it ain't so'  was always the closer.Come on down, put your arm on someone's shoulder and have a good time.well worth the visit.

4.description: I love neighborhood pubs if just for the fact that they represent the neighborhood that they are in. It's a great way to see and experience parts of the city that are not normally on my "beaten path" so they become a destination for me or a place to meet up with friends. On a recent Sunday night, I had the opportunity to stop into Lanigan's Irish Pub in Mount Greenwood. I sat at the bar and after having the locals check me out (it's always funny to me how the regulars have to size up the new folks) sipped my beer and looked around. Having spent some time in Ireland, I'm not sure I'd call this a typical Irish bar but it had most of the elements that they are known for. Friendly people, a bartender, who, while harried, made sure that the beers/shots kept flowing, coupled with a variety of people from the neighborhood just catching up after a Bears game. We even had one woman who had won a Bears pool that day offer to buy us a round of drinks! Now how friendly is that? But the real treat of the evening was a group of local musicians who gathered at one end of the pub on this night, and began to play Irish music and to sing Irish songs. The lilting combination of flute, accordion, violin, hand drum, and bagpipes had me smiling and tapping my foot along to the beat. How fun to find myself in the middle of all of that? And hats off to the one guy who sang a song a capella with at least 7 verses who made me think for a minute that I was actually in County Kilkenny, Ireland where I experienced a similar evening not so long ago. Not sure what the rest of the week looks like at this place, but for me- Sunday nights after 10 when the music and Guinness flow freely holds a special place in my heart!

29.description: Another one of my reviews filtered out so I am reposting since I am a REAL and current customer of Tata's!  From: 8/29/2012We drive in from South Loop to eat here and my husband even drove out once to pick up a pizza and bring it home where I had the oven waiting to keep it warm and crunchy! We've eaten here over a dozen times so far and have recommended it to many people and now we have people checking this place out. Personally for me, it's my new favorite. I've had friends order a pizza with italian beef on it that said it was fabulous and personally, I love the sweet pepper pizza and always request a little well done. The ingredients always taste fresh and the crust, just a perfect ingredient to exposed crust ratio! The owner even mentioned he grows some of his veggies in a little garden in the patio. The staff is always friendly and kind, but not over the top warm & fuzzy, which is fine for me. The place is very casual and informal...they know their pizza though and have a spacious outdoor byob patio. The other plus for me is that they are very kid friendly. The only thing I did not care for is one time when we ordered food in the patio, our pizza was brought out in a pizza box instead of a metal tray, which I think made the pizza a little soggy in the middle. But so far, it was only that one time. Just about everyone you know likes a different kind of pizza, for my husband and I, we agree Tata's is our favorite and it's very well priced compared to similar styles up north!Was this review ...?

42.description: Really really yummy. Not deep dish, but the toppings are thick. Best pizza in the neighborhood that I've found so far.

23.description: I was surprise on how great this place pizzas are!!! My 3 kids aging from 2 - 11 even make comments on how good the pizza was. The pizzas are not just great tasting but they are extremely reasonable. I highly recommend this place. I was hesitant at first to order from here and I am happy my husband convince me to give them a try. Will be ordering again!

8.description: Tata's gets 5 stars.  Why?  BYOB!  Seriously.  Hit the place in the summer, and sit on the patio.  Get a couple of pizzas with family, bring a few bottles of wine, and some beer.  Let the night carry on!  Good times!!!Ok, the food?  The pizza is 4 star if you ask me.  Service is quick and they carry a good thin crust tavern style pizza. It's Chicago, and the pizza is thin crust.  You might not like what I like.  Try it, and you may agree!And the pizza the next day?  Oh man.  I used to eat it cold, but my sister heated it up in a frying pan.  SO MUCH BETTER!  The crust was crispy again!!!I heard they may close a little early, and might not be the most friendly folks.  Ok...  Get there/order early, and remember you are not eating personality.This is the type of place I want to open!

31.description: The pizza is good and the prices are reasonable, but the way this business is ran is disappointing.  I raved about the pizza to a friend so we decided to go for lunch.  What a mistake.  After finding the "entrance" we were greeted with disgust.  How dare we read the large banner outside that says Italian ice and pizza by the slice and come in asking for a menu to order?  They have absolutely no seating and do not use their beer garden at all.  What a waste of a great location, size, and pretty good pizza in a poorly ran business.My family will still call and order pizza from here, but it is sad to see such a great opportunity for this place to thrive and they don't take advantage of it at all.

34.description: Never been disappointed. Delicious crispy crust with a bit of char like no other place I know of in Chicago. So good!!

16.description: Best thin crust pizza in Mt. Greenwood....I suggest trying meatball and roasted red peppers won't disappoint

13.description: Awesome pizza, family owned and most definitely eat outside. This place is great. The potato crust is really good. You can tell all the ingredients are really fresh.

11.description: If you love a thicker type pizza with generous toppings Tata's is the place to go!  Try the pepperoni pizza.  It's baked until the pepperoni is crisp on the edges and absolutely fantastic.  We call it "crack" pizza at home because after 1 piece you will be addicted.

39.description: A place offering legitimate vegan pizza (read as also: with soy cheese! Squee!) within a reasonable driving distance (to get some take out nosh, that is) and for a reasonable price (a small, plain "cheese" cost less than twelve bucks)?Oh.hells.yes.Now, listen. I've been doing the vegan thing long enough to eat plenty of 'za (probably far more than I should ;) sans cheese, sneaky egg washes, and the like. But sometimes a girl just wants to get up on a soy-cheese laden slice of deliciousness. Amirite?Now, some of the obvious pluses are price and location (at least for me). We also ordered at, say, six-something on a Friday night & twenty minutes later, we had a pizza in our car, ready to rumble. We went with the straight up "cheese" (which, from the looks of it, is Teese) because I wanted to see this beauty in all it's glory before filling it to the max with veggies (next time). Here's my quick analysis:1. It was cut beautifully. This is a big plus in my book.2. The crust was interesting in a good way. Light and flaky but with enough body to hold up all the goods.3. The sauce was interesting in an interesting way. It was sweet, but almost had a kick to it. Jury's out on this one. I usually gravitate more toward a simple, robust sauce but this was not bad at all...just interesting in an interesting way.4. The "cheese"...was....well, good but it needed some help. Teese comes in round tubes and it was pretty obvious that they did the old slice-and-slap with the circles. This left some gaping sauce parts, and some areas double coated with cheese. Another gripe of mine? Cut the slices thin if you're not going to grate them. There were a couple of bites where I actually had to deep six cheese since it was pretty much like a foot deep (okay, not really...but you catch my drift). Ultimately, while I know it's a PIA, grating the cheese is the way to go. Or hell, switch to Daiya where it's already shredded. (And admittedly, I'm biased there since I loves me some Daiya.) But I wasn't impressed with the whole drop a slab here, drop a slice there, drop a slab here routine. In short: yes, I will order again and next time with veggies galore. Definitely worth checking this out if vegan pizza is your bag and you rock the southside something fierce. :)Oh, and PS - call first to make sure they're offering vegan pizza. My husband called once a few weeks ago and they weren't serving it that day. So to avoid any potential soy cheese disappointment when you get to Tata's, you might want to pick up the phone first.

37.description: Hit or miss. Sometimes I get a pretty good pizza here & sometimes - like last night I get a poor one. The veggies seemed like they were thrown on as an afterthought.

0.description: Solid pizza here. They usually char the pepperoni- which tastes great. They don't shy on the toppings either. Usually get a free liter of pop with a large pizza. Good find in Mt Greenwood!  They have no indoor seating.

38.description: We live just a few blocks from here and were so excited when they put the outdoor patio up.  It is the perfect place to walk up for dinner on a nice day and relax outside while eating a good meal.  Unfortunately, we were pretty disappointed with the pizza.  We gave it 2 tries...6 months apart...with the same result.  I hate the crust.  It is so boring...no taste at all and just blah.  I also did not care for the tomato sauce.  I LOVED all the fresh toppings though and it was served in a reasonable amount of time, nice and fresh and hot.  If it were good pizza, we would be here all the time because of the location and patio, but really I would prefer almost any other pizza place in the area.  Most are a little cheaper also.

27.description: Great pizza! Party room is awesome...not expensive, holds up to 50 & is BYOB. Angelo, Joanie & their daughter are very nice & accommodating. We order the garlic cheese bread appetizer often for delivery but it is not on the menu-they have it for parties, sooo good! Our kids love it. It is a pizza crust brushed with olive oil garlicy sauce & mozz cheese melted on top. Also, the veggies on pizza and salad are so fresh & I love that they always have red peppers. Potato crust is so good. Great place for delivery & summer time on the patio with a cooler!

32.description: THE BEST PIZZA IN CHICAGO! BYOB on the patio!  Dominick the owner is a most gracious host.  Family business. Get some of the homemade Italian ice and bring some vodka, listen to some tunes on the patio.  The best place to relax in the summer.  A gem on the South Side!   Reasonable prices, gluten free, vegetarian and vegan pizzas available as well. My recommendation: the Tata's signature pizza.

44.description: I absolutely LOVE this place. If u like sweet pizza sauce then this is the place to order from. Although their prices are a little more than other area pizzas, it is totally worth it. They have fast delivery as well. You can also walk in for a slice and pop. They have recently built an outdoor patio area too. Looks great! They also have a sit down area in the back.

24.description: I ordered from tata's last night.  Called close to closing time (probably within minutes) and the gentleman that answered the phone could not have been nicer.  The Za arrived in what seemed like a split second.  The driver,delivery person was exceptionally friendly as well!  I thought I was being punked!  There are not a lot of people "out there" that act in this manner!  I even apologized for the ice on my stairs and the man made a comment on the Chicago weather!  WHAT???And YES, the pizza was insanely delicious!

7.description: Much better than the place down the street... Writing this review is making me want to make an unplanned Tatas order!

40.description: This has become my favorite neighborhood pizza place. It just has that home made quality about it. You can tell from the photo up there...the pieces are irregular, rough-cut, toppings are strewn about. The ingredients are fresh and the crust is nice. Good value, too. Very spartan, utilitarian look to the place. Owner seems like an odd bird, probably never worked this kind of service industry position because he kind of lacks social skills. Just sort of grunts and slides the pizza at you. This might bother some but it adds to the appeal for me. He's just a no-nonsense pizza maker. People think I look unfriendly and unappraochable too.

30.description: The pizza is just okay, but this business does not care about the customer.  We complained that the pizza was under cooked and the owner told us that it was fine and would not do anything about it as he didn't care because this is just his hobby.  Stay away as the owner does not care.  So wanted to like this place.

46.description: Exactly the way pizza should be - good, fresh and cheap.Part of a block of unexpected vegan and vegetarian delights (right across the street from Veggie Bite), they make vegan pizza with soy cheese here if you want it.  But I didn't tonight - Tonight I wanted sliced porky goodness atop a cheese of cowy goodness.  Tata's did not disappoint.With the Blackhawks game on above him, we got to see the guy make all of the pizzas himself while shooting the shit - everything is all out in the open and pretty bare bones, no seating.The tomato sauce is very fresh and tomatoey, not too salty.  We got pepperoni that had a nice amount of spicy zing  to it.  The crust was fairly thin and a bit crunchy on the edges - nice. Seriously, this thing got tore up at my house in a matter of minutes - even the baby was saying more in baby language "Mowaa! Mowaa!"Not at all the best pizza I ever had, but the combination of tasty quality and a good price earns it big time stars.  Maybe next time I'll try the thick and puffy potato dough crust they say is their specialty....An extra large with a bunch of pepperoni on it took them about 15 minutes to make and cost less than $18 bucks. And he gave us a liter of Squirt to go with it. Sweet.

1.description: family owned and operated with a huge investment in the neighborhood. If you like sweet sauce and light crust then tatas is the place .  Call in and most times your pizza is ready in 20 mins. !  Where else can you get a Pizza named after the kids ?   Da best!          The Maas family

9.description: We had my daughter's baptism in their party room. It was fantastic, the price was great, the room was nice. They let my Aunt come in early to decorate with tablecloths and banners but didn't add that on to the per-hour room charge. We had about 50 people. The girl who took care of us was great!The food was delicious and affordable and we saved SO MUCH money with the byob, not only byob but byo-pop as well. All of my family who lives in the area is talking about switching to Tatas, their sauce is outstanding!

26.description: We've only just recently started ordering from here but I'm definitely a fan, it's got very similar crust to Beggar's which I love, and you get lotsa sausage and green peppers on the pizza, I also tried the calzone too which was good, nice BYOB patio in the summer, I definitely plan on ordering in the future

25.description: I have ordered here many times and I bought myself a treat for Valentines Day.  I remembered why I love this pizza so much.  This pizza was outstanding.  Their ingredients are so good and I love the sauce. Keep up the great pizza.

12.description: Tata's Pizza I give it a 10 star!!! Me and my fiance christina had our shower here in there back room banquet hall. I been eating pizza with tatas for over a year and her family over 5 years and there pizza is excellent on point. But when we had other food from there OMG!! There meatballs and italian sausage, mostaccoli is to die for I had to take the left overs it will not go into waste! Beautiful place, excellent service and dominic and his daughter natalie are great owners!! This place in my opinion ranks #1 in the area and just in the south period..... great food, comfortable and its BYOB!!

21.description: Have had really good and really bad experiences.  The good:  the italian beef and giardinara pizza has been down right delicious and a great value for the price.  Also very good was the meatball pizza.  The problem recently has been consistency.  Which leads to the bad and the bad was my latest delivery which was a pile of ingredients without a crust/dough underneath.  Almost unedible, maybe they forgot to put the dough on, not sure but it was possibly the worst delivery pizza ever. i am willing to give a pass because they are usually good.   When cooked correctly the pizza is great, when not its aweful.  This could depend on who is cooking that day.

17.description: The owner is a big huge jerk.  Service was terrible and the owner was extremely rude. They don't tell you abt the corking fee until it's too late. A horrible, horrible experience. There are plenty of other places with good pizza. You shouldn't have to put up with what we had to put up with.

10.description: We love Tata's! I don't even like pizza and I really like Tata's pizza. Their sauce and crust are really good, and they definitely do not skimp on the cheese. And the cheese melts in your mouth. Every time I call for pick-up, they say it'll be about 15 minutes and the pizza is always ready - and super hot and fresh. We also love their homemade Italian ice in the summer :)

5.description: This place is awesome! The pizza is phenomenal, and if you go in the good weather seasons, their BYOB patio is an awesome spot to dine. Their delivery drivers are great as well.
