3.description: Well, I'd love to be able to review the actual food, but the owner was so incredibly rude to me on the phone that we didn't place our take out order. Let me explain: A couple of weeks ago I won a free Tata's pizza while playing Chili's Bar Bingo. The coupon featured the Tata's logo, address, phone number, etc. The date on the coupon was 10/15/15, valid for 30 days after that date on Monday's only. So we decided to give it a try last night. The girl on the phone was very nice and sweet and kindly told me that the business no longer accepts these coupons and hasn't in over two years. I was a little puzzled and questioned her about it, as Chili's seems to be pretty reputable company that offers these types of "prizes" every week at a ton of different bars in the area. She was very apologetic and after her explanation, she offers me the opportunity to speak to the owner. I hear her explaining the situation to him before giving him the phone. He immediately gets on the phone, no hello or friendly greeting, he just immediately says "I don't know where you got that from or who the hell is using my name, but we stopped giving those away years ago, I am not honoring that coupon" Again, I have no problem with him not accepting my freebie coupon if I received it in error. However, when I attempted to tell him that he should contact Chili's and let them know, he wouldn't let me talk and just kept saying "I'm not honoring it!!!" Ok guy. I get it. You don't want my business. I'm going to assume that he pegged me as a cheapo who wouldn't still place an order if he didn't honor my coupon. Well, he was wrong. Had he been the slightest bit of a nice guy about the whole thing, we would have gladly still placed an order. Instead, he was a total jerk to me. It is really a shame, because I keep hearing about how great the Italian beef is. Too bad I won't get the chance to try it.

35.description: Super fast delivery - new favorite Beverly pizza. LOVE IT!

19.description: Worst service ever. Never go here. They told us the patio was closed when clearly it was not. There were multiple people eating and the server looked at us and didn't say anything. They lost business from what would have been a large order. Do not waste your time for mediocre pizza.

28.description: Delivery is quick, the pizza was hot and delicious. I love their sauce because it is sweet and delicious. I am definitely ordering from there again!

45.description: I LOVE their veggie pizza! The owner and staff of this pizzeria are very nice. They've donated to the Beverly Arts Center a bunch of times - pizzas of course! And they always let me hang up our posters. The food is delicious and a pretty reasonable price! They recently added a patio/ cafe in the back - it looks adorable, but I haven't actually sat in there yet. Just thinking about it makes me hungry!

33.description: This is far and away my favorite place to have a meal outside. When the weather is nice and the patio is open, it is a fantastic place to bring your friends, a cooler and your appetite! We have also taken advantage of renting out the party room in the back for low key relaxed family celebrations. You can tell it is a family owned business and they take pride in their product because it is delicious. The staff are also very friendly and create a welcoming environment. Hands down one of the best pizzas in the area for reasonable prices.

43.description: I decided to give this pizza a try based on the great reviews but, it fell short. For one the pizza was cold and soggy and the taste was awful. The sauce was good but all the other ingredients were sub par. The cheese had the texture and taste of a frozen pizza and the sausage tasted more like hamburger than Italian sausage. My wife said she has had better frozen pizzas than this and, I have to agree. The price was low for the family size at only $17 but I would rather pay a bit more for a better pizza since we threw away the leftovers which we never do with other pizzas

2.description: Italian beef with giardiniera so good! After a road trip to Colorado and no decent pizza, I was craving my neighborhood favorite. I wanted something different and went for the Italian beef. What a treat! The garlic bread also killer with a side of sauceI they're quick, friendly, and reasonably priced, but most of all, just great pizza! I highly recommend.

18.description: The pizza is good and the prices are reasonable, but the way this business is ran is disappointing.  I raved about the pizza to a friend so we decided to go for lunch.  What a mistake.  After finding the "entrance" we were greeted with disgust.  How dare we read the large banner outside that says Italian ice and pizza by the slice and come in asking for a menu to order?  They have absolutely no seating and do not use their beer garden at all.  What a waste of a great location, size, and pretty good pizza in a poorly ran business.My family will still call and order pizza from here, but it is sad to see such a great opportunity for this place to thrive and they don't take advantage of it at all.

41.description: We go there for family birthday parties. Always take home a pie with fresh baby spinach & fresh mushrooms. Yum!

4.description: It's like a cross between Palermo's and Rosangelas. Those have always been my 2 favorite pizzas. Tata's has taken the #1 spot for sure.

6.description: This review is based entirely on the quality of the pizza.  I've ordered take out twice.  The first time to try a different place, different pizza.  The next time because we had some people over and I wanted to give it another chance.  Both times the pizza was not that great.  This is not a very flavorful pizza in my opinion, and it seems to have a slightly sweeter sauce.  It's not bad though, more like meh.

22.description: Best thin crust pizza in Mt. Greenwood....I suggest trying meatball and roasted red peppers won't disappoint

15.description: The pizza at Tata's is fantastic! The crust is hand tossed and the ingredients are really fresh.  We had the vege pizza which was loaded with red and green peppers, onions, mushrooms and tomatoes. It's BYOB and you can sit outside.  The server was friendly and the prices are good. They also have great Italian ice!  You should definitely try it!

20.description: The pizza at Tata's is fantastic! The crust is hand tossed and the ingredients are really fresh.  We had the vege pizza which was loaded with red and green peppers, onions, mushrooms and tomatoes. It's BYOB and you can sit outside.  The server was friendly and the prices are good. They also have great Italian ice!  You should definitely try it!

36.description: I think this is one of those love-it-or-hate-it places. My husband and I love this pizza, and our young adult kids always object. (But since we're buying it, I guess their vote doesn't count!) Anyway, I really like the crust and the sauce, and they layer on toppings like crazy. Mmm. The kids say the sauce is too sweet and there's too much cheese. (Can there ever be too much cheese?) Maybe it is a little on the sweet side, but that's fine with me. It's also very reasonable. I should mention that this review only addresses the carry-out, not the outdoor patio. I haven't tried that yet so I can't assess the service. Personal favorite: sausage/mushroom/garlic. But give other combos a try; you'll probably like it.

14.description: We've only just recently started ordering from here but I'm definitely a fan, it's got very similar crust to Beggar's which I love, and you get lotsa sausage and green peppers on the pizza, I also tried the calzone too which was good, nice BYOB patio in the summer, I definitely plan on ordering in the future

58.description: The food was horrible i felt as if i were eating a tub of butter with salt! The eggs benedict had no taste! The biscuits and gravey tasted like cream of chicken soup! The service was fine! The main reason i will not be returning is when  i was done paying my 75$ bill and sat back down to chat with my friends a hostess had the nerve to come over and if we were gonna be leaving anytime soon! I had literally just paid the bill! I have no intent to return i am all about giving second chances when it comes to bad service or shitty food! We all have off days but when im literally being pushed out of the door i am not happy at all!

56.description: Quick service and great food! This place pulls in a good sized crowd even on weekdays. I highly reccomend the bacado, or the caballero.

29.description: This was the best breakfast I've had in a long time! If you love Oreos, you must come here and try the Oreo pancakes! The service was so pleasant, felt like I was with family.

42.description: Big portions give way to tasty bfast dishes at reasonable prices.  I had a great omelet and big fluffy pancakes.  Will be back for sure.

23.description: located where the Omelet House used to be, I enjoyed it better when it was that. Pretty standard breakfast/ lunch place, very friendly staff, okay food. I ordered the bacado omelet, which supposed to be avocado, bacon and cheese served with salsa but it was more like a bacon and cheese omelet and the salsa was forgotten. My partner had the blue bayou, which did not impress him. Coffee was just okay, no flavored creamers. All in all not worth the drive for us.

47.description: I came in today for lunch as their breakfasts have been ok in the past. The breakfast specials are available all day but I went for a lunch club sandwich.  It was great~!  I got chicken, avocado, bacon, and cheese with fries and a pickle.  They serve all of their meals with a slice of fruit (watermelon this time!), and it's a nice touch.  The portions are generous and it's certainly enough to fill up and even take some home.  The service was a bit off, as in, the waitress forgot about me, adn she spilled water on another customer...I haven't seen her before, and will go for benefit of the doubt.   She was apologetic and provided pretty good service once she remembered I was there.  It's definitely a family-friendly, family-run ambiance, and the gentleman they have working the floor (bussing tables, providing water, cleaning) is phenomenal and very friendly.  It's a no-frills kind of place where you can get a good breakfast or lunch.

8.description: I've been here several times and keep coming back because the food is delicious. If you go on a Sunday morning it's jammed, so yes it may be a little messy in there but I have kids and know why. It's a reasonable scenario when it's so packed there is a short wait for their to be maybe a few crumbs or a butter wrapper on the floor. However, go Saturday or during the week the carpet is clean and they keep up.The wait staff has always been good outside of today but one time out of maybe 6 or 7 times can happen anywhere. I'm giving this place 5 stars because they seat you quickly, the food is just delicious (and I've had all versions of food there) the wait staff hustles and the prices are fair.

31.description: Wow - Yelp has finally failed me. In Yelp I trust has been crushed by this breakfast find. Granted this might be the "best" place in this particular area - as that's where I was when i was searching my iPhone Yelp app for breakfast - but this is nothing more than your typical joint. Maybe I needed to go beyond the Eggs Benedict which was sub-par to say the least (with oil streaks in the Hollandaise Sauce) . Saw some Mexican inspired items on the menu that might be better? I would hope? Not sure if there would another time on this one. Otherwise - these mediocre restaurants are a dime a dozen.

34.description: Had breakfast here today and felt the need to yelp about this place as soon as I got home! That's how great my experience was here today! Waitress was very attentive and nice and food was delicious.  I got the low-carb omelet and my better half got a breakfast croissant sandwich.  The manager or owner came around and asked us how our breakfast was and even boxed up our leftovers even though we didn't plan to take it home. There was some leftover bacon and he insisted we could make a BLT tomorrow or today for lunch!! It was pretty funny! We went to pay the bill and were given a to-go soup just for stopping in.  Of all the places to go for breakfast this place won me over! I will be back there just based on today's wonderful experience.  With all the stresses of normal life it was nice to be treated just a tad bit special ( even though it was just a bowl of soup, it was a nice gesture!)....Thank you!!!

16.description: Everytime I go here I have a great meal and amazing service. They have a big menu with plenty of options and there's usually a decent amount of people in there dining as well; making the atmosphere very relaxed. I look forward to paying my bill up front and crossing my fingers that they give me some free soup that they have stashed under the register! Yum!

13.description: Love their food. Never have had to wait more than 10 minutes and the skillets are amazing!

11.description: I've been coming here for breakfast since 2011. I always enjoy my meal (usually a skillet) and you can't be the prices. My son (2y/o) finishes his plate most visits, and he's picky so that's saying something.

39.description: This place was just "ok".The good things were:1. They were open on a holiday (I went on the Fourth of July) 2. My waitress was pleasant 3. The wait time was reasonable What I didn't like:The food was "just ok" (in terms of how it tasted). I ordered the "Health Nut Omelette" which consisted of egg whites, avocado, turkey bacon & cheese" my toast (of which I upgraded to French instead) was also "nothing to write home about". The coffee was decent but I prefer flavored cream (as opposed to adding more sugar) and they only had regular cream.Overall, my experience was decent but not somewhere I'd be looking to return especially when there's Lumes & Original House of Pancakes.

37.description: I thoroughly enjoyed the cheesy decor and the prompt service, but my omelette (chicken fajita) was overcooked. The fact is that I just hate overcooked eggs. Also, the honeydew melon was practically white. It was so white, my friend accidentally ate some of the rind!However, I really, really liked the pancakes. I don't know if it was that I hadn't had some in so long or if they actually were really tasty, but if I go again, I think I would just have pancakes.Mmmm . . . pancakes.

0.description: I called and spoke to Katie, she said it wasn't busy so I got there quickly! I let her know we spoke on the phone and I was the lady new to Oak Lawn, she told the server about me when I sat at the counter and the server ( Courtney I believe) was very friendly. A really kind Greek woman who is the owner or perhaps was the manger even sat down and talked to me. We had a great conversation and I told her I will definitely be there a couple of times a month. Great service!The food was awesome and affordable. I had the eggs Benedict which average $12-$16 at Yolk & Nookie but this was 8.99 and delicious.I would love to give this place more than 5 stars, everyone was so kind and I look forward to coming back!

38.description: Stopped in the other day hungry for veggies and eggs. Tried the (egg white) Mexican Omelette, complete with avocado, onion, jalapeño, tomato, jack cheeses, and sides of salsa and sour cream. Eggs were a little runny but such was to be expected with the lack of yolk. Omelette was a bit under-seasoned, and could've used some salt and pepper. Solid hash browns, married with a hint of butter. Service was friendly throughout, and food-to-table time was lightning fast. Menu prices were a tad above market, but manageable. Overall, a pretty good wooden spoon breakfast spot on the Southside.

51.description: It's a breakfast place. There are eggs. There are pancakes. But there is nothing here that stands out as special. The food is well prepared and better than average diner food, but it's nothing to write home about.

27.description: In great effort to expand our horizons for an early feast, fair maiden Emily and I ventured forth towards the Greenwood of the Mountains and the haven of Beverly. Lo and behold, nestled into an ancient and equally odd "L" shaped strip mall, lay a coveted eatery eagerly whispered in yelp legends of the past!"TO NIKOS" I shouted, remounting my steed before setting a furious pace towards the target. Ignoring the gaze of many of an obviously jealous onlooker, we eagerly sauntered inside to bear witness a great crowd.Such a crowd was quite boisterous, to my bewilderment, as spirits were not being served. What could prompt such a jovial mood? Fair-maiden Emily and I were greeted quite enthusiastically by the female host, who glanced around for but a quick moment before offering us seats at the counter! Ah, such an offer fit a lord such as myself, as this opportunity allowed me to supervise the creation of our meals. There would be no rapscallion-like activity when it came to the preparation of our meals! No sir! And it was done. A perfectly created meal that rivaled any in the area. Fair Emily was pleased, a feat that does not happen quite easily when it comes to great feasts of dawn. And add to the matter that she eat not beast nor fowl, and that is especially noble!Yes, Sir Niko, I applaud you. Huzzah!

32.description: Besides there being too many sanitation issues for me, the food and service is not that good. Couldn't figure out why the crowd. Turkey sausage had an off taste and I couldn't figure out how the egg whites were prepared. They were like none other that I've had. The whole place just has a dirty look and feel to it. Leaving a dirty mop in plain sight so you see it when you enter and exit the rest room is something everyone in the restaurant business should know not to do. Also, the dirty looking busboys need to be told not to handle the the silverware by the end that goes in your mouth when they are setting the tables. Just a whole sloppy unappetizing feeling sitting in there.  If you do decide to go there, bring your own extra napkins cause you won't get them from the waitress or the manager (owner ?) who promised to bring them right over. Didn't think it was such an impossible task to fulfill.

54.description: I had the Countryside Skillet and I ate every last bite, it was so delicious. I cannot wait to go again so that I could try something else, maybe next weekend, lol!

48.description: DifferentI have been to many breakfast places and most of them offer the same fare.Not Niko's, they do have some of the same items but they also have some new items.I was there more than a week ago and still thinking about their food. I had the bocado omelet and the Spanish omelet. I love avocado in any shape or form, raw or cooked. When I saw that they had an bocado omelet I new what I wanted. It comes with bacon and it is really good. But the Spanish omelet is even better with onions and mushrooms. They also have some of the best hash browns I have ever had. Toasty and perfectly seasoned. Pancakes are good as well. In my list to try now is the skillets, they look amazing.The place is located in a strip mall next to a gas station. Very easy to pass it but if you have this place in mind you will go around maybe a couple of times until you find it. At least that is what I did and it was worth it.Service is a little nicer than most diners. Price wise is comparable.

44.description: Best French Toast around.  Great service and even better food.

24.description: Excellent for what it is. Huge portions, reasonable prices, and genuinely good food. Don't expect a revolution, but for a breakfast diner I really can't ask anything more.

7.description: this place is great!!  definitely will bring home a doggie bag.  huge portions ...  never had a bad meal in here. there omelets are excellent. . I would recommend everone to try this place.

49.description: Great food, great portions, great service!  I wish I could make it here more often but when we do have time to make it the food is always great.  I highly recommend it!  It's not a fancy place like some of the other less favorable reviewers are looking for but the food and service is great.

40.description: Nikos breakfast club, serving the best skirt steak and eggs on the South side in this overrated neighborhood. I eat here at least 2x a month. The skirt is marinated, cooked over a flame grill, not a flat top. Skillets are great, I prefer a little heat so avocado, chorizo, cheese, peppers and salsa please. (They can improve the salsa but hey, it's a breakfast joint) the reason I only gave 4/5 stars, your bathrooms need attention. Serious attention. They are gross. On the flip side, staff and management, awesome. Nice people.

53.description: We are regulars here.  The owners and staff are out of this world friendly and make you feel so at home.  The veggie skillet is awesome and has asparagus in it which is delicious!  Most dishes are really good, but the mexican breakfast tacos are not my favorite.  Also, the BLT needs more bacon!  The crepes are great as well as the french toast and pancakes!

30.description: The breakfast here is fresh and delicious! The service is fantastic and you get your food very quickly, as well as free refills on coffee!!!

46.description: After reading the predominantly positive reviews, I decided to give Niko's a try. The wife and I dropped in this morning for breakfast. I had the Countryside skillet, and my wife had the bacon and eggs. The skillet, although greasy, was very tasty, and the serving size was more than enough. I couldn't eat all of it. My wife had the traditional bacon and eggs. She liked hers as well. The waitress was very friendly and kept my coffee cup filled. We never had to ask for anything: she checked in with us often to make sure everything was ok. The pancakes that came as part of the deal were very good too (almost as good as mine according to the wife). All in all a positive experience. I would recommend this restaurant.

1.description: Typical local breakfast spot.  They make everything and they make it all well.  My personal favorite is the crepe suzette served with orange butter sauce and fresh strawberries.  Although in all honesty,  the crepes can be a little thicker than they should be.  That aside they are delicious.  The menu includes all of your breakfast standards skillets,  pancakes,  waffles, omelets, etc. As well as salads, sandwiches and burgers.  I have yet to have anything subpar. It's a great spot for a quick homemade cheap meal.

55.description: This place is amazing. I'm glad that I stay in the neighborhood. My mom initially introduced me to this place. The first time she took me, the staff was so nice and spoke to her as if she was a regular (I'm starting to find out now where she goes every Saturday morning). We are always seated right away and fresh coffee once we sit down. Everything from this place is great! They also fix your food until its perfect for you! Nice portions and a great price point....This is the best breakfast place! I think I will go this Saturday :)

9.description: Breakfast portions are delicious and HUGE. Every meal comes with a cantaloupe as well. I had the biscuits and gravey with a huge helping of hash browns. Everything was great including the service.

26.description: We've never had a bad dining experience here. Friendly and attentive waitresses, who work quickly to make sure your breakfast is served hot and fresh. Excellent!! Great family atmosphere.

25.description: WHAT A JOKE! I wish I could give this place negative stars. This place is by far THE WORST. Every time we've gone here, we have had nothing but problems with our meal. We witnessed 4 other tables send their food back today. I'm just so appalled with this establishment. I will make sure to tell ALL of my friends and family about this piece of crap restaurant. If you want good breakfast and are right by the breakfast club, keep driving. You'll be able to find something better than this place. You could go to McDonalds and get a better meal, and they probably won't screw up your order or find random pieces of human parts in your food.

12.description: This place is usually pretty busy, and for good reason (besides not being very big). Despite being so busy, we've almost never had to wait for a table. Food is delicious, price is reasonable and service is helpful even though they are running around so much. I recommend the Fiesta skillet.

59.description: I heard alot of good things from people. But I was not impressed. I will say they were very nice and friendly. But for the food my eggs were a little runny and they messed up another part of my order. The place just wasnt for me...

21.description: I come here when I am looking for a good bowl of soup and a hearty sandwich for lunch. There is nothing too fancy on this menu, it is pretty typical, but the staff is quite nice, the service has always been good, and they are clean. I had one issue with a snippy waitress and the owner/manager? was so sweet and apologetic to me.  Please note that I never even approached her. She came to me and asked if all was well because I cancelled my order.  Such an excellent way to treat customers!

17.description: I thoroughly enjoyed the cheesy decor and the prompt service, but my omelette (chicken fajita) was overcooked. The fact is that I just hate overcooked eggs. Also, the honeydew melon was practically white. It was so white, my friend accidentally ate some of the rind!However, I really, really liked the pancakes. I don't know if it was that I hadn't had some in so long or if they actually were really tasty, but if I go again, I think I would just have pancakes.Mmmm . . . pancakes.

10.description: Love this place:) very good! I always end up getting the corned beef hash and eggs... So yummy! The owner is a super nice guy too!!

5.description: No soup today, but the breakfast was great. I had the Hungry Man Omelette, and my daughter had the Vegetable Omelet. Niko's is a nice friendly restaurant. Always busy

3.description: Standard family-owned breakfast spot. Fast service and good food. Sit at the bar if you want to hear gossip. I was thoroughly entertained.

35.description: Excellent food and wait staff.  Relaxing atmosphere.   Will go back again.  Reasonable prices.

19.description: Stopped in the other day hungry for veggies and eggs. Tried the (egg white) Mexican Omelette, complete with avocado, onion, jalapeño, tomato, jack cheeses, and sides of salsa and sour cream. Eggs were a little runny but such was to be expected with the lack of yolk. Omelette was a bit under-seasoned, and could've used some salt and pepper. Solid hash browns, married with a hint of butter. Service was friendly throughout, and food-to-table time was lightning fast. Menu prices were a tad above market, but manageable. Overall, a pretty good wooden spoon breakfast spot on the Southside.

28.description: Great service, a little cold sitting in front by the door. Waitress was attentive and quick. Minimum food wait time. Definitely come back

45.description: Niko's is easily one of the best breakfast spots in the Mount Greenwood area. Located right across the street from Chas high school, and within the Bank of America parking lot.Great menu with tons of options. The omelets (about 20 choices) are my favorite. Omelets range from the Spanish Omelet to the healthy choice of the Egg White Omelet. All omelets come with your choice of grits or hash-browns. Most orders also come with your choice of fruit, and pancakes, English muffin, or toast.Service is far above average. The Hispanic woman working the front register I believe to be the manager is always more than polite. The waitresses are always more than attentive. If you're unsure of a menu selection, just ask! They don't mind.I eat here about once a month and have yet to have one single complaint. Check em out!

33.description: Best breakfast place around SXU. Cant go wrong with any selection. My favorites are the Countryside Skillet and the Greek Isle Skillet. Their omelets are really good too.Service is great and wait time isn't too bad unless its Sunday after mass. Regardless, its well worth the wait.

43.description: Came here awhile ago with a friend who'd heard good things.  Overall, I just was not impressed.The whole restaurant just looks dated and kind of runned-down, but I can forget poor aesthetics for good food.  Unfortunately the food I got just wasn't good.  I got the eggs benedict florentine, and the spinach was not fresh.  It tasted slightly off like spinach that was a step away from starting to rot.I haven't been back, and with much better options like Flapjack's, Stacked, and even Golden Bear, it's unlikely I'll ever return.

2.description: Good food,good service,average price,try a few breskfast places around,this is the best one! Everything looks clean,food is hot and fresh made,so many options,waitress are nice,will come back to try something new.

18.description: DifferentI have been to many breakfast places and most of them offer the same fare.Not Niko's, they do have some of the same items but they also have some new items.I was there more than a week ago and still thinking about their food. I had the bocado omelet and the Spanish omelet. I love avocado in any shape or form, raw or cooked. When I saw that they had an bocado omelet I new what I wanted. It comes with bacon and it is really good. But the Spanish omelet is even better with onions and mushrooms. They also have some of the best hash browns I have ever had. Toasty and perfectly seasoned. Pancakes are good as well. In my list to try now is the skillets, they look amazing.The place is located in a strip mall next to a gas station. Very easy to pass it but if you have this place in mind you will go around maybe a couple of times until you find it. At least that is what I did and it was worth it.Service is a little nicer than most diners. Price wise is comparable.

41.description: This is your typical "Greek family owned" diner with Mexican cooks......good food, great quantity, and friendly staff.......this place reeks of Chicago......Chicago cops, Chicago city workers, Chicago accents, Chicago Firemen.......it's behind the BP station..."over by dere"

52.description: This is the best breakfast place in all of suburban Chicago as far as I'm concerned. My friends and have gone here on a semi-weekly basis for at least six months. The staff is ALWAYS friendly and patient--we're the kind of people that forget to split the check until we're at the register and they still love us when we come back. The waitresses are always nice, talkative and willing to work with you for your perfect breakfast. Now to the food...the French Toast here is heavenly. I've tried to order other things, but I just can't bring myself to pass it up! The French Toast is perfect. Order it with a side of freshly cooked sausage and always perfect hash browns (seriously--they're always that tasty golden brown) and you will fall into the best food coma you've ever had. My friends have ordered the crepes, the skillets and the lunch items and have loved everything. The food comes quickly, your coffee is refilled at a great pace and the atmosphere is great. My hearty breakfast (classic French Toast, a side and coffee) normally hits from $11 - $13 without tip. For a poor college kid, this can't be an everyday thing at that price; however, it is worth EVERY cent. If you're in the neighborhood, go here. If you live in the neighborhood and you haven't,  do it. It's just a fantastic place.

50.description: Great dives rule and I LOVE me a quality greasy spoon, but  ya gotta wow me with a stand out. Upon two recent visits they got my entire order wrong. Although the waitress was apologetic and personable...getting even one aspect of my food correct was a hassle. On the upside, the fruit was super fresh and they were generous with their iced tea refills. My eggwhite and avocado omelette was fluffy, lean and yummy, but between the spoiled cream curdling in my coffee and how forgetful the staff was (despite it was not crowded when I placed my order) I won't be back.  Not a bad spot, but there's better breakfast for my buck.

4.description: Niko's is homey type of diner that immediately makes you feel like you've been coming here for 20+ years. I ordered the frittata Santa Fe which is essentially an open-faced omelette with green onion, bell pepper, avocado, cheese and bacon. It also comes with crispy fried potatoes. All of these were fantastic, but the X factor was their salsa! I was pleasantly surprised at the flavor of what seemed to be homemade salsa. It complimented my frittata so well. No matter what you're getting I would ask for a side of that. Yummy! Side note - roosters...everywhere!

6.description: It's not totally a lost cause. I read a lot of the reviews and they way over blew the quality of this restaurant. Service isn't great. Staff was running around like chickens with their heads chopped off. No organization or communication between each other. I went there one time and the cost was completely different for a custom order. Hearing the staff yelling at other staff is unappealing. That's just the service. Let's talk about the food. Now, when we first went here the food wasn't bad. The second time the hashbrowns were completely burnt. Almost smoldered together into a solid piece of blackness. My girlfriend's eggs were not cooked as requested. If you're going to price your food like others make the quality and experience better. Inexperienced service staff and business owners. This place needs work.

22.description: Had breakfast there on 10/3/2014, and sadly since my last review Niko's has gone down in quality. Omelet was smaller and not as good, it looked like it was made from some contraption you see advertised on late night t.v. The hash browns were very dry and over cooked. And the portions are smaller. The wait staff is still friendly and efficient but the food needs work. Everyone has a bad day, I will go there again but if I have the same experience it will be the last.

15.description: I just gave this 5 stars and I would've easily given it 6. The food was SO good. My boyfriend and friend got burgers which were delicious and huge my other friend got a club sandwich that could easily feed a family of 4 and I got a frittata. Burgers are hand packed our food was fresh and hot not to mention awesome service! It cost us about 35$ for the four of us. Can't wait to go back.

57.description: Love love LOVE this place!  Wonderful service and the owners always are there to make sure everyone is taken care of.  Food is always done just the way we like it.  I have a son with special needs and they are very accomodating unlike many other family restaurants I've been to.    Generous portions and just plain old good homemade food.  THE place to go for breakfast!

20.description: I've been coming here for breakfast since 2011. I always enjoy my meal (usually a skillet) and you can't be the prices. My son (2y/o) finishes his plate most visits, and he's picky so that's saying something.

36.description: I just gave this 5 stars and I would've easily given it 6. The food was SO good. My boyfriend and friend got burgers which were delicious and huge my other friend got a club sandwich that could easily feed a family of 4 and I got a frittata. Burgers are hand packed our food was fresh and hot not to mention awesome service! It cost us about 35$ for the four of us. Can't wait to go back.

14.description: Very greasy and salty. The waitress kept handling her personal phone and then toasted my English muffin with the same dirty hands. I was so grossed out.  Go to Stacked.

1.description: Everyone is familiar with Subway; however, this Subway is somewhat different. This Subway is open 24 hours which is nice if you want to get something late besides McDonald's. The workers at this McDonald's are very kind and generous. They're always attentive and polite to the customers. There is a man in the neighborhood who is less fortunate and completely harmless and I noticed that at this Subway they let him sit inside when it's cold out and they gave him a cookie. I'm unsure if they gave it to him for free but I'm assuming they did. I just thought this Subway was deserving of a good review! It's nice to see workers showing compassion for others!

0.description: Love the staff!! VERY CLEAN! They even remembered my name and exact order!

3.description: This is about my fourth time in Nicole Marie for my hair being curled (weddings Christmas party etc) and again I left feeling fabulous! I asked for big, curly and wild and got exactly that. I appreciate the fact that Nicole Marie is super chic and trendy and you get what you ask for! The staff are knowledgable personable and extremely polite. I highly recommend this salon!

1.description: Wow, I am shocked to see such a negative review posted below...  I would have to 100% disagree.  I have been going to Nicole Marie salon since it has opened, and can't say enough about it.  If you want stylists who truly know what they are doing, and care about their customers satisfaction then you must try this salon.  Every time I leave there I feel like a New woman!  It is shame that Susan had a bad experience, But do not let that stop you from experiencing the truly best hair stylists in the neighborhood and an overall wonderful team of compassionate, amazing artists!  See for yourselves, you won't be disappointed.

0.description: Love love love!! Moved to Mount Greenwood so I had to say good bye to my suburban hair salon. Mary Ryan is amazing and worked miracles. I will definitely keep coming back!!!!!!!!

2.description: FABULOUS SALON!!! I came to Nicole Marie for my first time on Saturday and couldn't be any more in love with it. First off, the salon itself is chic, sexy, gorgeous...the vibe is everything. I was looking to have my hair styled for a wedding later that night so I made my appointment with Mary. She is a doll and did EXACTLY what I wanted! The curls and volume were larger than life, and the style lasted well into Sunday ;) Nicole Marie and her team of experts are the real deal...this salon is it. I can not wait to be back for a cut and color. Amazing!

5.description: Nicole Marie Salon and the stylists there are the best on the southside. Nicole and her team are great at working together and making sure that every customer leaves looking and feeling beautiful! The atmosphere is fun, inviting, and relaxing.    It's chic and modern but still gives a warm and friendly vibe. I love the set up because the stylists and clients all engage together and are able to talk and get to know one another. Nicole cuts and colors my hair regularly and I always get compliments! She knows my hair and I whole heartedly trust her to make me look my best. I've gotten blow outs by Jen and Julie and they've been great! Mary cuts and colors my moms hair, and she's never looked better. My mom has had the same style my whole life until I took her with me to the salon. My friends who've seen her new look say she looks 15 years younger. I can see her new found confidence- it's crazy how much of a difference good hair can make on someone! Bottom line- this team of stylists are passionate about what they do and you're in good hands in their salon. Nicole Marie is the best of the best.

6.description: I can't believe I just read such a negative review posted from "Susan F". After attending a wedding a few weeks ago, and seeing the amazing job Nicole did on the ENTIRE bridal party: hair and makeup, I was blown away! Her work ranks right up there with those seen in "Brides" magazine! So happy to see we have such a talented cosmetologist in our neck of the woods.

7.description: Love it there! Have always left totally happy! The salon itself is super cute and everyone is very friendly. :)

8.description: THE BOMB!!! I've been going to Nicole Marie Salon since it has opened and I've NEVER had a bad experience. I've gotten everything from makeup, up do's, hair chalk,  cut and color and have left satisfied every time. The stylists are ALL amazing and show they truly care about making you feel good. So many times I've gone in with pictures or visions to show exactly what I wanted done and the girls exceeded my expectations every time. I was just there today and met their new front desk girls, Molly and Jenna, and I was blown away by how welcoming, inviting, and hard working they were. I've never received such a nice greeting upon arrival. What a great addition to the staff!!! I would highly recommend this salon to any and all... they don't disappoint! I love, love Nicole Marie Salon and would never go anywhere else!!

9.description: I love Nicole Marie's! I've gotten my hair cut/color twice and loved it both times.  It's really cute inside too- very Northside class on the southside.

10.description: Beautiful, trendy salon in Mount Greenwood is just what the neighborhood needed. Nikki is the owner and has styled this business to to be hip and modern without scaring off the over 35 crowd. Exposed brick, gorgeous and comfortable white leather chairs and adjustable shampoo bowls ensure that every client can soak in the relaxed surroundings while getting pampered. Teri is an amazing colorist and her precision cuts cannot be beat. She takes her time, cross checks her cuts and makes sure you are 100% happy when you leave. My friend goes to Jen and is extremely happy with her work, too. Nikki has a great eye for what cuts and styles look good on a wide range of people, and she is friendly as well. I'm so glad that I don't have to leave my neighborhood to patronize a salon of this caliber!

4.description: Nicole Marie Salon is exactly what the neighborhood needs! Nicole and her team are just as cute and stylish as the modern decor here. These girls love what they do and it shows in their work. Whether you are looking for something fresh and trendy or going for a classic look, Nicole and her team can do it all. I got my hair cut and colored there tonight and loved it so much I booked the entire salon for my wedding party!!! Thanks again girls!

3.description: Good place to grab a quick dinner for the family.  I usually take out or hit the drive thru because the dining area is kinda small and not very comfy.The food is good, the staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable. Verdict:  Nothing fancy here, no real standout dish, just good fried chicken , sides, and sandwiches for a quick meal when you are not up for cooking.

1.description: Twice, I've gone to Brown's Chicken in Oaklawn, il and twice I'd asked for someone else to make my food! The last time, I walked OUT!!!!! The manager or supervisor Sheryl or Cheryl  (not for sure of the right spelling of her name), NEVER EVER WEAR GLOVES! This women rubbed her nose, flick her hair and begin to grab food out of the freezer or open the heater for the corn on the cob and turn them..... WITH NO GLOVES! Brown's Chicken in OAKLAWN IL, is DIRTY! This women Cheryl or Sheryl, when asked to put on gloves, she didn't, then the security guard, walked in kitchen part, where food is being cook and grab food!!!! UNBELIEVABLE, WHAT TYPE OF FILTH OF A RESTAURANT IS THIS!!!!!  OBVIOUSLY, BROWN'S CHICKEN OWNERS ARE FULL OF FILTH THEMSELVES!

2.description: Pros: Good Chicken.  Great fried mushrooms.  Quick and friendly service.Cons: Every booth was dirty.  2 chicken legs, one small mushroom, one medium drink.  $9.42 OUCH!.50 drink refills.

0.description: I stopped in for lunch and the place was empty but it was also a Monday. The place has some great daily deals and although I did not have Monday's daily deal...it looked good. I ended up having a 3 piece meal and it was A-OK. I prefer the crispiness of KFC and/or the spicyness of Popeyes chicken vs. Brown's seasoning...The service, pricing, cleanliness were good and that's why I give it a solid 3 stars.If you like beef & hot dogs, which I did not have this time around - Brown's chicken will not disappoint - Now that I think about it...I probably prefer the beef vs. the chicken...dig the biscuits too.

4.description: I am writing a review about their Italian Beef, oddly enough. Their chicken is very good, so I won't bother with that. I suspect most people, like myself, would never think of a chicken place as a good place to try Italian Beef. Like going to McD's for salad. However, I finally tried this place, after years of intentions to do so. This is one good f*@*ing sammich. I get the large size, and with extras it can get a little costly. I figure it this way...every bite is awesome, and it will absolutely stuff you, so 7,8,9 bucks is worth it to me. Great Au Jus, with some garlic zip. Great marinara too. Give this a shot. (Drive-thru too! I couldn't be any lazier!)

1.description: Best subway I ever had . Staff is very friendly. Store is always clean and nice . Bathroom is always clean . Food is fresh . I love it

2.description: I give it two stars for the kind and fast service. The food, well...it was subway food and my boys like it so we stopped by for the following sub sandwiches ... chicken breast, ham, turkey, and steak & cheese - all decent as always...Why I took away three stars:1) Minimal Seating2) Minimal Seating plus no clean tables = no where to sit3) One garbage and it was full4) Bathroom was not clean5) We were in before the lunch rush, wonder what it's like during busy timesTip, get in and get out.

0.description: Glad to have this Subway right around the corner from me..  Fresh, healthy, sandwiches and salads, a short walk from home. Can't beat that! The location is kinda small, but it is clean and the staff is courteous.

29.description: Tonight was my second time here in the last four days, I can't believe it took me so long to find this place..it's great!  Food- EXCELLENT!  Both times I had a sandwich but the pasta dishes are very good too.  They start you off with hot garlic rolls, and the menu has a nice variety of steak, pasta, chicken, etc.Drinks- Very cold!Wait Time- Walked right in and sat..you're greeted with a friendly hello!Parking- It's 111th Street, deal with it and find a spot on the street or side street..not a biggie.  God forbid people have to walk a block..it's worth the walk.Staff:  VERY FRIENDLY! Probably my favorite thing about Joseph's is the environment...everyone in there is very nice which I love. Go there peeps...you won't be disappointed!

42.description: A group of my girlfriends went last night to Joseph's and it was phenomenal!  They were super accommodating, as our reservation was for 7:00pm, but being 9 girls we were all late.  Every dish was amazing from the pasta to the chicken to the steak!  All very tasty!  The calamari and toasted ravioli were great starters and salads were plain but really delicious.  The atmosphere is very inviting; they've definitely made improvements, it's much brighter and almost feels like you're in a friend's dining room.  They sat us at a great table in the corner that allowed for us all to catch up, and they didn't seem to mind that we were the last to leave at almost 11:30pm. Overall, great service and the price was right.

23.description: This plAce is awesome! The first time I went here I was skeptical, only because I was never a fan of Richies. But this place blows richies away! The staff is incredible, The service is outstanding and the food is beyond delicious! I've had the shrimp scampi, the chicken francase and the shrimp divolo. They were all amazing in their own way and I can't decide which is my favorite. They also have an extensive list of martinis, my goal is to try all of them! So far my favorite is the chocolate covered raspberry! This small local restaurant is a MUST TRY!

8.description: The stuffed eggplant is to die for and be sure to ask for Adam!!! He's a great server very friendly and played the piano for us!!! We will be back soon!!!

34.description: Place was nice, staff was very friendly. Waiter was attentive and polite. Food was...awful. Rolls with garlic arrived right away, which was nice.Ordered some soup.  Tomato Basil soup was hot and had very good flavor.  Wife ordered a pasta special... penne with shrimp, spinach, and artichoke hearts.  Well, you can add extra 'choke' to the artichoke... RAW.  Hard. Inedible.  The shrimp was an odd whitish color, tasted a little off, so we stopped after the first bite. The pasta was literally dripping with olive oil.  I had the veal parmesan. Huge plate arrived with so much sauce that I had to dig to find the veal  and the noodles.  Noodles were  drowned in olive oil.  The sauce had so much oil it was separating.  The veal was WAY overcooked, tough, and oily.We REALLY wanted to like this place. It is in the neighborhood, is new, clean, and staffed by really nice people.  However, the food is horrid.   We won't be back.

16.description: Betty Mc:   We had a family "surprise birthday" dinner with 9 people on Saturday night. The service and food were wonderful and helped to make the celebration what we hoped it would be  "Special and Fun"!!!!.   A few of us had the specials (Flank steak), others had the Colossal Shrimp (one of my favorites), Veal, and Prime Rib. Everyone enjoyed their entrees.  The ambiance of this restaurant is friendly, the food is excellent as is the service.  Thanks Joseph's for making our night  "the special event" we were hoping for.

13.description: I really had a taste for steak last we and after reading the Yelp reviews thought I would go here.  I had the new york strip, medium, with a baked potatoe and veggies.  The garlic rolls they brought were ok - fresh garlic on top which my daughter did not like, but I wiped off most so it wasn't too bad for her.  Our food came out relatively fast but the steak was the blandest meat I have ever had - absolutely no flavor.  The potatoe was just that, nothing fancy but better than the steak.  I don't like broccoli so didn't touch that.  The waitress didn't come back to check on us for 20 minutes - no drink refills, not to check in, nothing until I asked her for the check.  It wasn't a busy night so not sure why it took so long but I wish I would have had the pasta.  Lesson learned.

11.description: What a great place: first, EXCELLENT food. The shrimp diavolo is a favorite, as are the BBQ ribs and veal Marsala. But the best part about this place is the ambiance: it has a neighborhood, friendly feel and the "piano man" has a knack for putting everyone in a good mood.A south side favorite for sure. A gem.

39.description: We are walking distance from Joseph's and had been meaning to try it out since it opened.   So many of our friends told us how much better it was than the previous restaurant here (which we had several complaints about) so we were anxious to give it a shot .  Of course, the 1st time we went up it was closed (I think it was a Monday) so make sure you check the hours.  We finally made it up in late October for dinner.  Although many of the same delicious meals as Richie's had offered were still on the menu, there were a few small changes that were all for the better.  The best part was no drunk owner came to sit at our table uninvited and ruin our meal....which happened with the previous owner several times.The restaurant itself is great...small and well decorated.  The atmosphere is very comfy and could be either romantic or perfect for family/friends.  I really liked the presentation of the garlic rolls, but like others have said I would have preferred garlic bread or italian bread served with parmesan cheese and olive oil.  They looked great, but were messy and a bit too much garlic taste.   That is saying a lot, since I love garlic and usually order extra garlic on my entrees!  Of course, that did not stop me from eating 3.  We also started with an appetizer of Calamari, which I recommend.  Mmmmmm.I was really wanting a pasta in a white cream sauce and was thrilled when I asked the waitress if the cook would make me cheese tortellini in the white cream sauce from another entree similar to a carbonara .  There was a small substitution fee (which was expected for being a pain in the ass!) but the pasta and sauce were WONDERFUL!  Thanks for catering to a pregnant chic with a craving!  Also to be blamed on the baby, I followed this up with a piece of Tiramisu.  Delicious!  Great service, well timed food preparation and everything was fabulous.  A little pricey, but we also had appetizers and desserts, plus some drinks.  It beats the usual fast food/taco/hot dog places in our area and was a nice change.  We will be back and look forward to many delicious meals here!

37.description: Let me preface this by saying that I haven't actually eaten here. I have only read the menu. Then let me say that.......This is the EXACT same menu as Richies that closed before it.  And the exact same menu as....barracos, palermos, franconellos, Island cafe, blah blah blah. Sorry people. I am just very frustrated with Beverlys LACK of variety in their restaurants. Please someone open a korean BBQ joint, or an Indian restaurant. I'd even settle for a really decent Greek place. Not diner just good greek food. Please. I am begging you. How bout a argentinian empanada shack. Or a east coast seafood place. Okay. I'm done. Sorry Josephs. I'm sure your food is decent. But I get excited about new restaurants in the area and then I see that its just more of the same.

0.description: Husband and I love coming here on the weekend. It had a great menu, and truly amazing staff. Would recommend to anyone. Never leave here disappointed.

38.description: I made the return trip to Joseph's last week, and had another great meal. We started with the stuffed shrimp, and did not look back. The Chicken Fiorentina was cooked just right, and my buddy enjoyed his Joseph's Chicken Special. Catherine was our server, and she did great, a real professional.

27.description: **WARNING-REVIEW BY  EX-EMPLOYEE**I initially started to write a negative review as I wanted to trash this place. But like the stories of young George Washington cutting down the cherry tree, I can not tell a lie.  The meatballs are to die for.  Some of my favorite dishes happen to be the fan favorites, like the lasagna.  The lemon chicken is tasty and delectable.  The colossal shrimp with lobster sauce is out of this world.  **Hint-if you don't like to work for your food, ask the server to have the kitchen remove the shells from the shrimp.  The kitchen is accommodating.  Jay, the owner, may not be much of a front-of-the-house guy, he sure knows his way around the kitchen.  He has created some unique soups i.e. cream of jalapeno.  Be like Mikey and try it, you'll like it.  The servers are awesome and the kitchen is as well.   If you like music with dinner, go in Tuesday through Saturday to hear the piano stylings of Adam.  If you're in the Mt. Greenwood area, stop in for a great dining experience.

32.description: I had the shrimp scampi.  Perfectly cooked shrimp (not over cooked and hard, but just cooked and melt in your mouth.)  The spaghetti was perfectly al dente also and I like that its the thicker style spaghetti.  Our servers are always friendly and the owner is so great.  I like the laid back bar which is great for couples and older clientele to hang around and talk without going to the surrounding watering holes.

44.description: We came here recently for a family dinner, and on the whole were very pleased by the experience. The food was good--everyone liked their entree. I had the calimari and spaghetti--yummy! and members of our party had sausage and penne (which I sampled, excellent) and chicken parmagiana(ditto). Joseph's has a signature bread basket, which are small rolls slathered in oil and garlic, and the waitress kept this filled. Nice idea, but it was a little too garlicky, and no one ate more than one. It was a bit too messy. Plain Italian bread, as well, would have been nice.The prices are not unreasonable, although a little too high for regular dining. There's also a bar that offers a good range of domestic/imported beer and seems to do well with mixed drinks.The waitstaff is excellent. Very friendly and prompt with our orders.We live within walking distance--which is a good thing, because with all the cul-de-sacs in Mt. Greenwood, if you don't find curbside parking you'll have to hoof it from wherever you manage to find a space.The management may want to consider installing noise-absorbing ceiling tiles. It was loud and difficult to converse as the place filled up.I'm glad to see a restaurant of this calibre in the 'hood.

24.description: Arrived at Joseph's at 5:30 on a Saturday to find the restarant with two filled tables.  Asked for a table for three and was told that we would have a thirty minute wait!  We were told that there were a lot of reservations due to arrive at 6:00.  Needless to say, we left.  Had we been seated, we probably would have been out by 6:15.  Very poor business practice.  This is a local place that is never that crowded.  Took our business to another Italian restaurant that had just reopened.

7.description: Went her with my husband because we had a gift certificate. He had lasagna and he didn't really care for it. He said it was too saucy and there wasn't really much cheese in it at all. I had a pasta which was just ok-not much flavor. The waitress was very nice and helpful.

40.description: Very pleased! Dinner for two with drinks -- not too pricey. Food was excellent.

30.description: I have been here a few times now.  My lady's Pop likes this place a ton cause they do gluten-free pasta for him and it is a hop, skip, and jump away from his house.  It has a real family run Italian feel to it.  The staff is very friendly and the owner always says hello.  The food good. They start you out with some garlic rolls that are covered in chopped garlic and olive oil. The tomato sauce tastes home made and the portions are huge.  Which is a plus, nothing worse than an Italian place that skimps on noodles.  So they have pasta down, but it isn't ever anything that you will be craving for, just solid Italian pasta.  I haven't strayed to far from the pasta menu but they have chops, steaks, and fish that looks good.  Nice wine list and your glass of water always stays full.  If you south and looking for a good date or family gathering restaurant you can't go wrong with this place.

46.description: Just went for the second time to this newly re-opened south side eatery. The cook of the restaurant that was formerly there, Joseph,  bought the place and opened it in the last couple of months.All I can say is Thank God we finally have a decent sit down restaurant to eat at on the far south side in Chicago. Do get me wrong, I love all the pizza and hamburger and taco joints all over the south side, but we all know there is a serious shortage of serious restaurants. This place may finally fill the bill. It is not dressy, and you can go casual, but it is a well thought out sit down place.There are still some kinks to work out in this place, and I am sure that over time they can improve. I give it five stars because I am adding a star to what would have been a solid four star experience for breaking through the restaurant glass ceiling in Mount Greenwood.First time there I had baked spaghetti with meat sauce. EXCELLENT. This time I had penne with sausage. Again, a great job. I am yet to try any of their steak or seafood offerings, but I am told they are just as pleasing. It gives me something to do for the rest of the summer.

1.description: Very good food . Adam is an excellent server. Parking can be hard to find.  Food is worth it. Very nice eating area separate from bar area .

9.description: LOVE Joseph's for a family night out!  Great service, great atmosphere.  They take care of our 2-year-old like pros and we always feel comfortable bring him.  The only thing is that I wish they had a bit more creative and tastier Italian menu to offer.  But the experience we know we will have there makes up for it!

26.description: I loved Richie's and was sad to see it go, but thrilled that it's opened again under Joseph's and kept pretty much the same menu, but added some awesome stuff like GLUTEN FREE PASTA! I went here a couple weeks ago for their salad that I'm obsessed with and when I found out they had gluten free pasta, I had to order that as well. I got the Spaghetti Pat "D", which was so delicious. The portion sizes are large, enough for two meals.The bar is great, very friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.It is a bit on the pricey side, but worth it.

25.description: Staff was very friendly, a waiter even sat down and played a couple songs on the piano at one point. Good selection and portion sizes.

12.description: Let me preface this review with saying that I REALLY wanted to love this restaurant.After all the rave reviews, my boyfriend and I decided to try it out on a Friday at 6:30pmThere were open tables but still a good crowd.  The atmosphere is cheaply chic.  There are hanging lights on the wall but brass fittings on some of the obvious hardware.  Brass is very old-fashioned to me.  But I can look past a restaurants decor...We were greeted by a friendly hostess.  And Adam was our server.  I heard a lot of great reviews about Adam and they are exactly as promised.  He is amazing!  Very friendly but not overly obstrusive.  He also plays the piano in the bar when he has a minute.  Very fun waiter!!!The snapper seemed to be a hit amongst previous diners.  I love a good fish and I also eat on the healthier side.  So snapper sounded wonderful with a side of veggies.  My boyfriend ordered the house special which was meatloaf with mashed potatoes.  We got the gorgonzola salad to start.  It was delicious.  However, my boyfriend was surprised that they used bagged salad mix.We also ordered the house made guac with house made chips.  Those were fantastic!Then came the entree.  They were both generous portionsMy snapper was on top a lemon caper sauce.  But the sauce was sooooo salty that my tongue hurt after 2 bites.  And I love salt.  I salt all of my food.  I ended up scraping the fish off the top to avoid the sauce.  So I missed out on half my fish.  My veggies were broc/caulifl/carrot.  But you could tell it was the frozen mix.  Completely bland and devoid of any flavor.  And if you are going to serve a veggie with fish, the veg should complement the fish.  Maybe a nice asparagus.  But frozen veggies?  Bleh!The meatloaf seemed to be good.  I don't eat meatloaf but he seemed to think it was at least decent.  The mashed potatoes, however, were instant.  INSTANT?  REALLY?  Gross!  If that is the special for the night, at least make homemade mashed potatoes.  I can usually eat instant potatoes, but these weren't even tolerable.  So he only at the meatloaf.The prices should reflect the quality of food. The prices are not low enough for the quality.  I expected so much more.  I hope this restaurant can do better.  Maybe the pasta is really their specialty and they should stick to that.After we left the restaurant we were still hungry.We only had water to drink and our bill was $50 (not including tip).I think this restaurant needs some work, but please don't get rid of Adam

21.description: Very good food. I like the HUGE salads they have and the roasted pepper dip.  Just wish they had some more vegetarian options other than pasta.

17.description: I loved Richie's and was sad to see it go, but thrilled that it's opened again under Joseph's and kept pretty much the same menu, but added some awesome stuff like GLUTEN FREE PASTA! I went here a couple weeks ago for their salad that I'm obsessed with and when I found out they had gluten free pasta, I had to order that as well. I got the Spaghetti Pat "D", which was so delicious. The portion sizes are large, enough for two meals.The bar is great, very friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.It is a bit on the pricey side, but worth it.

10.description: Went to a Sox game and called to ask what time that they were closing. They said if you get here before 11 that they would serve us. They kept their word. No attitude  Adam the waiter was extremely friendly  excellent service and awesome food. Definitely will go back. Soup salad and sandwiches were great. Salad was big. Soup was hot and sandwiches were cooked to perfection. Ordered Philly chicken parmigiano and burger had leftovers

5.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants. The service is impeccable and the food is delicious. I love the chicken maranello. My husband has tried many of the items on the menu and he loves them as well. The vibe is relaxed and the prices are reasonable.

3.description: Man this place should be awesome, but the food is just bad. The first time I thought I may have just ordered wrong with the snapper, but no. I came here a second time with my parents and was totally embarrassed to have taken them here. It is some of the worst Italian food I have ever had. All the pasta and fish sauces were just plain gross. I won't be back.

35.description: Don't understand all the raves. My husband ordered his steak WELL done, it came to him rare! He sent it back, came back medium. The baked potatoes were tepid as was the side of broccoli. Waitress didn't seem concerned at all. We definitely won't be going back! Over priced for sub par food. It's sad to say we've had better steaks at Lonestar and that the wait staff there asks you to cut into your steak before they walk away.

19.description: It's really good. Their ravioli is pretty good!

28.description: The food was good but the service was awesome. We also had Adam as a waiter and he went above and beyond to make sure we had the best dining experience. We got such a kick out of him playing the piano. The pasta I had was good, shrimp was cooked perfect and their desserts were out of this world. I would recommend this place and of course, Adam!

45.description: We just tried Joseph's for a family dinner to celebrate 5 birthdays in the family, we were hoping for the best for a new restaurant opening on the South Side.We had THE BEST experience!Adam was our waiter and he is worth waiting for, as he makes your dining experience complete.  Friendly, informative and witty!!!  He also plays an amazing Billy Joel on the piano - ask him to play you a tune!We could not of been happier with our meal. The garlic rolls, awesome! We tested the kitchen as we ordered Red Snapper, Gnochi, Sausage and Peppers and Prime Rib.  Each meal was 5 stars, delicious!  We ordered the Queen Prime Rib and it was the largest piece of Prime Rib we ever saw, my father-in-law exclaimed, "The Queen was a big woman"...we stumped Adam on that one, he loved it!Before leaving Adam brought us home-made tiramsu.  LOVE IT.  If your from the South Side and looking for a new restaurant to rely on for a great meal - be sure to visit Joseph's and meet Adam.Enjoy!

33.description: Came here for my husbands birthday. Read the reviews so i figured to give it a shot. I am glad I did. The service and overall experience was great!! The service is good, the servers are nice and attentive. In this area I feel its the best "nicer type" of restaurant to come to. Great for families. I hope the next time I come they continue doing a great job!

43.description: I have eaten at Joesph's roughly ten times.  Everytime I go in, I have a wonderful mean in a wonderful atmosphere.  The shrimp are my favorite....very large and in a lobster cream sauce.  The grilled calamari is also wonderful.   I highly recommend this place.  Great for a date or just a night out.  Prices aren't out of this world and you will most likely take home leftovers as the portions are more then plentiful.  The staff is very attentive and pleasant.

2.description: Great place and environment. Friend staff that goes out of their way for you. Excellent food.

18.description: Tonight was my second time here in the last four days, I can't believe it took me so long to find this place..it's great!  Food- EXCELLENT!  Both times I had a sandwich but the pasta dishes are very good too.  They start you off with hot garlic rolls, and the menu has a nice variety of steak, pasta, chicken, etc.Drinks- Very cold!Wait Time- Walked right in and sat..you're greeted with a friendly hello!Parking- It's 111th Street, deal with it and find a spot on the street or side street..not a biggie.  God forbid people have to walk a block..it's worth the walk.Staff:  VERY FRIENDLY! Probably my favorite thing about Joseph's is the environment...everyone in there is very nice which I love. Go there peeps...you won't be disappointed!

41.description: This restaurant is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood.  The interior is very nice - they did a lot of work to bring it up to date post-Richie's.  The food was excellent as well, and the prices were right on.  Great place for a nice but not too stuffy night out.

4.description: I love Joseph's!  Have been going since they switched from Richie's a few years ago.  The bar is good.  Not a ton of beer on tap but very nice bartenders who manage the bar well even when it's busy.  Fun martini menu.  The food is great. Love Joseph's colossal shrimp and the pasta it comes with.  With I could just order the pasta without the shrimp - I would love a heaping helping of that pasta (no matter how bad it probably is for me!). Husband enjoys the prime rib.  Service is great - they will always make sure things are exactly right with your order. The tirimisu is great, and their gelato is yummy.  I have craved the salted caramel gelato since the last time I had it.  Have come here on date nights, birthday dinners, and family dinners, and everyone loves it.  Perfect for groups of any size, including kids.  Have been here for date nights and it's very cozy and the kids in the restaurant have always tended to be well-behaved.   Adam is the best server I have ever had, anywhere.  Great personality, super attentive, he makes every visit there great.

6.description: I'm a creature of habit and order the same items every time I go but when those items hit the mark every time, why switch it up? (Mozzarella Caprese and New York Strip with sauteed spinach) Very friendly service from all sides with Adam the waiter randomly taking a seat at the piano and hammering out everything from KISS to Billy Joel classics. FUN!

22.description: I dont eat much pasta, but when I do I go to Joseph's. I've had the salmon and a steak there so far. The service is unbeatable and the food great.

15.description: Ok food for my greenwood but starting to go down. All of their shrimp dishes were excellent before they got rid of the jumbo shrimp the new smaller shrimp don't cut it.

20.description: This restaurant was an excellent surprise. From the garlic rolls, well crafted dinner salad, and excellent entrees, I was impressed.  The marinara was excellent ( a must) & there was a warm neighborhood feel to my dinner experience that added up to a dinner experience that far surpassed my expectations! Will return.

36.description: Went with the kids for my wife's birthday. Had a great meal. I ordered the chicken marsala. Excellent. Tender and the sauce was so good. Had enough left over for dinner the next day. Couldn't wait. Had it for lunch. Wife had some kind of cognac pasta. Good but subtle flavor. Kids enjoyed their meals. My son has a peanut allergy. This is always a pain, but important. Staff was understanding and careful. We'll be back for sure.

14.description: I was not a huge fan of "Ritchie's"...this place is much better! We have friends that live close by, so we are able to walk there, which is a definite plus. The martinis are delicious. I am not a fan of the garlic rolls. I would prefer a warm french bread. I had the Chicken Florentina, which was very good. We also had the stuffed mushrooms. There weren't enough for all of us to each have a whole one, but they were big enough to cut in half. The breaded calamari was also good.  Our bill - with numerous alcoholic beverages, no desserts and one cup of coffee - worked out to about $40/person. I would definitely go back!

3.description: Horrible service.   I keep going back because it is only one around.   I would  like to back more often, but will not reward bad service.

1.description: This won't be a long review. I mean, it's fast food. I felt the need to at least put in a good word considering the low star rating. Ordered the 4 for $4 because it was quick and inexpensive. The customer service was friendly, my meal came out quick, and everything was fresh. Oh, the inside was clean too. I ate inside \(^_^)/

2.description: If I could give this place zero stars I would their service is terrible they don't listen and they take all day for your food

5.description: Jesus S. must work there...Wendy's Corp should close this one down - have complained to district mgr before, but zero change in the quality of service at this Alsip location.  The consistently get orders wrong, poor customer interaction.  If you really want Wendy's - go south on Cicero to the Midlothian location, they have better food/service which is more consistent with what I expect from Wendy's.I usually go to the Midlothian location, but due to time of night & bad weather, I went to this one, and as expected, the order was wrong.  I have learned to stay parked at the window until I can verify that it is correct.   They did give me the rest of my order, but zero acknowledgement, no "sorry", "thank you", "have a good night" etc. that you usually get at a fast food drive thru.  IMHO - they are so used to having to fix orders, that they do so on 'autopilot'.As I said, I've gone the route of complaining via the Wendy's website, but even after speaking with the district mgr (Mark Gee at the time), I haven't seen the slightest improvement.  As a result,  I only hit this location as a necessary evil since it's the closest fast food place to my home.

6.description: Good food, clean and fast drive throu

0.description: The lettuce was crunchy. I also enjoyed the tuna. I enjoyed this place so much, I stayed there for 6 hours the other day. I recommend the hand soap.

4.description: Worst service i have ever received. The cashier was also putting orders together and completely ignored us for 20 minutes and did not even acknowledge us. I was returning because, during my last visit, i was overcharged for my items. I have never had such a horrible experience and will not be returning to this location. Get your freaking act together. This location should have been closed a long time ago for poor customer service.

1.description: Yummy coffee and tea, good service, friendly employees. Got a chai latte last time I was here, and it was delicious. I also got a nifty travel mug I will use the next time I go here. If you're a student your meal card is good not only for food and beverages, but also merchandise, so remember that at the end of the semester!(the $ on your meal card don't roll over)

2.description: Coffee Cats uses Starbucks beans and has nice employees working there, plus, they're usually pretty swift and on the ball--I get my drink fast and they've never messed up my order--so it SHOULD earn more than three stars, but my only irritation and the reason for the harsh grade is that it opens at 9:00 a.m. (although the website claims it opens at 8:30). Seriously, I should be able to get a latte on my way TO my 8:00 class, not have to wait until AFTER my 8:00 class to get caffeinated!

0.description: Love this place, I can give them a really complicated drink like, skinny, no foam, almond milk , vanilla latte and they make it right. I don't give it another star because sometimes the line is too long and I get impatient, they need to hire more than one person to work during rush hours.

1.description: I would be fibbing if I said I didn't feel some anxiety walking into Lawlor's. So many white people. Nothing wrong with that, but I did have to calm my nerves by reminding myself that white people enjoy having sex with their socks on, carry hand sanitizer with them everywhere, use "mild" hot sauce, drink SmartWater, dress their dogs in outfits, and listen to Macklemore. Nicest, most harmless people on earth.Lawlor's isn't much for visual appeal, in that they ain't got none. Lawlor's isn't much for decent beer on tap, in that...they ain't got none. The food at Lawlor's could be better, in that you better take your ass down the street to Micky D's, because they ain't got no damn food. You're probably asking "then why would I want to come here?" Simply, you're an unabashed alcoholic and the drinks are cheap. Or you're like me and had some time to kill, drove past it many times throughout the years, became curious...and an unabashed alcoholic. You'll infer from the insane weekly drink specials that they welcome drunken debauchery. $1 pints on this day, $1.50 bottles the next. Seems like an ideal place to relive your early 20's. Early 20's? Just writing this makes me want to play Century Club with friends while blasting my Chingy and Outkast burned CD that I spent hours downloading off Kazaa, from my Juno ISP dial-up modem on my Compaq desktop PC. I love a good neighborhood dive bar, but I can't call Lawlor's "good". It lacks personality and individuality. They need to give this place an identity, other than drunk and south side-y white, or they ain't goin' nowhere like a bad navi.

2.description: I regularly go here it gets really pack most weekends because it is cheap you can get a pint of shocktop for two bucks. We are all from the area with a few outsiders it can take a minute to get your beer if it's busy but they are good people. Outsiders are welcome though just stay away from the drunk mics if they start segueing the bouncers are quick to break things up. This is a true southside Irish dive bar not like the ones up north calling them selves that. There are fights but they are few and far been. They are cleaning them selves up and making it a nicer place. All in all it is what it is a good place for a cheap cold beer

0.description: I dunno. I like it.  It doesn't take much to impress me.Monday night typically a slow night.there were a few folks in there.  Good prices, cold beer, great service.Probably one of the cleanest bathrooms I seen.  Visited the lawlers on archer a few times.  No pool tables but good jukebox, darts and golf.  Smoking situation kinda pimpy though.  Out front and kinda sloppy.  Could be cleaned up a bit.  Just saying.

3.description: One of the few drive through places open in the area late at night, so sometimes I will drive through here in a moment of weakness. However, no matter what time I go or what I order, the staff is always surly at best.

1.description: Drive through can be slow sometimes but for the most part it goes by quick... Drive through staff is friendly and upbeat always says hi and great with a smile. I have eaten inside one time not bad nice playground for the kids. I use the drive through my four stars is based on that. I love my coffee from here!

2.description: Epic fail. Had to wait over 5 minutes for a bag of ice. Then I'm told to pull up into the waiting spot. Finally, an apparently disgruntled employee comes out and throws the bag into my open window. Doesn't say a word, just throws it at me. Apparently, no one wanted to make up a bag of ice.  Normally, I receive good service here. The weekend manager needs to get her act together. Employees all seem angry. Not a smile or nice word in the place.
