9.description: To give this a star is beyond nice. I know its a mcdonalds but come on dirty, service is a joke. Night crew is lazy wont serve breakfast  or all items even though its listed..   Then they say there to busy what a joke to busy late at night or to lazy. I agree with the other yelp reviewers stay far away from this joke of an establishment.

10.description: DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS McDONALD'S. This place is the pits! Their interior is grimy, the personnel are surly, and when I asked a question this morning at breakfast, the mohawk coiffed manager told me that that it was my problem.

4.description: Yesterday on the way home from work, I got hungry so I pulled into the drive thru. I order three regular cheeseburgers, medium fry without salt,and a large orange drink. The total was about $7. I paid for the food, drive to pick up window,and after getting the food, to a parking spot to eat. I opened the bag and after having spent  $7,the cheap bastards on put, grease soaked  (probably from the fries) in the bag. Cheap bastards!

6.description: I dont eat McDonald's because the food is poison, however I would occasionally stop at this one for coffee, was there the other day and spotted a no concealed carry sign. They will never get my business again.

12.description: THE HEALTH DEPARMENT SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN last week!!! Only a McDonalds can lose their food license and be back open in 24 hours. Truly a nasty place.

5.description: On my visit to this location I discovered that the inside of McDonald's was closed due to a problem with the bathroom. I proceed to the drive thru and I was told that she could not take 3 orders in drive thru. I can't  understand why there is a limit for the drive thru if the inside is closed.

11.description: Passed by many times. Decided to check it out. Terrible mistake. No air conditioner. Flies everywhere. Everything looks dirty. Terrible mistake. Customer service is great. But nothing will bring me back to this place. Literally, I can count the flies.

8.description: Every table has an outlet, so you can keep your electronics charged! Employees nice, newly remodeled.

0.description: Ok for a McDonald's, employees aren't the friendliest or most cheerful, but it works, I guess.

7.description: Can they ever get an order correct? I come to this location because of the location but I regret it almost everytime. I always pull away missing something from my order. I gave them two stars because the staff is always friendly and polite so I do not want to take that away from this location. You think by now they would have a person there to double check the orders.

1.description: This is the worst CVS in the city. The cashiers are rude and act like your bothering them. The pharmacy is very very slow

2.description: I shop at CVS at least twice a week, either down town or this one.  The staff behind the counter always seem pleasant.  What's interesting is that their after-holiday items always take way longer than the local Walgreens or other CVS stores to discount.  I know they're franchised, but just an observation.   Also, I went shopping last Saturday (the last day that some of the stuff in the ad was on sale) and the little sale tags that were on the shelves only a few days before by the sale items were gone.  I have noticed this a couple of times before when I was looking for something on sale.  I assume the staff is just trying to get ahead and taking the signs down when they have the spare time, but it's a pain when you go in specifically for something on sale and then you're not sure if you're getting the right thing (and you have to figure it out at the price checker machine or wait in the check out line).  But otherwise, a regular CVS with a decent liquor selection.

0.description: Turn and face the strange cha cha changes...Just out and about taking care of biz when I arrived one day to discover that dreadfully garish, CVS signature red slapped across ALL of Osco's sunny windows. Ack!  My beloved, local Osco...Bangin' with affordable cosmetics, a sweet pharmacy, and tiny, but decent liquor department was all tarted up!  NOW where's a gal supposed to simultaneously purchase her vitamins and vodka? -- Total bullsh*t.  Turns out....not so much. CVS invested in an overdue interior facelift and brought in their own quality, affordable line of goods while still keeping my higher-end favs . Once they rolled out their ExtraCare Rewards Program, they hit dat savings sweet spot with plenty of freebies and discounts. Mo money...Mo money...Mo money.  (Sign up for it..seriously)  This particular location has well-lit, ample parking and an excellent pharmacy; it's rare I ever have to sit around and wait for an order. Friendly cashiers know the regulars and seem familiar with the layout & inventory so it's not uncommon to witness them directing some lost soul directly from the register. A few of my favorite Osco employees stuck around the place and so my once dreaded transition has settled quite nicely into CVS Buck bliss.  24 hour Subway with flat screen and comfy seating next store is a bonus. Little known funfact: If you listen carefully when pulling into the awkward and extremely narrow (concrete pillar & painted pole) drive-thru here...you can hear it bellow, "Finish Him!!"

28.description: Let me start off my saying what a great addition to Evergreen Park this place is! Went there on a busy Friday night. The place is very small but we were seated right away. I ordered the chili and the corned beef sandwich which was excellent and probably the best I have ever had. They also had a good craft beer selection. Will definitely be coming back.

1.description: This place looked to have all sorts of potential, but in the end was a letdown.First, let me tell you, they have great fries.That being said, the rest needs a lot to be desired, and they need better execution of preparation of their food. i ordered the blue cheese with candied bourbon bacon burger, with all the extras (lettuce tomato onion). The burger was way overdone (bad enough that I actually sent it back) the bacon was under cooked, and the onion was the rings from the outer layer of the onion that you should throw in the garbage (the tough fibre filled layers that you can't bite through). The first bite revealed the bad onions. I asked for fresh slices, got them, same result. Discarded the onions. Second bite revealed the burger was very well done (I ordered medium, and made a point of asking if medium would still be pink in the middle, assured it would be).Sent the burger back. Got a whole new setup, including fries. Like i said, the fries are great. However, the bacon was under cooked again, the burger was barely less well done, and AGAIN I got onion skin instead of onions.So until this newer entrant to the south side learns how to avoid all these issues, I say give this place a pass.

39.description: To start off, the place is fairly new so my hopes are that changes are still to come. The place is a very nice addition to neighborhood life in Evergreen Park. I went there with 3 other people for lunch and I think we all enjoyed our meals, they were very tasty. The fries are great and they actually threw in an extra basket of fries for free which was very nice. I had their corned beef sandwich and everything was great except that the rye bread was very very soggy, like a wet pancake soggy. That was my only quam, I would have much preferred a normal toasted piece of dry rye bread. Everything else was great tasting and delicious. The service however needs a lot of work In my opinion. Our server was extremely friendly and nice however it took forever to get drinks and whenever she came back to our table, she would not take any empty drinks, glasses, or plates. So, our table got very clustered very soon. It was awkward. But, I understand the place is new and tweaks will be made, hopefully. All in all, it is a nice neighborhood joint and I would go there again to give it another chance.

9.description: A lifetime ago I used to hang out in this area.  I remember vividly the butcher shop that was in this location. When I saw the Yelp listing for Porter Cullen's, I had no idea it was in the very same space.  When I pulled up, I had a fun flashback to my sisters high school graduation from Mother McAuley, and getting steaks for the graduation barbecue afterwards (circa 1990??).  Porter Cullen's makes up for the loss of a really great butcher shop.First off, the staff are so nice in here.  Not fake nice corporate restaurant-ish, but like truly community hospitable welcoming.  We came on a Saturday night and the place was about half full.  We grabbed a booth and were greeted within a minute by our server.  I can't recall her name, but she was friendly and sincere.Guinness on tap here is poured expertly.  They have a decent wine list- my date found something she really wanted, so we were both happy.  For an appetizer, we ordered the Harp Mussels.  I have never had beer mussels before, and these were delicious.  The flavor of the Harp beer wasn't lost in the cooking at all.The dish to try here is definitely the burger.  I had the one with portobello mushroom and provolone.  It was outstanding.  I don't often order burgers, but the waitress said it was the best thing on the menu.  I'd have a hard time arguing with her.  My date had the fish and chips, and they were pretty standard fried cod... good as anywhere else I've eaten them.Overall, this place is really good!  I'm definitely planning on coming back the next time I am on the south side.  It's so nice having places to go to other than Western Ave and 95th St.  Four stars.

29.description: Updating a previous review, went for lunch and there were 4 or 5 specials, which provided many more options.  Grilled goat cheese sandwich was great.  I hope they add it to the regular menu.  Service was excellent.

23.description: A friend and I decided to check this place out after seeing that it had opened recently. We were very impressed. It's not your typical Irish pub...the decor was very clean and classy. More importantly, our food and drinks both exceeded expectations. Our waitress was sweet and was happy to answer any questions we had. We will certainly be returning!

5.description: Love the Irish Breakfast on Sunday's and for lunch or dinner, the Fish and Chips are my other fav!

31.description: This past Sunday I arranged a large gathering  at Porter Cullens.   EVERYTHING was terrific.   A menu was worked out prior to the event..... with a VERY fair price point and the variety of food choices were great for adults and children.  The food was delicious and the service was OUTSTANDING.  Every family echoed the same sentiments.  Great bartenders and they also had live music.  HIGHLY recommend Porter Cullens!

25.description: Best restaurant in the area.  Great food and service!! Highly recommended.  The burgers are great and the soup is homemade...  Great beer and the bar area is very nice

12.description: Saw there was a new place so we Stopped in for a quick drink. Great service and a nice atmosphere. Sweet little tavern.

37.description: The first time I went , I ordered the mussels appetizer. The sauce was great, the mussels were small and tough.Today, I went with a friend. First, we ordered two Irish coffees. The presentation was nice but the coffee was, well, it is a joke a to call it coffee at all. Completely weak and tasteless...for $8.00! My friend ordered the corned beef sandwich and it was gross. It was the shavings left over in the the pan crammed between two slices of bread. I ordered the Irish stew.  It made me think of the Game of Thrones "Bowl of Brown". It was a rather large bowl of brown gravy, I found about six pieces of meat, three carrots, a piece of parsnip and one piece of potato.  Those things were actually pretty tasty, but the big bowl of brown, which amounted to about six spoons of food, cost $10.   When I brought our complaints to the management, I was offered another "Bowl of Brown" but no discount for the generally bad meal. I will absolutely NOT be returning.  If you want a nice home cooked Irish meal, go to CLANCY'S in Oak Lawn on 103rd.  Seriously, skip Porter Cullens. Wish it was till the butcher store.

21.description: Went there the other night for dinner and was not disappointed.The waitress was so sweet and helpful!We tried the sliders for an appetizer and they were awesome.  The bleu cheese with candied bacon was a favorite.My son loved the corned beef sandwich, said it was the best and he loves corned beef!!!

16.description: Monday Special of 1/2 priced burgers!  Had a lovely glass of wine paired with a candied bacon blue cheese burger...YUM!!  Great service, friendly and inviting. Don't let the parking out front scare you.... You can park at the school just west of PC

17.description: Ordered the Sliders which was a sample of three of their burgers ! Very good food and service !

10.description: Went here the other night after months of anticipation of awaiting its opening. Well, I am very happy to say that it was well worth the wait! This is not your typical south side Irish pub with dark interiors and questionable food. On the contrary, Porter Cullens has a modern and fresh interior appointed with comfortable furnishings and an attention to detail. My wife really liked the old fashioned light bulbs and the beautiful marble bar. We had viewed the menu online, so we had already made up our minds on what we would eat. We started our meal with the vegetarian crostini with portabello mushrooms and fresh motz. It tasted fantastic and paired well with Leinenkugel's cranberry ginger shandy. This place has a great selection of craft beers and favorites such as Guinness and Stella on tap. For our main courses, my wife had the Guinness braised short rib stew and I had the brown sugar bacon blue cheese burger with a pint of One Trick Pony: Spotted Saddle. The burger was beyond belief! So flavorful! The Guinness stew was amazing as well. I could barely get my wife to let me taste it because she was so enamored with it. Rich and savory, it was the perfect choice for a cold Friday night. We really can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu, especially the muscles with Harp cream sauce and the fish and chips. If you are looking for great dining experience or a place to have a pint with friends, Porter Cullens offers an experience in the same vein of the Gastropubs of Dublin and London. Including a unique menu, clean interior design and an amazing staff! Definitely visit if you are on the south side.

11.description: I used to live in Evergreen and remember the butcher shop this place used to be. It's in kind of a weird place...smack dab in the middle of a residential neighborhood. But, anyway, I went there with my dad and wife this week and it was a solid place. The interior is small but nice. Our server was very helpful as we endured a toddler meltdown right before our dinner arrived.The Guinness on tap is excellent and they pour it right. My wife fell in love with a particular brand of Irish Cider while on our honeymoon in Dublin and was excited to see it on the menu here.The food was pretty good as well. We had the Irish egg, which is a rip on the traditional Scotch egg and the Harp mussels for appetizers and both were good, although the Irish egg seemed a bit dry. For dinner I had the corned beef sandwich. It was very good but had the most unusual flavoring...almost like fennel or anise. My wife had a burger and my dad had the Guinness stew. Everyone enjoyed the food, although the general consensus was everything was a bit too salty.Overall, this is a nice neighborhood place with a friendly atmosphere and really solid food. There's a few nice beers on tap and even more options in cans/bottles. I'd recommend this place for a fun evening.

26.description: Even with a reservation, we waited 10-15 minutes to be seated. Food was good, but menu is limited. One member of my party ordered an item only to be told it was no longer available (permanently), but the menu hadn't been updated. It was too loud from so many customers in such a small place. Our waitress was friendly but inattentive.

27.description: Food was a little pricey but you can tell it's not the fast food crap. We had the corn beef egg rolls appetizer and beer battered cod. All tasted great. Only thing is that is gets really loud in there - so no romantic dates wld be suggested. Oh and it was busy arnd 5:00 on a Friday but they do have valet parking. Since it is residential parking and EP will give you a ticket for on a side street

35.description: A very nice addition to the neighbor. I have eaten here with my family a few times already, and everything has been delicious. The burgers are especially tasty! They also offer special salads that are super fresh and the prices are very reasonable for now good the food is.

8.description: I loved the food but the noise level is way to high. If you go at lunch time, you can't have normal conversations. Too many hard surfaces. They need to put in a lot of soft surfaces to absorb sound. I know several people that planned to meet girlfriends for lunch here and walked out because noise level is too high.I live close and would love to frequent this pub but loud places just ruin the experience for me. Please fix this problem.

0.description: I am really loving this place. It makes me sad I no longer live near here. The service is friendly and the clientele is nice. Its a fun but older crowd. The décor is cute. I always feel very comfortable in here.The drinks are good. I cant exactly remember the beer list because I am never in the mood for beer here but the wine list is decent. The prices are average too.The food can be a little salty for me, but I am overly sensitive to salt. The pork wings are amazing. Definitely order those. The sliders were pretty good too. Other than that I have always just sort of shared with whoever I was with. This is one of the best neighborhood spots in the area! I would for sure recommend it especially if you live in the area.

38.description: I'm not big on ratings, so I'll keep it short. The beer selection is great and I got to watch the Blackhawks beat the Bruins. Incredibly friendly staff and the food was great too. I would definitely recommend stopping in.

20.description: The burgers are delicious and half price on Monday.  The only thing is you have to wait until 4:00 p.m. for that half price.  Bummer!

19.description: Went in for drinks and absolutely loved this place! Cool atmosphere, great decor, really good and quick service, good mix music selection. My only problem with this "Irish" pub is that they do not serve Magners! (I've been to many many many pubs in Ireland and there is not one pub that doesn't serve it. ) Seriously would've made my experience that much better. Also a little more traditional Irish music in the mix would be amazing!! Will definitely come back to try the food!

33.description: This is a fantastic, hot new neighborhood gem. Above all, delicious food and perfectly crafted mixed drinks. We had the Guinness braised beef stew (ah-mazing and I'd love the recipe for!), mixed greens house salad (dressing perfect and light), burger ( definitely try), grilled cheese sandwich - with fries (so tasty),  and margarita (made by Maggie and just perfect). I went on a Friday afternoon - which has a vibrant lunch scene and if you want to impress a first date, meet up with friends, or hang out with family, this is a great place to go. Wonderful service, helpful and attentive.  Decor is clean and modern, with tasteful authentic Irish touches- a really smart balance of casual comfort and style. Lovely fireplace near the entrance and cozy large booths which are a favorite particularly for this area. I highly recommend you give Porter Cullen's a try--  leave a minute or two to park, the place is hopping & they make you feel like you are home.

2.description: I have been to Porter Cullen's several times and have always found the food very good.  Last night we went for the "fish fry". The restaurant/bar is very small and very loud.  I'm always cold here. We had a short wait and we were seated.  They do not rush you at all. In fact they don't seem to care how long you stay even if there is a big line.  We all ordered the Guinness Fish and Chips.  Boy was it good.  The fish was flaky and moist and the batter was amazing.  The fries were also excellent. I think they may have been hand cut and they were cooked to perfection.  We were even asked if we wanted seconds on the fish.  This is certainly a very nice addition to our restaurant options.  Give it a try.

34.description: We've been to the restaurant twice, and have had great service and excellent food each time.  Nice bar, plenty of seating, with booths and tables available.  Nice beer selection.  They spent time an money on building the restaurant out, and it shows.Can get a bit loud depending on the crowd, and they tend to keep it brighter than we like, although each time we were there they dialed it down to a better level after a bit.Overall, a great addition to the area.

32.description: Porter Cullens is outstanding!  Porter Cullens is welcoming, followed by friendly fast service, great drinks and outstanding food.  The space is amazing with great attention to detail which makes it a unique, warm, welcoming neighborhood place with a very special feel.  Being a larger group enabled us to order many appetizers and entrees which allowed us to taste everything.  It was amazing!  It has a fancy downtown feel with a neighborhood price and welcome.  Outstanding, thank you!

18.description: Meh. Have been looking forward to trying the place for awhile and finally got went there for lunch today. It was OK. The place was not crowded and we were sat immediately at a high top table and given menus. Then, we waited. There were 3 waitresses and a hostess. The service was terrible. It took them 10 minutes to come to the table and asked "Oh, is someone helping you?" Never given water or told of the specials. Had to ask about the soup of the day. Service never got any better. But the girls spent a lot of time gathered together by the bar and the hostess desk. And they were on their cell phones a lot. That is extremely tacky and no one said a word because the whole staff appeared to be under 25.They do have good Guinness. For food we had the chili, the slider trio and the candied bourbon bacon blue cheese burger. The food was good, really good. The portion size was perfect. The prices good. The menu is pretty limited.The decor was a mess. It looked like they picked random pieces and threw it together. And not in a good way. I am still trying to wrap my head around the bathroom tile in the dining area and the green velour bench seating.I was really looking forward to a nice local pub with good food. They got the food and drinks but have really missed the mark with the staff and the place itself. Too bad. Won't be coming back.

41.description: Went here the other night after months of anticipation of awaiting its opening. Well, I am very happy to say that it was well worth the wait! This is not your typical south side Irish pub with dark interiors and questionable food. On the contrary, Porter Cullens has a modern and fresh interior appointed with comfortable furnishings and an attention to detail. This place has a great selection of craft beers and favorites such as Guinness and Stella on tap. For our main courses, my wife had the Guinness braised short rib stew and I had the brown sugar bacon blue cheese burger with a pint of One Trick Pony: Spotted Saddle. The burger was beyond belief! So flavorful! The Guinness stew was amazing as well. I could barely get my wife to let me taste it because she was so enamored with it. Rich and savory, it was the perfect choice for a cold Friday night. We really can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu, especially the muscles with Harp cream sauce and the fish and chips. If you are looking for great dining experience or a place to have a pint with friends, Porter Cullens offers an experience in the same vein of the Gastropubs of Dublin and London. Including a unique menu, clean interior design and an amazing staff! Definitely visit if you are on the south side.

13.description: Great neighborhood establishment. Service was good but the food was only fair. Disappointed with the house speciality Corned Beef sandwich but did really enjoy the broccoli cheese soup. Will likely not be back.

4.description: I've been to Porter Cullens about a half dozen times now.  After it changed from the butcher shop and it sat empty I would drive past and think of all the different businesses that occupied that spot, going all the way back to the small grocery store in the 1960's.  One day I saw a sign that I thought said "Porter Cutlets", and I thought "another butcher shop."  When I slowed down one day and saw tables inside the lightbulb went on (not the brightest bulb, I admit) that this must be a bar/restaurant now. It took awhile for me to go in, and the first time it was a little disorganized, but it was new. The staff is very friendly.  The food is good, above the average pub grub stuff.  A fun addition are the "pigs wings", which I had had just a week earlier for the first time in Milwaukee.  They have craft beers and an American swill on tap, so something for everything, plus a lot of bottle selection.  Not a wine drinker, so that's a mystery.  People mention the noise, and that is a factor, but not so much when I can get a chance to get in there, which is usually mid-week.  If they could mute the noise somehow it would be more comfortable. Overall, a good place, and off the main drag of most things.  I'm surprised Evergreen granted a license, but not disappointed.  The really nice thing is that I can walk home if I want to.

24.description: Monday Special of 1/2 priced burgers!  Had a lovely glass of wine paired with a candied bacon blue cheese burger...YUM!!  Great service, friendly and inviting. Don't let the parking out front scare you.... You can park at the school just west of PC

6.description: Loved this place both times I was there. Great food and music; attentive employees; clean and comfortable ambience. The Irish egg rolls are delicious! The decor is modern with lots of white, dark wood, and splashes of red via the chairs. I should say, though, that I was there after the lunch rush on Sat, so the place wasn't crowded.

22.description: Went to a luncheon here last week and loved everything about it. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the food was amazing. It has a great little Irish pub feel but super classy at the same time. I really enjoyed my experience and can't wait to get back soon.  I wish I could pick up this little gem and bring it to the city:)

15.description: Good food, decent craft beers. Worth checking out again. It was a cute neighborhood place. Waitress was good and they offered us a free round, so really can't complain. Lack of vegetarian options on the menu, but hey, that's life.

40.description: Went there tonight, only been open a few days. Overall food was pretty good. Fish and chips, fish was light and crispy. Fries crispy as well. Mussels fresh and flavorful. Bread had great grilled taste. Corned beef tender and homeade tasting. Ordered a few drinks on bar menu that they didn't have in stock yet, hopefully they get those in soon. Staff friendly. Hopefully this place works out. They have valet after 5, not a lot of parking. Will try again in a few weeks when they work out the kinks.

7.description: We recently moved to the Evergreen Park area and are completely digging the cool Irish pub vibe at Porter Cullens.  Good comfort food staples like fish and chips and burgers.  Pretty decent selection of craft beers as well.  Live music, friendly service, and a warm and welcoming ambiance have made this our absolute favorite place in EP thus far!

36.description: Went in for drinks and absolutely loved this place! Cool atmosphere, great decor, really good and quick service, good mix music selection. My only problem with this "Irish" pub is that they do not serve Magners! (I've been to many many many pubs in Ireland and there is not one pub that doesn't serve it. ) Seriously would've made my experience that much better. Also a little more traditional Irish music in the mix would be amazing!! Will definitely come back to try the food!

The place was not crowded and we were sat immediately at a high top table and given menus. Then, we waited. There were 3 waitresses and a hostess. The service was terrible. It took them 10 minutes to come to the table and asked "Oh, is someone helping you?" Never given water or told of the specials. Had to ask about the soup of the day. Service never got any better. But the girls spent a lot of time gathered together by the bar and the hostess desk. And they were on their cell phones a lot. That is extremely tacky and no one said a word because the whole staff appeared to be under 25.They do have good Guinness. For food we had the chili, the slider trio and the candied bourbon bacon blue cheese burger. The food was good, really good. The portion size was perfect. The prices good. The menu is pretty limited.The decor was a mess. It looked like they picked random pieces and threw it together. And not in a good way. I am still trying to wrap my head around the bathroom tile in the dining area and the green velour bench seating.I was really looking forward to a nice local pub with good food. They got the food and drinks but have really missed the mark with the staff and the place itself. Too bad. Won't be coming back.

3.description: Love this place! Nice menu and delicious food in the cutest setting. Drinks are wonderful, too!

14.description: To start off, the place is fairly new so my hopes are that changes are still to come. The place is a very nice addition to neighborhood life in Evergreen Park. I went there with 3 other people for lunch and I think we all enjoyed our meals, they were very tasty. The fries are great and they actually threw in an extra basket of fries for free which was very nice. I had their corned beef sandwich and everything was great except that the rye bread was very very soggy, like a wet pancake soggy. That was my only quam, I would have much preferred a normal toasted piece of dry rye bread. Everything else was great tasting and delicious. The service however needs a lot of work In my opinion. Our server was extremely friendly and nice however it took forever to get drinks and whenever she came back to our table, she would not take any empty drinks, glasses, or plates. So, our table got very clustered very soon. It was awkward. But, I understand the place is new and tweaks will be made, hopefully. All in all, it is a nice neighborhood joint and I would go there again to give it another chance.

0.description: What can you say!  This is a true neighborhood joint!  You wont find this in any suburban strip mall.  It has a good crowd mixed with young and some old playing darts,golf, or bags. Some Irish and some not but all there to have a few laughs and drinks.  Recently remodeled and looks fabulous.

12.description: Seriously - Why don't I just eat here every damn day?  Probably because eating chili cheese topped things every single day would wreak further havoc on my digestive system, however...I got a decent sized quarter pound cheeseburger with grilled onions on a toasted bun, a generous order of real potato fries topped with Lindy's delicious chili, a huge, impressive, and deliciously slightly bitter chocolate phosphate in an old fashioned large float glass and a small chocolate milk here for.....NINE DOLLARS!Nevermind the fact that that is quite possibly the fattest order anybody ever ordered in a restaurant, still - $9.  For all of that delicious grub?Yessssss!

3.description: Nobody who knows me can dispute my love for Lindy's, but I'd never ventured to another location outside the one in McKinley Park, so perfect for its after ice skating relief.  Now, I still love Lindy's and I (obviously) loved their chili at this location, and will certainly return because I am at the Beverly Art Center for various activities such as art, but there were some little things that just l couldn't help compare.  Our server was was a rather listless teen, which is fine, but everyone working in there seemed really depressed for some reason.  Not just "my job's not that awesome" depressed but "Tom Waits is the soundtrack to my life" depressed.  Maybe I'm being dramatic.  I also know it's a franchise so it's not necessarily super consistent, but my favorite sundae, the Sweet 16, was listed as having "fruit salad" on it where strawberries should have been and the sundae we did order didn't come on a little plate to catch the overflow, nor did it come with the advertised Nabisco wafer which I enjoy.  Like I said, I'll be back, but it's the little things.

1.description: I'm extremely surprised to see such low ratings. This place is old school, yes, but that's part of the charm. The chili with the fixings is just right and their flavored sodas with ice cream are classic. Fresh whipped cream is NOT buttery as one reviewer suggested. Bottom line is that they are doing the greasy spoon diner classics really well and nailing their sundaes and phosphates. It's too bad this place isn't busier, but I think it'll be hard for them to draw in the younger crowd without an interior update.Also, the guys behind the counter are very nice. It's a take-a-penny-leave-a-penny kind of place that gives service with a smile despite the old ceiling tiles, bad lighting, and run-down look of the place. I played the claw machine (25¢) and weighed myself & got a fortune (10¢) while waiting for a to-go order- all in good fun! I'll be back.

2.description: Classic chili/ice cream joint on the south side, the chili is great and so is the ice cream, not expensive either, it's a must for those looking for classic establishments in Chicago

9.description: I love their hot fudge sundaes and their food.  Its all junk food done great!I do have some issue with their customer service.  I didn't get the gross lady, but all the employees were bored or cranky last time, which goes perfectly with the ambiance.  This place used to be such a treat, but as an adult it seems a bit sad and lacking the magic an ice cream shop should have.  Especially a shop that is selling such a great product!Smiles, cleaning, and sprucing up needed for a 5 star rating.

10.description: Where do I begin..Although likable at first, our waitress was extremely unsanitary and quite frankly, gross. I was there about an hour ago, and even though I didn't finish my TINY b.l.t. I'm still kind of queezy. Initially our waitress was charming, fairly entertaining and quirky. She took our orders and was helpful with suggestions. We were having fun and laughing with the waitress a lot at first. After delivering our delicious bowl of chili, get this, she TASTED the condiments with her FINGER!! After closing the cap of the hot sauce with her masticated finger she placed next to the chili and walked away babbling about something. We still hadn't received our drinks. Like I said above, the chili was great. However my b.l.t. was baby-sized and the ranch I ordered on the side was almost solid and tasted like French Onion dip. The fries were practically raw potatoes; soggy on the outside and raw on the inside. Yuck.My boyfriend ordered the chili cheese burger and said he would have been satisfied if the portion wasn't minuscule. Mid-meal our waitress informed us she would be taking a smoke break. I'm not opposed to smokers, but that's disgusting for a server to do while her table is eating. We were the only customers in there!She came back in sniffling and wiping snot onto her arm right at our table. I mean come ON.She asked if we wanted to box the fries and we assumed it was so that we could finish cooking them at home. We politely declined. For the grand finale, we walked up to pay the bill as she was hocking a loog into a paper cup!Who are these people?! What happened to the place?

4.description: So: they changed the prices, and not in a good way! We recently stopped here because we felt like having chili (and of course, a chocolate soda) on a cold winter's night. The new menus listed prices that were bumped up by 20 to 30%. Quality of the food is the same, but if you are less than a block away from a Burger King and another hamburger joint, Grant's, why price yourself out of competition?To add insult to injury, the old menus have been replaced by cheap photocopies with the edited prices. They couldn't even bother with a decent computer-generated update.When prices increase, you expect something else to improve as well. This is just gouging with no real benefit to the customer.

6.description: We stumbled upon this location yesterday evening, while looking for a place to grab a quick bite. I have been a fan of Gerties since I was a kid and used to frequent one of the original locations, on Archer Ave in Brighton Park.  Most recently, I have been going to the Ford City location on Pulaski.  I was happy to see this location so close to our new neighborhoodAnywhoo.. . Lindy's and Gertie's combined to make an excellent match, chili, burgers, hot dogs & sandwiches, meet ice cream, shakes, sundaes and flavored old fashioned sodas..    A perfect match for a big guy like me!I ordered a 1/4 pound cheeseburger(which was handmade), fresh cut fries w/ skin, and a cup of their famous chili.  I gotta say, everything was delicious.  The burger was nicely seasoned, and went well with the grilled onions i requested.  The fries with thick cuts of fresh potatoes and were fried to perfection.  The chili was pretty good, very meaty and flavorful.   I was able to taste my wife's banna shake, but it was so good that she refused to give me anymore than a quick taste.  Next time i will have to order my own.   I will definitely be back..  I left with a butter pecan scoop on a plain cone and it was very good..  I will have to try some other flavor on my next trip.

15.description: chili - great :)milkshake - garbage :(service -  unfriendly, not welcoming :(

0.description: there is something magical in that chili.  euphoria results.

5.description: Their ice cream is OK:... DO NOT GET WIPPED CREAM!!!!IT TASTES LIKE BUTTER!!! It smells really bad and they take FOREVER 2 make one dang milkshake!!!! One time I went there with my friends and we didn't get our ice cream 4 an hour and we were the only ones there!!! One employee started crying cuz she couldn't keep up with the receipts! This place is slow and unorganized! The only close to good part about it is their food and ice cream. Chilly kinda gross. All in all I'd prefer Oberweis over Gerties.

13.description: This place should be shut down due to health code.  So disgusting inside.  I even had to use the washroom and they had no lights.  When told the staff they said i could use their flashlight!  Everything about this place is gross and dirty.

11.description: Was looking for some ice cream and the Burger King drive through was packed so stopped by this place.  Asked to see an Ice Cream Menu and it was completely Unreadable.  Looks liked they just made copies over and over.  So i just ordered a Hot Fudge Sundae.  Girl that took my order seem to not care what I ordered just wanted me to leave.  Got home with the sundae and it was a bowl of ice cream with hot fudge on the side.  Thought I ordered some cheese fries from White Castle.  Next time I will just stop at Dominick's and make it myself better.

8.description: Much better the second time around. I ordered my cup of chili with NO beans, and a side of macaroni, and it was wonderful. Also ordered the burger again with grilled onions.This place never seems busy. I'm kinda surprised they still keep it open. Hopefully the other Lindy's locations make up for the slack at this one. Service here could be a little friendlier, seeing as we've been the only customers both the times I've came here. They sure can't blame it on being too busy.

14.description: Been going there for years.  The last few times things have not been so nice but this last time it took the cake!  Rude nasty waitress on Friday. 4/26/13.  Short with me and the kids and we were the only ones there at this point.  Placed order, ate then wanted ice cream and that was too much for her to handle nicely.  She told us rudely they did not have a particular ice cream and then we changed order to something they had and then we got the original order with no explanation or apology.     Then paid the bill and was suppose to get $9.40 change on a $30.60 bill.  She tried to get a 30% tip by only giving me 40 cents after snapping the money down on the counter.  I had to remind her to give me the money after she asked me "what?" when I did not get the full change.  Needless to say, tip was very bad.  Just called to see if I left my coat and woman who answered phone said to another person "this asshole wants to know if he left his coat" so I guess they have my coat as a tip now...owner of this location needs to do something ....

7.description: Lindy's and Gertie's are well established Chicago institutions, each renowned in its own right. Lindy's has the best Chili in Chicago, in my opinion; while Gertie's, with its fantastic ice cream concoctions, is a throwback to the days of local soda shoppes. The pairing of these two has nearly unlimited potential. However, that potential goes mostly unrealized at this location. While their other locations, McKinnley Park in particular, have a certain charm, this location is in need of a rescue. The staff, in particular, needs a serious infusion of customer service skills. Fortunately, the food here is still reliably good. However, I won't be dining in anytime soon.

0.description: Pros: Store is new, clean and organized.Cons: Employees are unfriendly.

28.description: There are so many mediocre restaurants in Beverly/Morgan Park/Mt. Greenwood that I get really excited when someplace continues to meet and exceed my expectations after many visits. Fat Tommy's is one of those places.I was missing out BIG TIME for the first year or so that I lived in the area by not visiting sooner. Fat Tommy's has turned into our favorite local dog and burger shop, which is something coming from a life-long south-sider still mourning the loss of Red's. I was impressed on my first visit over a year ago, when I asked for a brisket sandwich and was told by the owner, Dan, that I couldn't have one because it wasn't "ready yet." When I learned that they smoke their own brisket, ribs, and pork butt on-site, and that the proprietor took enough pride in his food that he wouldn't serve brisket until he knew it was right, I knew there was something about the joint.The hot dogs are fantastic, better than anyplace else in the area (although I've kinda always wondered why they don't use poppyseed buns). Hand-cut fries, with the skins still on. HANDS DOWN the best cheeseburger I have ever eaten. As I mentioned, the brisket, pulled pork, and ribs are all smoked on site, and the beef is made from scratch. The Inna-Gadda-Da-Vida salad is amazing, as is their "bowl full of summer," the Fiesta del Sol salad. Soups are made on-site from scratch. Over the past nine months or so, my wife and I have become weekly customers for their Tuesday trivia, hosted by the adorable (and very smart) Nikki, which has given us an opportunity to get to know the proprietors and their dedication to good food.This place is a winner. Patio (BYOB) is awesome in the summer. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

1.description: Perfect lunch for a cold winters day.  Cup of chili with cheese, hot delicious dogs and a cold beer.  DELICIOUS!

9.description: the food is delcious, I nver have food over there that is bad, over or undercooked. the only downside is the wait for the food, but I do believe the wait more than makes up for the delicious food they make.

29.description: Fat Tommy's has become a local hangout for those looking for something fun to do on Tuesday nights - they have trivia!  For $10 a team, you can play trivia with a great group of fun people.  There are prizes - for second place you win your $10 back, and for first place, you win all of the other teams' entry fees, minus $10.  Fat Tommy's food is excellent.  They have one of the best cheeseburgers I've had, and their Philly cheesesteak sandwiches are out of this world.  Of course, the hot dogs are the main event, but don't forget the chicken, the beef, or the ice cream.  In the winter, there is home-made chili and soup too.A great, friendly neighborhood place that everyone should check out.  Great outdoor seating area in the summer.

23.description: Huge dogs this is a great place OMG big ones and they serve you!!!! this ok and great

5.description: Great spot. One of the best cheeseburgers I've had since reds was put out of business by the former aldercrook and the BAPA clowns to build the new BAC that's been in foreclosure twice.....I digress back to the food. Burgers are the bright spot, dogs are great, fresh cut fries, root beer floats, all tops. I cannot say enough good about this spot.

31.description: Great little place to grab a hot dog... or brat. I just recently tried their In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida salad.  This iron butterfly salad came with grilled chicken, nuts, veggies and a delicious raspberry vinaigrette. If you're looking for something different for lunch stop into Fat Tommy's!Also, the owner and staff over there are really nice. They've come out to events at the Beverly Arts Center and sold their delicious treats on a cart.

25.description: Good food and people, but OVERPRICED!!!!

12.description: I really try to support local businesses, but I just can't go to Fat Tommy's with Pop's being a few blocks away. Fat Tommy's is very expensive and their food is just okay. I have really tried to like their food, but I just can't.

21.description: Fresh salads, all beef dogs, milk shakes made the old school way, home-cut fries (big enough to split a basket if you dine in) and a great, personable, funny staff. If you have to wait it is because everything is made fresh and to-order. You can play checkers, read a book from their selection, watch TV, read one of the free papers they offer or snag a Chicago Reader to kill time while you wait.Beer on tap or by the bottle (nice variety for a neighborhood spot) and patio (aka beer garden) out back. SO much more than hot dogs, although a great dog is nothing to sneeze at. Air conditioning a bonus in the heat.  Their cajun chicken breast added to a salad is choice. SO lean.  A fun place to swing by, but they also do carry out. If you pay it a little more, it is for quality food and generous portions from great people. I enjoy supporting the local small businesses. Well worth it in my view. Ya want cheap and fast, there's no shortage of disappointing hot-dog dumps in the area. I'll pass and stick with these folks.Try "Fat Tommy's"....you'll like it!

16.description: First time there. I pulled up at 5 min before closing time and was waved in by the owner who was standing in the window. Couple of hot dogs for my boy, nice crisp snap on them, hand cut french fries, steak sandwich for myself. The meat was grilled perfectly and served with carmelized sweet onions and W sauce on the side and served on toasted garlic bread. There is nothing I would have done differently.Wide selection of beers and a very knowledgeable, friendly staff that makes you feel at home. Good prices.There are places that you can tell that are passionate about their product; this is one of them. Ask the owner how something is made, like something off the new smoked menu, and you're in for a great conversation. It's going to be a regular spot for me. Woohoo! As good as it gets!

17.description: Let me say first... that it is WELL WORTH the waitChicago dog was a win winDitka dog was perfectgot the loaded fries with chili and the garden.. very good home fries and fresh toppingsalso tried the onion rings.. very tastyThey had root beer on tap.. YAY!!Pleasant service and nice sit down atmosphere also.. there was a lot of families and groups there

10.description: Fresh salads, all beef dogs, milk shakes made the old school way, home-cut fries (big enough to split a basket if you dine in) and a great, personable, funny staff. If you have to wait it is because everything is made fresh and to-order. You can play checkers, read a book from their selection, watch TV, read one of the free papers they offer or snag a Chicago Reader to kill time while you wait.Beer on tap or by the bottle (nice variety for a neighborhood spot) and patio (aka beer garden) out back. SO much more than hot dogs, although a great dog is nothing to sneeze at. Air conditioning a bonus in the heat.  Their cajun chicken breast added to a salad is choice. SO lean.  A fun place to swing by, but they also do carry out. If you pay it a little more, it is for quality food and generous portions from great people. I enjoy supporting the local small businesses. Well worth it in my view. Ya want cheap and fast, there's no shortage of disappointing hot-dog dumps in the area. I'll pass and stick with these folks.Try "Fat Tommy's"....you'll like it!

11.description: Average food at a high price. Fast food at a slow pace. If you are looking for a quick bite visit somewhere else.

26.description: They now have a great beer selection and the 90+ brand of wine is phenomenal!  Nothing else has changed, they're still friendly, they still have the best hot dogs and the best garlic fries!  Check them out!  I took some pictures this time.

27.description: Meh is right.The burger and fries smelled good...unfortunately the fries were soggy and limp and the burger came with what looked like cheese sauce instead of a slice of cheddar. Overall, I've had better. I think the burger would have been better if it actually had cheese that wasn't gritty in texture and look.

0.description: Eat Here!!!A Little Expensive But That's Because Of The Top Products Used. Get Over It. This Place Is Awesome.Great Burgers And Probably The Best Fries On The Southside. The Ditka Dog Would Make Da Coach Proud.On Occasion I Tried The Pizza And They Even Do That Right. Good Crowd And One Of The Coolest Owners Of An Establishment I've Ever Had The Pleasure Of Meeting.This Places Is Aces You Won't Be Disappointed.

20.description: If you want to wait a long time for a hot dog or burger and you do not care if it is good.  Then try this place. Nice area to eat and nice beer garden. Food just not up to par.   I have seen some of the other reviews and they must be family or friends.  If you like someone you would never send them here.

19.description: After passing this place many times and seeing decent reviews, thought I would give a try.  So I gave it my hot dog test, basing a place on it's hot dogs.  The first thing that is good is that place is clean and cozy, the people running the place are very funny and nice.Like some of the other reviews said, the food is over priced and it takes forever to get your order served to you.  The bun was cold and not steamed and no poppy seeds.  The hand cut fries, which I love, were a bit over cooked.  But the worst thing was that the relish on the hot dog was so sweet it over powered the taste of the dog itself.  So every bite all you tasted was the relish.So I will continue to search the perfect hot dog stand.

2.description: I really like this place. They offer some really good food. Like pork chops and burgers. They have trivia Tuesday's. I've only gone a couple of times but everyone is super nice. One night, they were celebrating a birthday and it happened to be my birthday, so when my friend pointed it out, they all started singing to me too! Check them out. And grab a bottle of one of their wonderful import beers.

18.description: How can a hot dog be tastier at one locale than another? I don't know, but that's what Fat Tommys dogs are--tasty. I'm not one of those wackos who puts five pounds of vegetables on my dog--mustard is all I ask for--so I can really taste the meat, and it is damn good. You need to go here. It's better than any of the much ballyhooed hot dog stands up north (like the Wiener Circle) and pretty much the best thing I have had outside of Fat Johnny's.

13.description: Well if your lunch break is only 30 min long I would not recommend this place. Somehow it takes 20 min to cook a hotdog. Also, who the hell charges for a fountain drink refill. And what kind of low life charges an entire dollar for a fountain refill? They really try to shake every penny out of your pocket here. Hot dog was decent dog. Nothing memorable except for the amount of celery salt that was on it. Was way too much. Fries were real good. Overall average experience. I would expect this place to be in Skokie with how they try to shake your pennies out of your pocket. Fuck this place is basically all I can say. Overhyped average dogs.

4.description: Great Food and reasonable prices   The restaurant was very clean and the fries are out of this world. It is definitely worth a try

24.description: After passing this place many times and seeing decent reviews, thought I would give a try.  So I gave it my hot dog test, basing a place on it's hot dogs.  The first thing that is good is that place is clean and cozy, the people running the place are very funny and nice.Like some of the other reviews said, the food is over priced and it takes forever to get your order served to you.  The bun was cold and not steamed and no poppy seeds.  The hand cut fries, which I love, were a bit over cooked.  But the worst thing was that the relish on the hot dog was so sweet it over powered the taste of the dog itself.  So every bite all you tasted was the relish.So I will continue to search the perfect hot dog stand.

6.description: Might I just say... Mmm! That IS a tasty burger! Dan, the owner makes wonderful hot dogs/buyers/pork/chicken/Italian beef.. Everything is great. The best part is he is willing to personalize anything and even make recommendations if needed. I just can't get tired of the friendly service and great atmosphere.

22.description: Good food but takes way too long to get it

15.description: Real Vienna beef hot dogs. Freshly cut homemade french fries.  Solid service. Great option for greasy but delicious food. In a city with many famous hot dog spots, fat Tommie's manages to stand out.

7.description: Overpriced and inconsistent.  Service drags on and they seem to be out of ribs a lot.  It's supposed to be fast food so what's the problem. There are too many choices within a 5 minute drive to put up with this.

8.description: Can't say enough good things about this place the hot dogs are right up there with the best in the city, (gene & dudes, jimmys, portillos and so on)the brats are amazing.  The gourmet burgers are amazing, great barbecue nothing bad to say here, if you think this is just another run of the mill fast food stand your missing out

30.description: This place is now east of kedzie on 111 and whipple but it's still good!

3.description: You get what you pay for little pricey but good I'll go again people that think this is expensive are just cheap. the guy needs to make a dollar too. I got the bacon cheese burger fries it was good. Owner Dan was very nice I'm handicapped and he assisted me to my seat. I'll go here before barracos hands down.

14.description: BEST chargrilled chicken sandwich ever! Giardiniera puts it over the top. Love the fries and kids are crazy about the dogs. Friendly service and family atmosphere :)

3.description: Dr. Clodfelter is the best eye doctor I've had.  He is so nice and takes his time. I would recommend him without any reservations.  You will be satisfied.

1.description: Dr. Clodfelter is so nice. I visited him after experiencing extreme redness and pain in my eye. While I am not a regular patient, he fit me into his schedule and helped identify the problem. He put me on a medication that starting clearing up the problem right away! He then gave me his cell number and said if I experience any more issues that require immediate attention to give him a call (a courtesy he extends to every patient) regardless of time of day.His staff was very helpful and accommodating. His office is very clean and bright. I will definitely be using Dr. Clodfelter as my regular eye doctor from here on out.

2.description: Best eye doctor EVER!! Won't under sell you and is very thorough with everything he does from start to finish! This place is very reasonable in prices but of course glasses can get very expensive depending in one's taste.

0.description: I had been going to Dr Clodfelter for over 20 years and never fully appreciated the fantastic eye care he provided until I relocated and had to find a new Optometrist.The practice is extremely well run - everything goes very smoothly, from scheduling the initial appointment to picking up your glasses.  Dr C is easy to talk to and is responsive to your questions.  You won't be sorry!!!

28.description: I always get a taste for pizza on Sundays & I've wanted to try S&T for some time. So yesterday (Saturday) as I was driving by I decided to stop in. The place was crowded, probably due to Superbowl parties. I wasn't sure how to proceed, but the girls behind the counter were very helpful, she walked me through the process from start to end(it's really pretty easy.) You buy all the ingredients to bake at home. I bought the sausage pizza set up & also picked up some extra hot & garlic Irish sausage. The price was very reasonable. I then went out & bought a pizza stone( ceramic plate to cook the pizza on.) I doctored up the sauce a little, some garlic, basil, cinnamon. The pizza came out great, crisp crust, good flavor, extra cheese. I also made one with mushrooms & peppers. You get 3 set ups so you can play around with different toppings. All in all a great pizza for a great price & a lot of fun to make. If you're in the area, stop by.

1.description: Was just here for the first time in a long time today, so very disappointed. The staff here is a revolving door of rudeness. (Only stopped because my 97 year old grandfather wanted to stop in , and you can't argue with that man)Let me first explain why I haven't been frequenting here the last year. My husband and I found out from a reputable 19th ward source in Feb 2015 that this small business that we visited twice a week for almost 18 years was scamming their employees. Well, not ALL of the employees, just the hard working deli women who get our pizza set ups and bag our goods. Paid under the table and below minimum wage, these women are entitled to be rude from time to time. Their lack of smiles is not why we stopped shopping there. My husband and I are also small business owners and abide by the law and make monetary sacrifices to provide a decent wage for our employees. We cannot respect any business, especially in our very own neighborhood that doesn't do the same. We have been trying to spread the word about the shady practices of this mom and pop shop for months now. Every community event we go to, it is a topic of discussion. You can't attend anything involving Mt. Greenwood/Beverly without S&T Provisions coming up. 111th St. is something we should be proud of as a community, they have made the way they run their business a disgrace. We plan on addressing Alderman O'Shea the first chance we get. Please consider shopping elsewhere. Ask the women who work there yourself. My husband did today, and the candor he got from these women was amazing.

9.description: I have been getting the pizza setups for years. They are great for when I'm watching the family kids because they get to make the pizza themselves. These pizzas are delicious. We get the deep dish set up with sausage and it's only $15. For three large pizzas. Great for sleepovers

23.description: The pizza set ups are fun.  I wouldn't say the pizza itself is great, but the experience of making your own pizza is a fun one.For under $15 you can get the fixings for 3 pizzas, plus a ton of extras.  Their sausage is evidently the best out there.  Small parking lot next to the building can get crowded.When you walk in the store, grab a number and get in line.  It's appreciated to have your order ready by the time you're going to be helped, but the staff is great at answering your questions.  Even on a busy Saturday morning, you can be in, out and on your way in 10 minutes.

5.description: This place is terrific! I love there pizza setups and there ingredients are amazing and affordable. You get three pizza setups with sausage for around 15 bucks.

25.description: Been going here since I can ever remember with my parents (both from Mt. Greenwood).  This is the best.  You get the sausage, cheese, sauce and the pizza crust.  Totally great.  They also have amazing Polish Sausage and I am pretty sure this place is Italian.

12.description: I have been eating this pizza for as long as I could remember. The sauce, the cheese, the sausage and the pepperoni are still GREAT, just like I remember. I usual get the mini cheese pizza setups. I saw in the freezer they sell pumpkin ravioli and I am a PUMPKIN LOVER.

21.description: What S&T offers is something unique in today's world.  I speak of the "mini pizza set ups."  You can get sausage or pepperoni with your set ups - both are very good.  Everyone really enjoys making their own pizza and tossing it in the oven - about 12 minutes and YUM!  While the kids don't care for it I toss some sliced onions and green peppers on my mini-pizza.You can't go wrong trying this place out.  But don't be surprised as it's not the biggest place and it's not the fanciest place.  Additionally some of the workers "appear" not to be all that happy (maybe they are just focused on their jobs).  Regardless, I still give the place 5 stars as I haven't found anywhere else that offers something so fun and delicious!

16.description: What S&T offers is something unique in today's world.  I speak of the "mini pizza set ups."  You can get sausage or pepperoni with your set ups - both are very good.  Everyone really enjoys making their own pizza and tossing it in the oven - about 12 minutes and YUM!  While the kids don't care for it I toss some sliced onions and green peppers on my mini-pizza.You can't go wrong trying this place out.  But don't be surprised as it's not the biggest place and it's not the fanciest place.  Additionally some of the workers "appear" not to be all that happy (maybe they are just focused on their jobs).  Regardless, I still give the place 5 stars as I haven't found anywhere else that offers something so fun and delicious!

17.description: Mmmmmmeatballs! they sell a mix here that is so delicious. We (actually, my husband) make spaghetti & meatballs fairly often, and we always get the ingredients from S&T's. (Then you can make sandwiches the next day!) The prices are reasonable, too. Expect crowds, this place is popular.

10.description: Neighborhood places like these are a snapshot of the past. It is everything I remember for the past 40 years. If you don't like this place you don't like pizza. Embrace it for all its worth. I love the pizza set ups, the home made sausages of every kind, and the meat ball mix.

11.description: Pizza Setups! I didn't even know they sold anything else until last year, haha!Get some sliced Italian beef from the deli and rip it and scrunch it into little hunks with some hot giardiniera and put it on the pizza. You will thank me later.

26.description: Their pizza set ups beat most pizza places I've been to.  Their sausage and meatballs are also the best in the area for sure.I dont know if they still have this going but a few years back there was a shack like building attached to the back of the store (alley front) that should cooked food.  If they still do this the meatball sandwiches I used to get from there (used S&T meatball mix) was the best I've eaten.  I'll check it out in a couple of weeks when I get back to Chicago and give an update.

27.description: This place has the absolute best homemade pizza ingredients. Also, it has the best Meatball Mix in the whole wide world.

0.description: How have I not reviewed this place yet?S&T pizza set ups. Simply....perfection!So much fun for a kid sleep over. So much fun for a family party. So much fun for a regular Friday family game night...... You each get to make your own pizza however you want them. The crusts are thin, the sauce is superb. The meatball mix is fresh. Love it. All the way, love it.

20.description: All I can say about this place is, AWESOME pizza set ups!

19.description: The pizza set ups are fun.  I wouldn't say the pizza itself is great, but the experience of making your own pizza is a fun one.For under $15 you can get the fixings for 3 pizzas, plus a ton of extras.  Their sausage is evidently the best out there.  Small parking lot next to the building can get crowded.When you walk in the store, grab a number and get in line.  It's appreciated to have your order ready by the time you're going to be helped, but the staff is great at answering your questions.  Even on a busy Saturday morning, you can be in, out and on your way in 10 minutes.

2.description: I love this place.   It is a hidden gem from the past.   Buy everything you need to make your own pizza at home.   We buy the setups and freeze them.   We can have awesome, delicious pizzas in 20 minutes.Try it!

18.description: Great meatballs and pizza set-ups. Love this place!

13.description: If I could give more stars I would. L love this place. Brings up all good memories as a kid. Love the pizza set ups.

4.description: The staff here is rude and the food is all freezer food that while a cut above the freezer section is not really worth making the extra effort to get here. The meatballs were mediocre as was the marinara sauce. Unless you have been going here since you were a kid, there is no reason to come here unless you want to check out the cool neon sign. Careful out front. There is a speeding camera. Not worth the trip.

24.description: Due to my dad loving this place I ate these pizzas 90% of fridays from childhood to young adulthood. "Its pizza friday, woo!"This is the best pizza I've had to date! The fact that you make it yourself is wonderful. I bought a pizza set-up for superbowl this year. 3 pizzas for $13.99. Absolutely wonderful. They also sell personal size. Perfect if you're having a kids party. Each kid makes their own pizza!

6.description: Love love love this place!! My parents have been going here as long as I can remember so naturally my brother, sister and I have been going there and passing on the tradition to our kids. Everything is great! I moved about an hour away and make the trip every couple of months and stock up. The pizza set ups freeze great as well as everything else I've bought there. I like to buy the mini pizzas for my kids sleepovers....they enjoy making their own pizzas with their friends. I'm a good cook and have had people tell me numerous times I need my own restaurant... With that being said I'd like to say I don't know why other reviewers are calling it freezer food. Yes, a lot of it freezes beautifully but it definitely is better than an encore meal. It makes a delicious weekday dinner possible in between my kids busy sports schedule when I only have 20 minutes and it's priced fairly. I've been there I'm sure over 100 times in my lifetime and the staff has always been great. 90% of the time they are swamped and may be less chatty and just trying to get the line moving but have never been rude. They are just trying to get you your order and move onto the next person in line. I don't know about anyone else but I'd rather get my stuff and get moving rather than sit there chatting about the weather and having them make you feel warm and fuzzy.  They're too busy to kiss your *ss people , get over it!

22.description: I went once and it was o.k. but everyone said it was so good and i went back. This place the second time around sucked more than the first. I've been going to Rosario's for pizza set-ups for years and they make s&t look like crap. I will never be back!!!

15.description: I love the Irish Garlic sausages.  I drive very far from western suburbs to S & T's to pick up several pounds of irish garlic and pizza puffs.  I have not tried the set-up pizza yet, but will have to.

7.description: So a few years ago we go to my Nephew's house and his Son is making a Pizza, he is 3 or 4 years old, the pizza goes in the oven 15-20 min later we are eating one of the best pizzas we have ever eaten, they tell us It's a pizza set up,a what?My Husband is a pizza fanatic, so we go and get a 3pack sausage set up, I make it with a few additional ing.(no need ) IT WAS ABSOLUTELY SUPERB, my kids love it, everyone that has ever tried it wants to know where it came from, Just had 2 this weekend and my Hubby ate 1 by himself, Thanks S&T we love you and will spread the word and your pizza to everyone we know...

8.description: I had their roast beef and mosataccoli that someone brought to a party and I really liked it awhile ago. I just visited it for the first time with my sister in law today - she had never been there either.  The staff was VERY rude. Two different women took our order and when we told them our orders were together they both very obviously rolled their eyes and acted like we had demanded the world from them. Especially since I had told the woman it was my first time there you would think she would want to make sure I had a good experience. Nope. Very snobby.When we got to my sister in laws house we told my brother what happened. He wondered why we hadn't just walked out. Well we're fat and didn't think of that but I wish we had. We regret spending our time and money on half decent freezer food. Don't go. Not worth it.

3.description: Two words. PiZZA. SETUPS.Of course there is sausage, beef, meat ball mix and sauce.  Good spot. Check it out sometime.

14.description: I love S&T pizza set ups.  In case you don't have the directions, here they are.  Pre-heat a pizza stone at 400 degrees.  Pop it in the oven for 18 minutes.  If you are using a regular baking sheet, no need to pre-heat.  Cook it for 18-20 minutes at 400 degrees.
